name: EYE OF THE BEHOLDER
message:
Take a picture and transform the scene into the visual language of the classic Twilight Zone episode 'Eye of the Beholder.'

SUBJECT COUNT DETERMINATION (CRITICAL — FIRST STEP):
• First, determine how many human subjects are visible in the image
• All transformation logic must strictly follow the correct branch below

BRANCH A — SINGLE SUBJECT ONLY (HARD RULE):
• If ONLY ONE subject is visible:
  – That subject MUST be transformed into one of the grotesque 'normal' citizens of this world
  – The subject must NOT appear conventionally human
  – Do NOT introduce additional figures, silhouettes, or background characters
  – The world’s definition of 'normal' must be expressed solely through the subject’s grotesque features

BRANCH B — MULTIPLE SUBJECTS PRESENT:
• If MULTIPLE subjects are visible:
  – EXACTLY ONE subject must appear genuinely normal and conventionally human
  – ALL OTHER subjects must appear as the grotesque 'normal' citizens
  – The grotesque subjects must treat the human-looking subject as abnormal

DISGUST & GAZE INVERSION (MULTI-SUBJECT ONLY):
• Grotesque subjects must look at the human subject with disgust or moral judgment
• Body language should reinforce rejection and dominance
• The human subject should appear isolated or vulnerable

FACIAL TRANSFORMATION (GROTESQUE SUBJECTS):
• Distorted facial symmetry
• Heavy prosthetic-like features
• Flattened or exaggerated noses, uneven cheeks, misshapen mouths
• Features must resemble layered latex appliances — not monsters or fantasy creatures

FACIAL TREATMENT (TRULY NORMAL SUBJECT — MULTI-SUBJECT ONLY):
• Minimal or no distortion
• Clean, human proportions
• Lighting contrast used to emphasize social rejection

STYLE & MEDIUM:
• High-contrast black-and-white
• Film grain, soft focus, and 1960s television texture
• No color

LIGHTING & CAMERA:
• Stark shadows and oppressive, institutional lighting
• Dramatic angles reinforcing power imbalance

TONE:
• Serious, unsettling, restrained
• No humor, no parody

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must look like an authentic frame from a 1960s Twilight Zone episode. In single-subject images, the lone subject must appear as one of the grotesque 'normal' citizens. In multi-subject images, grotesque citizens must visibly judge and reject the lone human-looking subject. The logic branches must never overlap.

name: FAIR RIDE
message: Take a picture and place the subject riding a carnival or amusement park ride with dynamic action and excitement.

options.text: Ferris Wheel - seated in gondola at top of giant wheel, panoramic view of fairgrounds below, sunset lighting, romantic nostalgic atmosphere
Roller Coaster - hands up, mid-drop on steep descent, speed motion blur, screaming expression, track visible, thrilling moment
Carousel/Merry-Go-Round - riding ornate painted horse, mirrors and lights, calliope music atmosphere, up-and-down motion, vintage charm
Bumper Cars - driving colorful bumper car, collision moment, electrical sparks overhead, laughing expression, carnival chaos
Tilt-A-Whirl - spinning cup ride, centrifugal force, dizzy expression, motion blur suggesting rotation, colorful spinning cars
Pirate Ship - swinging pendulum ride at peak height, weightless moment, gripping safety bar, crowd below visible
Gravitron/Round Up - pinned to wall by centrifugal force, UFO-shaped ride, floor drops away, stuck to padded wall, spinning motion
Drop Tower - free-fall moment, hands up, terrified/excited expression, tower rising high above fairgrounds, rapid descent
Scrambler - spinning and rotating simultaneously, arms extended, multiple colored cars visible, dizzying circular motion
Swing Ride/Wave Swinger - suspended on chains, flying outward, carnival lights below, elevated circular motion, feet dangling
Haunted House/Dark Ride - in cart going through spooky scenes, monsters jumping out, scared expression, darkness with dramatic lighting
Log Flume - in log boat, big splash moment at bottom of water drop, soaked, arms up, water spray everywhere
Spinning Tea Cups - in oversized tea cup, spinning the center wheel, dizzy laughing, pastel colors, Mad Hatter theme
Octopus Ride - in rotating arm that spins and lifts, multiple arms visible, colorful lights, evening carnival atmosphere
Zipper - enclosed cage flipping end-over-end, upside down moment, extreme thrill ride, vintage carnival aesthetic
Funhouse - in mirror maze or tilted room, distorted reflections, disorienting perspective, laughing barrel, classic carnival funhouse
Roller Coaster Loop - upside down in loop-de-loop, inverted, G-forces, intense moment, track curving overhead
Balloon Race - in hot air balloon basket carnival ride, gentle floating, colorful balloon envelope above, peaceful height
Wild Mouse - sharp turn on small roller coaster, car tipping to side, jerky motion, compact track visible, surprise elements
Slingshot/Reverse Bungee - elastic launch straight up, acceleration moment, screaming, compressed in seat, rapid vertical motion

name: FAIRY
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a magical fairy while preserving their recognizable facial features and identity.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• Subject becomes a fairy with magical features added
• IDENTITY PRESERVATION IS PARAMOUNT - face must remain clearly recognizable
• Tiny fairy size (6 inches to 1 foot tall)
• Delicate wings and ethereal qualities
• Subject's unique facial features completely preserved
• This is the subject AS a fairy, not a generic fairy replacement

IDENTITY RULES (HIGHEST PRIORITY):
• Subject's face MUST be immediately recognizable
• Preserve exact facial structure, proportions, and features
• Keep subject's natural eye shape, color, and expression
• Maintain subject's nose shape and size
• Keep subject's mouth, lips, and smile exactly as they are
• Preserve subject's natural skin tone (just add subtle glow)
• Keep subject's bone structure and face shape identical
• Subject's hair color and style preserved (may add flowers/natural elements)
• NO altering facial features to look "more fairy-like"
• Think: "This is subject who happens to be a fairy"

FAIRY ENHANCEMENTS:
• Pointed ears (ADD to existing ears)
• Subtle natural glow to skin (enhancement, not change)
• Slightly luminous quality to eyes (keep natural eye color)
• Delicate sparkle effect on skin (like makeup, not transformation)
• Keep natural human facial proportions
• Wings added to back (not changing body)
• Tiny size scale but face stays recognizable

WINGS (ADDED FEATURE):
• Large translucent wings sprouting from back
• Iridescent, shimmering membrane
• Delicate vein structure visible
• Wing Style Variants:
 – Butterfly wings (colorful, patterned)
 – Dragonfly wings (transparent, delicate)
 – Moth wings (soft, feathered edges)
 – Unique fairy wings (crystalline, flower-petal)
• Wings catch and reflect light beautifully
• Gossamer thin and magical
• Natural integration with body

FAIRY VARIANT (SEED-DRIVEN — SELECT EXACTLY ONE):
• Spring Flower Fairy:
 – Pastel colors (pink, lavender, soft yellow)
 – Flower petal dress (rose, daisy, cherry blossom)
 – Butterfly or flower-petal wings
 – Sitting on or among blooming flowers
 – Fresh, joyful expression
 – Morning sunlight, dewdrops
• Summer Garden Fairy:
 – Bright vibrant colors (emerald, gold, sky blue)
 – Leaf and petal clothing
 – Dragonfly wings (iridescent, transparent)
 – Perched on sunflower or garden bloom
 – Warm, playful expression
 – Sunny garden setting, bees and butterflies nearby
• Autumn Woodland Fairy:
 – Warm autumn colors (amber, copper, russet)
 – Oak leaf or maple leaf dress
 – Moth-like wings with autumn patterns
 – On mushroom or fallen acorn
 – Cozy, wise expression
 – Forest floor, falling leaves, golden light
• Winter Frost Fairy:
 – Cool icy colors (silver, white, pale blue)
 – Crystalline or snowflake dress
 – Crystal-like transparent wings
 – On pine branch or icicle
 – Serene, magical expression
 – Snowy setting, frost, starlight
• Forest Guardian Fairy:
 – Earth tones (moss green, bark brown, forest green)
 – Moss and fern clothing
 – Leaf-like wings with nature patterns
 – In tree hollow or on ancient branch
 – Protective, gentle expression
 – Deep forest, magical glow, fireflies
• Night Moon Fairy:
 – Dark mystical colors (midnight blue, silver, purple)
 – Night-blooming flower petals
 – Luna moth wings (pale green, moon-like)
 – On moonlit branch or night flower
 – Mysterious, enchanting expression
 – Moonlight, stars, bioluminescent fungi

BODY TRANSFORMATION (SUBTLE):
• Subject scaled down to 6-12 inches tall
• Delicate proportions but recognizable body type
• Graceful posture and movement
• Subject's natural build preserved at tiny scale
• Barefoot with delicate feet
• Natural elegance in pose

CLOTHING:
• Natural materials matching variant:
 – Flower petals (rose, daisy, lily)
 – Leaves (oak, maple, fern)
 – Spider silk and gossamer
 – Moss and lichen
• Simple elegant fairy dress or tunic
• Colors match seasonal variant
• Flowing, lightweight fabric
• Organic and handmade appearance
• May include tiny vine belt or flower crown

HAIR STYLING:
• Subject's natural hair color and texture
• Flowing and natural movement
• May include woven flowers, small leaves, or vine accents
• Crowned with seasonal flowers matching variant
• Loose, free-flowing style
• Natural and untamed but beautiful

SIZE & SCALE (CRITICAL):
• Fairy is tiny - 6 to 12 inches tall maximum
• Show clear scale comparison:
 – Sitting on large mushroom
 – Perched on human hand
 – On flower bloom (flower appears huge)
 – On tree branch (subject very small)
 – Next to normal-sized object for reference
• Environment appears massive around fairy
• Camera angle emphasizes tiny scale

SETTING OPTIONS:
• Enchanted forest glade with giant flowers
• Garden with oversized blooms and vegetation
• Mushroom fairy ring
• Tree hollow entrance (miniature door optional)
• Dewy meadow at dawn or dusk
• Magical woodland with bioluminescent elements
• Riverside with water droplets as large as fairy
• Inside flower bloom

MAGICAL ATMOSPHERE:
• Soft magical glow in environment
• Fairy dust or sparkles around wings when moving
• Bioluminescent elements (fireflies, glowing mushrooms)
• Floating particles of light
• Enchanted dreamlike quality
• Natural and magical harmoniously combined
• Bokeh effects from magical lights

LIGHTING:
• Soft, dreamy natural light
• Golden hour glow or dappled forest light
• Moonlight for night variants
• Magical ambient glow
• Dewdrops catching light
• Backlit wings showing translucency
• Warm and inviting atmosphere

COLOR PALETTE:
• Natural colors from chosen variant
• Soft pastels or rich nature tones
• Iridescent shimmer on wings
• Complementary environment colors
• Magical glow effects
• Natural saturation, not oversaturated

CAMERA:
• Macro photography perspective
• Fairy clearly in focus
• Shallow depth of field (blurred background)
• Eye-level with fairy or slightly below
• Scale clearly communicated
• Intimate, magical framing

OPTIONAL MAGICAL ELEMENTS:
• Tiny glowing fairy lights floating nearby
• Dewdrops with rainbow reflections
• Friendly small creatures (ladybugs, butterflies at scale)
• Magical flower blooms opening
• Sparkles trailing from wing movement
• Tiny mushroom village in background
• Spider silk catching light
• Morning mist with magical quality

RESTRICTIONS:
• NO generic fairy face - MUST be recognizable as subject
• NO enlarging eyes beyond natural proportions
• NO changing subject's unique facial features
• NO replacing subject's face with idealized fairy features
• NO cartoon or illustrated style (photorealistic)
• NO costume appearance (real transformation)
• NO text overlays or captions
• NO overly exaggerated proportions
• Subject's humanity and identity preserved despite magical changes

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject clearly recognizable as themselves, transformed into a tiny magical fairy. Their face, expression, and identity remain unmistakably theirs, but they now have delicate fairy wings, pointed ears, and exist at a miniature scale in an enchanted natural setting. The viewer should think "That's [subject] as a fairy!" not "That's a generic fairy." The transformation adds magical elements without erasing the subject's identity - they remain themselves in a magical form.

name: FAIRY HUMOR
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a fairy while preserving their identity and realism.

ABSOLUTE TRANSFORMATION REQUIREMENTS (NON-NEGOTIABLE):
• The subject MUST be a fairy
• The subject MUST have visible fairy wings
• The subject MUST be wearing a tutu
• Wings and tutu must be clearly visible in the final image
• If wings or tutu are missing, the result is INVALID

FAIRY DESIGN RULES:
• Wings should be translucent, delicate, and attached naturally to the back
• Wings must cast appropriate shadows and catch light realistically
• The tutu must be a classic ballet-style tutu
• The tutu must fit the subject’s body correctly

GENDER HANDLING:
• Do NOT change the subject’s gender
• Do NOT feminize male facial features
• Do NOT masculinize female facial features
• Humor (if present) must come ONLY from contrast, not caricature

TONE CONTROL:
• If the subject is male:
  – The result should feel humorous through contrast
  – The subject remains confident and normal
• If the subject is female:
  – The result should feel natural and graceful
  – No exaggerated comedy

REALISM CONSTRAINTS:
• Maintain photographic lighting, shadows, and textures
• No cartoon or animated styles
• No fantasy glow, sparkles, or magical effects unless subtle and realistic

POSE & EXPRESSION:
• Subject acts completely normal
• No exaggerated fairy poses
• No winking, flying, or floating
• Feet remain on the ground

FINAL RESULT:
The image must look like a real photograph of a person who happens to be a fairy, clearly wearing a tutu and wings — grounded, believable, and quietly funny when unexpected.

name: FAIRYTALE PAGE
message: Take a picture and make it into a page from a magical children fairytale book. Like a page pulled from a magical tale, a whimsical world of castles, forests, and enchanted creatures. Soft textures, rich colors, and fairytale-like details giving the image a dreamy, otherworldly feel.  The result should be a full view of the page with a relevant background behind the page.

name: FAIRYTALE MORAL
message: Take a picture and transform it into an illustrated fairytale moral or fable lesson. Depict the subject as the central figure in a symbolic, storybook-style scene. Generate a short moral or lesson written beneath or beside the illustration using flavor text inspired by the subject’s appearance, actions, or surroundings, incorporating any externally provided details naturally. The moral should read like a classic fable conclusion. Ensure all text is clearly visible. The overall tone should feel whimsical, wise, and timeless.  The result should be a full view of the illustration with a relevant background behind the illustration.

name: FAMILY GUY
message:
Take a picture in the style of a Family Guy cartoon scene, with simple shapes, clean lines, bold colors, and exaggerated features. Preserve the subject’s recognizable facial identity in the Family Guy style.

The subject must be the main character, but include other Family Guy characters in the scene interacting naturally — they can be Griffin family members, neighbors, or recurring secondary characters.

Backgrounds should reflect typical Family Guy settings: living room, Quahog streets, Drunken Clam, or other show locations. Ensure proper perspective and consistency with the show’s signature look.

The final image should look like a fully integrated Family Guy world with the subject seamlessly placed among other characters, maintaining the show’s humor, proportions, and visual style.

name: FALLOUT
message:
Take a picture and place the subject directly into the Fallout video game world.

CHARACTER TYPE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a character type, USE THAT CHARACTER TYPE
• If no character type is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE type using the RANDOM SEED
• This MUST be a true 50/50 random selection - flip a mental coin
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in an EVEN number (0,2,4,6,8): SELECT Vault Dweller
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in an ODD number (1,3,5,7,9): SELECT Ghoul
• Do not reuse the same type across renders
• This selection MUST occur before evaluating the subject's appearance
• Do NOT bias toward Ghoul for visual interest, detail, or drama
• Vault Dweller is NOT a fallback option
• VAULT DWELLER IS EQUALLY IMPORTANT AND ICONIC

If Vault Dweller:
• Dress the subject in an iconic bright blue-and-yellow Vault-Tec jumpsuit with visible vault number (Vault 101, 76, or 13)
• Equip a detailed Pip-Boy 3000 on left forearm with glowing green monochrome screen showing SPECIAL stats or map
• Style hair in clean 1950s retro cut - pompadour for men, victory rolls for women
• Place in iconic Vault location: vault door entrance with massive gear mechanism, vault cafeteria with propaganda posters, vault corridor with yellow and blue striping, or outside vault emerging into wasteland
• Include Vault-Tec branding, vintage computers with green screens, retro-futuristic technology
• Clean, heroic, adventurer aesthetic - the vault dweller is the PROTAGONIST
• Lighting: clean vault lighting with slight blue tint, or dramatic backlit vault door silhouette
• This is the ICONIC Fallout protagonist look - emphasize the retro-futuristic adventure hero aesthetic

If Ghoul:
• Severe radiation damage with leathery, cracked skin
• Collapsed nasal cartilage — the nose must be partially or completely missing, leaving a visible hole
• Exposed teeth, sunken eyes, asymmetrical facial damage
• Clothing is scavenged, pre-war, and deteriorated
• Subject must remain recognizable despite damage
• Place in post-apocalyptic wasteland: ruined buildings, irradiated zones, abandoned gas stations, or ghoul settlements
• Include radiation barrels, glowing debris, decrepit pre-war signage
• Weathered, survivor aesthetic with visible decay but determination

ENVIRONMENT & ART DIRECTION (CRITICAL):
• Must visually match Fallout game art — not generic post-apocalypse
• 1950s retro-futurism, satirical Americana, Vault-Tec propaganda
• Nuka-Cola branding, radiation barrels, Pip-Boy tech, weathered signage
• Color grading: greenish tint, high contrast, slight comic-book realism
• Lighting should feel stylized, not cinematic

The final image must be immediately recognizable as Fallout — not just a ruined world.

name: FAMILY CREST
message:
Take a picture of the subject and turn them into the centerpiece of a grand family crest or coat of arms.

Place the subject’s face in the center of a shield surrounded by decorative symbols, banners, and icons that humorously represent their personality, habits, or interests.

The crest should include ornate scrollwork, ribbons, and classic heraldic styling.

Use external master prompt text, if provided, to influence the motto, symbols, or family name.

The final image should look like a serious, medieval-style coat of arms, but with silly or absurd details that make it funny.

name: FAMILY HOLIDAY PHOTO
message:
Take a picture and transform it into an awkward family holiday photo from the late 1980s or early 1990s.

Select a holiday automatically at random (e.g., Christmas, Thanksgiving, Easter, Halloween, Valentine’s Day, Fourth of July, New Year’s, or another widely recognized holiday), OR use a specific holiday provided via external master prompt.

The image should look like a staged holiday portrait taken with an on-camera flash: flat lighting, slight red-eye, soft focus, mild film grain, and dated color tones. The setting should feel like a living room or photo studio decorated for the chosen holiday.

Include classic, slightly tacky holiday decorations appropriate to the selected holiday. Decorations should feel excessive, mismatched, or unevenly arranged (e.g., too many balloons, awkward banners, cheap props, cluttered tables, or off-theme color combinations).

Dress all subjects in era-appropriate holiday clothing that clashes or feels uncomfortable. Examples include ugly sweaters, oversized cardigans, patterned vests, turtlenecks, stiff dresses, themed novelty outfits, or poorly coordinated formalwear. Hairstyles should be dated and awkward: big teased hair, perms, mullets, bowl cuts, feathered bangs, or obvious hairspray volume.

Subject logic:
• If there is ONE subject, surround them with added family members (parents, siblings, or relatives) who look mismatched or emotionally disconnected.
• If there are MULTIPLE subjects, present them as a family group standing or sitting closely together.

Body language should feel tense or unnatural: forced smiles, blank stares, crossed arms, stiff posture, uneven spacing, or someone clearly looking away from the camera. Not everyone should appear happy at the same time.

Optionally include a dated holiday banner, sign, or photo caption naming the holiday and year (use external master prompt text if provided; otherwise invent a plausible holiday label and year).

Ensure the entire photo is fully visible within the frame, like a complete printed holiday portrait. The final image should feel uncomfortably nostalgic, unintentionally funny, and instantly recognizable as an awkward family holiday photo — clearly readable on a small screen.

name: FAR SIDE
message: Take a picture and place the subject into a classic Far Side cartoon.

options.text: Cows standing upright, one yells "Car!" as they drop to all fours
Dog at piano thinking "I can do this" while owner watches
Scientists in lab with "Bummer of a birthmark, Hal" snake-shaped mark
Dinosaurs smoking, meteor approaching: "That's going to cause some excitement"
Polar bears waiting by igloo: "I just love these things"
Hell's library - only has one book over and over
Deer with target on chest: "Bummer"
Dogs at poker table, one has five aces
Chicken crossing road, psychologist asks why
Scientist in jungle: "I've got to remember this moment"
Amoeba family dinner, mom says "No dessert until you split"
School for the Gifted - kid pushing "PULL" door
Boneless chicken ranch
Cat with "Kick me" sign, owner puzzled
Primitive tribesmen with shrunken head shop
Midvale School for the Gifted - pushing on pull door
Elephant in living room, everyone ignoring it
God at computer creating Earth: "Oh no... I just put fleas on the dog"
Institute for the Study of Migraine Headaches - all workers have migraine
Primitive cave: "I paint, therefore I am"
Duck hunters in blind, ducks have "DECOY" sign
Cats forming plans to assassinate humans
"If we pull this off, we'll eat like kings" - roaches at table
Dog heaven: "The cats are over there"
Frankenstein at job interview: "What's that on your neck?"
"Same time tomorrow?" - therapy for paranoid
Primitive man: "Thag invent wheel!" - square wheel
Hell's video store - only has "Ishtar"
"Testing whether lemmings really do follow each other" - scientist
Shark party: "Is Steve here? I smell blood"
Primitive language school: "Thag know verb"
"The picture's pretty bleak, gentlemen" - goldfish meet
Wolf in sheep's clothing caught at X-ray machine
"Don't be afraid, Jimmy... it's just a dream about algebra"
Cows cutting up human steaks

name: FAST FOOD MASCOT
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a fast food restaurant mascot while retaining the subject's facial characteristics.

options.text: Ronald McDonald - red and white striped shirt, yellow jumpsuit, big red shoes, red yarn hair, white face paint, big smile
The Burger King - oversized King mask/head, royal robe, crown, creepy frozen smile (subject's face AS the King)
Colonel Sanders - white suit, black string tie, white goatee and hair, glasses, Southern gentleman, holding bucket
Wendy - red hair in pigtails, blue dress with white collar, freckles, smiling friendly girl (subject with these features)
Jack from Jack in the Box - round clown head, yellow hat, red nose, business suit body, drive-thru intercom
Chick-fil-A Cow - black and white cow costume, holding "Eat Mor Chikin" sign, comedic spelling, Holstein spots
Little Caesars Guy - toga, laurel wreath, holding pizza spear, Roman emperor style, orange and red colors
Arby's Oven Mitt - subject dressed as or holding giant oven mitt, "We Have The Meats" theme
Sonic Drive-In Guys - two subjects as comedy duo, casual attire, sitting in car, witty banter energy
Dairy Queen - subject as ice cream treat mascot or vintage DQ girl, soft-serve swirl theme

name: FATE BOOK
message: Take a picture and transform it into a dramatic illustrated page from an ancient Book of Fate or Destiny. Present the subject as the central figure of a foretold prophecy, depicted in a mythic or symbolic scene that reflects their appearance, posture, and personality. Surround the subject with aged parchment textures, arcane symbols, constellations, or subtle mystical motifs. Generate a short prophecy-style passage written in poetic language inspired by the subject’s visual traits and surroundings, incorporating any externally provided details naturally. Ensure the entire prophecy text is fully visible and integrated into the page design. The final image should resemble a sacred manuscript or legendary tome, with cinematic lighting, rich detail, and an epic, timeless atmosphere.  The result should be a full view of the page with a relevant background behind the page.

name: FAUVISM
message: Take a picture and transform the image into Fauvist style painting. Intense, vivid colors, simplified forms, and expressive brushwork while keeping the subject identifiable.

name: FAX MACHINE COPY
message:
Take a picture and transform it into an authentic single-page fax machine transmission from the 1980s–1990s.

The final image must look like a full sheet of faxed paper viewed flat and fully visible within the frame, including margins, header, and body. Do not crop the page.

Apply classic fax artifacts: harsh black-and-white contrast, dithering, streaking scan lines, slight skew, uneven toner density, paper curl shadows, compression noise, and faint horizontal banding. The subject should appear embedded within the faxed image area and degraded but still identifiable.

At the top of the page, include a standard fax cover header with the following sections, all rendered in simple monospace or office-style fonts and visibly degraded:

• **From (Sender):** A humorous sender name, company, fax number, and phone number inspired by the subject’s appearance, clothing, posture, or environment (e.g., "Gary from Accounting," "Dept. of Snacks," "Fax: 555-0199").
• **To (Recipient):** A humorous recipient name, organization, and fax number, derived from scene context or absurd office logic.
• **Date:** A plausible transmission date (can be generic or stylized).
• **Subject / Re:** A short, funny description of the fax contents based on the subject or scene (e.g., "Urgent: Hat Situation," "Re: Chair Malfunction Update").
• **Pages:** Include a page count such as "1 of 1".

Below the header, include a **Confidentiality Notice** in small text, written humorously but styled like a real legal disclaimer (e.g., warning unintended recipients to destroy the fax immediately or consult a supervisor named something absurd).

All names, numbers, and text must be fictional, non-sensitive, and clearly comedic. If external master prompt text is provided, use it to override or guide sender, recipient, subject line, or tone.

Ensure the overall result unmistakably resembles a real faxed document rather than a modern filter. The page should feel outdated, bureaucratic, slightly ridiculous, and clearly readable on a small screen.

name: FAZZINO POP ART
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a vibrant 3D layered pop art composition with multiple raised paper-cut levels creating extreme visual depth at miniature scale.

Style characteristics: Ultra-bright saturated colors with bold black outlines, flat color fills with minimal shading, playful exaggerated proportions and perspectives. The aesthetic should resemble colorful painted cardstock or screen-printed paper sheets stacked at different heights, rendered with realistic miniature scale and physical dimensionality.

Layering structure: Divide the scene into at least 5-7 distinct depth levels with strong cast shadows between each layer emphasizing the sculptural three-dimensional quality.

CRITICAL - PACK THE SCENE WITH MINIATURES: Fill every inch of the composition with abundant miniature elements densely arranged: tiny buildings with architectural details, miniature cars and vehicles, small-scale people figures, street signs, storefronts, windows, decorative patterns, architectural ornaments, repeating shapes, whimsical embellishments, busy textures, trees, street lamps, and countless playful visual elements. The scene should feel like a bustling miniature cityscape or metropolitan diorama with an overwhelming joyful abundance of tiny detailed objects all bunched together. No empty space - every area should be filled with miniature sculptural elements.

The diorama MUST be constructed exclusively from elements present in the actual photographed scenery OR the location explicitly specified in the master prompt.

DO NOT invent a different city, skyline, or landmarks.

If the subject is in Miami, the diorama must reflect Miami.
If Las Vegas, Las Vegas.
If no location is provided, use ONLY the visible environment from the original image.

All buildings, streets, signage, vehicles, and scenery must be derived from the real environment and reinterpreted in layered, sculptural form.

The subject MUST appear as a FULL miniature human figure within the diorama — even if only a torso, head, or partial body was visible in the original photo.

The subject should be scaled down appropriately and integrated into the environment like a physical figurine.

Use layered depth, bright colors, paper-cut textures, stacked elements, and playful perspective.

The final image must look like a physical 3D pop-art diorama constructed from the real location — not a generic city illustration.

CRITICAL - SUBJECT SCALE: Transform the subject into a three-dimensional miniature figure within this densely packed layered diorama at the EXACT SAME SMALL SCALE as all other miniature elements. The subject must be proportionally sized to match the tiny buildings, miniature cars, and small people figures surrounding them - NOT larger or more prominent. If buildings are 2-3 inches tall in the miniature scene, the subject figure should be appropriately scaled (roughly 1 inch or smaller if representing a person). The subject should appear as ONE SMALL ELEMENT among many in the busy cityscape, not dominating the composition. They must have physical depth and dimension like a detailed figurine, integrated naturally among all other miniatures at consistent scale.

The final result should look like a physical framed miniature diorama or shadow box photographed straight-on, showcasing vibrant metropolitan energy with extreme visual depth, realistic three-dimensional construction, CONSISTENT miniature scale throughout with the subject properly sized to match all surrounding elements, overwhelming joyful abundance of densely packed tiny details, and clear dimensional separation between layers. Everything - including the subject - should appear as real miniature sculptural objects at the same small scale, bunched together in a busy, celebratory cityscape.

name: FELT PUPPET
message: Take a picture and transform the image into a felt puppet scene. Soft fabric textures, handcrafted appearance.

name: FESTIVE-ALL!
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a participant in a famous festival anywhere in the world.

FESTIVAL SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a festival, USE THAT FESTIVAL
• If no festival is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE festival using the RANDOM SEED
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 0,1: SELECT La Tomatina (Spain) - tomato-slinging streets
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 2,3: SELECT Holi (India) - color powders thrown across crowds
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 4,5: SELECT Songkran Festival (Thailand) - water guns and hoses splashing
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 6,7: SELECT Battle of the Oranges (Italy) - teams throwing oranges
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 8: SELECT Belize Carnival - painting water eggs and flour with music and dancing
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 9: SELECT Boryeong Mud Festival (South Korea) - mud slides baths and playful activities

Ensure the subject is fully integrated into the scene, participating actively in the festival. Include environmental cues, textures (tomatoes, colored powder, water splashes, mud, oranges), and festival-specific props or costumes. Preserve realistic lighting, motion, and perspective, creating an immersive festival atmosphere.

name: FEUDAL JAPAN
message: Take a picture and place the subject in feudal Japan as a samurai. Preserve facial identity and physique. Authentic armor, period setting, cinematic lighting.

name: FIELD GUIDE
message: Take a picture and transform it into a field guide page. Include a clear photograph of the subject as the main reference image, labeled as a specimen photo. Add a species name (real or humorous), habitat, behavior notes, and identifying traits. Use the visual style of a naturalist’s guidebook. The photograph should appear as a documented observation supporting the entry.

name: FIFTH BEATLE
message: Take a picture and insert the subject as the fifth member of The Beatles in one of their iconic photographs.

options.text: ABBEY ROAD CROSSING: Place the subject walking in line with the four Beatles across the zebra crossing on Abbey Road. The subject should be dressed in period-appropriate 1969 clothing (suit, casual wear, or barefoot like one member). Match the walking stride and positioning. Background shows the tree-lined London street.

COLORFUL MILITARY COSTUMES: Place the subject alongside the band wearing vibrant, elaborate military-inspired costume from 1967. Include ornate jacket with decorative elements, bright colors (pink, yellow, orange, blue), psychedelic era styling. Subject should be posed with the group in formal portrait arrangement.

BEACH SCENE: Insert the subject playing in the ocean waves with the band at a beach. Everyone should be in 1964 swimwear or casual beach clothes, splashing in water, showing youthful energy and joy. Bright sunny beach setting.

EARLY CLUB PERFORMANCE: Place the subject on stage with the band in a small underground club setting. Everyone wearing matching suits with narrow ties, distinctive 1960s hairstyles (mop-top or similar period style). Instruments visible, intimate venue with brick walls and low ceiling. Black and white or slightly muted color photography.

AIRPORT ARRIVAL: Insert the subject descending airplane stairs or in terminal with the band, surrounded by crowds of fans and press photographers. Everyone wearing sharp matching suits, waving to camera. 1960s airport setting with vintage aircraft visible. Capture the excitement and chaos of fan mania.

name: FIFTY-FIRST STATE
message: Take a picture and place the subject in a major city representing one of Canada's provinces or territories.

options.text: Ontario (Toronto - CN Tower, Niagara Falls, Parliament Hill, provincial bird: Common Loon)
Quebec (Montreal/Quebec City - Old Quebec, French culture, poutine, provincial bird: Snowy Owl)
British Columbia (Vancouver - mountains, Pacific coast, totem poles, provincial bird: Steller's Jay)

Manitoba (Winnipeg - prairies, polar bears, provincial bird: Great Grey Owl)

Nova Scotia (Halifax - lighthouse, Atlantic coast, fishing villages, provincial bird: Osprey)
New Brunswick (Fredericton - Bay of Fundy, covered bridges, provincial bird: Black-capped Chickadee)
Newfoundland and Labrador (St. John's - colorful row houses, icebergs, fishing, provincial bird: Atlantic Puffin)
Prince Edward Island (Charlottetown - red sand beaches, Anne of Green Gables, provincial bird: Blue Jay)
Yukon (Whitehorse - gold rush, northern lights, wilderness, territorial bird: Common Raven)
Northwest Territories (Yellowknife - midnight sun, diamond mines, northern lights, territorial bird: Gyrfalcon)
Nunavut (Iqaluit - Arctic tundra, Inuit culture, polar bears, territorial bird: Rock Ptarmigan)

name: FIGHT CLUB
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject to look like they've just been in a serious physical fight, with realistic battle damage and injuries.

Add visible injuries: a swollen black eye with dark purple bruising, a bloody nose with blood dripping or smeared on face, swollen or split lip, cuts and scrapes on face, reddened areas from impacts.

Clothing should be disheveled, torn, or stained with blood spots. Hair should be messy and out of place from the struggle.

The subject's expression should show exhaustion, defiance, toughness, or the aftermath of adrenaline - perhaps breathing heavily, grimacing, or showing a tough determined look despite the damage.

Optional context: Background could suggest where the fight occurred (alley, gym, street, parking lot), possibly with other visual clues of the altercation.

Keep all injuries photorealistic as if this is an actual photograph taken immediately after a fight. The damage should look fresh and recent with appropriate coloring for bruises (dark purple, red, swelling) and blood (realistic red, properly placed).

Preserve the subject's recognizable facial features while adding realistic fight injuries and tough, battle-worn appearance. The mood can be serious or darkly humorous depending on the subject's expression.

name: FILM NEGATIVE
message: Take a picture and convert the image to look like a traditional film photography negative. Invert all colors so that dark areas become light and light areas become dark, creating that distinctive orange-brown negative film appearance. Show the characteristic sprocket holes along the edges of the film strip, frame numbers, and development marks. Include slight grain, scratches, and dust particles that appear on aged film negatives. The subject should be clearly visible but in inverted colors with that warm amber/orange cast typical of color negative film. Add frame edge borders and film stock information markings for authenticity. Nostalgic, analog photography aesthetic.

name: FILM NOIR
message: Take a picture and transform the image into classic film noir style. High-contrast black and white. Hard directional lighting, deep shadows, Venetian blind light patterns. Moody, dramatic composition.

name: FILTH MODE
message:
Take a picture and identify the main subject or object. Transform it so it appears dirty, neglected, or gross while preserving its shape and identity.

Add realistic grime such as dirt, mud, stains, splashes, smears, or dried mess. If appropriate, include cartoonishly unpleasant elements like poop, sludge, or foul residue applied to the object’s surface without obscuring it completely.

Ensure the filth follows the object’s contours, texture, and lighting so it looks physically present rather than overlaid. The result should be visually obvious, humorous or shocking, and immediately readable on a small screen.

name: FIND ME
message: Take a picture and transform the image so the subject is fully visible yet intentionally hidden through perfect visual camouflage. The subject’s clothing, colors, textures, and patterns must precisely match and continue the surrounding environment, making the subject difficult to distinguish at first glance. Do not remove or blur the subject — instead, conceal them through seamless pattern alignment, color continuity, and texture matching. The subject must remain physically present with accurate scale, lighting, shadows, and depth, so they clearly exist once noticed. Avoid outlines, highlights, or obvious separation; the concealment should feel deliberate, intelligent, and visually satisfying when discovered.

name: FIREWORKS
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject's face into a spectacular fireworks display in the night sky, where every facial feature is formed entirely from pyrotechnic bursts and cascading light.

FACIAL STRUCTURE FROM FIREWORKS:
• Face outline formed by golden willow pattern bursts cascading downward
• Eyes created from bright white chrysanthemum bursts at peak brilliance
• Pupils formed by smaller, concentrated blue peony bursts
• Eyebrows made from curved arrangements of golden kamuro (falling stars) effects
• Nose formed by a vertical sequence of small brocade crown bursts
• Mouth created from a curved arrangement of red and orange palm tree patterns
• Cheekbones highlighted by silvery strobe bursts
• Hair formed by massive multi-color willow bursts radiating outward
• Overall face composed of dozens of overlapping bursts at various stages

FIREWORK VARIETY AND COLOR:
• Use multiple pyrotechnic patterns: chrysanthemums, peonies, willows, palms, rings, crossettes
• Color palette: brilliant whites, deep blues, vibrant reds, golden yellows, electric greens, vivid purples
• Some bursts at peak brilliance, others showing cascading trails
• Glittering kamuro effects falling like rain from upper portions
• Strobe effects for highlights and sparkle
• Color-changing effects showing transition mid-burst
• Smoke trails visible between active bursts

SKY AND ATMOSPHERE:
• Deep black or dark blue night sky background
• Multiple bursts at different distances creating depth
• Atmospheric perspective—closer bursts brighter and more detailed
• Smoke patterns from previous bursts creating misty layers
• Some bursts still rising (trail visible), others at peak, others falling
• Light reflecting off atmospheric moisture creates soft glow
• Distant city lights or horizon glow at bottom of frame

DYNAMIC TIMING:
• Capture multiple bursts at different stages simultaneously
• Some effects just igniting, others fully bloomed, others fading
• Falling embers and glowing particles trailing downward
• The composition should feel like a split-second frozen moment
• Varying brightness levels create dimensionality
• Motion trails suggest the dynamic energy of the display

TECHNICAL PRESENTATION:
• Long exposure photography aesthetic showing light trails
• Sharp peak bursts with softer cascading elements
• Light blooming effect around brightest areas
• Particles and embers visible as individual light points
• Smoke wisps catching light from active bursts
• Color saturation high but natural for pyrotechnics
• The face should be clearly recognizable despite abstract medium

ATMOSPHERIC DETAILS:
• Concentric ring patterns from shell bursts
• Glittering particles suspended in air
• Layered smoke creating depth and texture
• Light reflecting off clouds if present
• The display should feel celebratory and awe-inspiring
• Maintain facial proportions while embracing the organic chaos of fireworks

FINAL RESULT:
A stunning nighttime portrait where the subject's face is masterfully recreated using a perfectly-timed orchestration of firework bursts at various stages and positions in the sky. The image captures the peak moment where dozens of coordinated pyrotechnic effects combine to form a recognizable likeness that is both ephemeral and spectacular—a face made entirely of light, color, and controlled fire in the darkness.

name: FISH TANK
message: Take a picture and place the subject inside a clear aquarium fish tank, swimming as if they were a fish.

options.text: Home aquarium
Large public aquarium tank
Pet store fish display
Office or restaurant decorative tank
Minimalist glass cube tank

name: FLAG
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a national or state flag design, either creating a fictitious flag for an invented nation or placing the subject's face on an existing flag that features a human portrait.

Arkansas State Flag (diamond with stars - adapt)
