Louisiana State Flag (pelican with nest - adapt with subject)
West Virginia State Flag (state seal with farmers)

name: FLINTSTONED
message:
Take a picture and place the subject into a real-world street scene where they are operating a Flintstones-style, foot-powered vehicle.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• The scene is photorealistic and grounded in reality
• The vehicle operates using foot power instead of an engine
• The humor comes from the absurdity being treated seriously
• This is NOT a cartoon and NOT animated

VEHICLE CREATION & TRANSFORMATION (MANDATORY):
• A Flintstones-style foot-powered vehicle MUST be present in the scene
• If a vehicle exists in the original image, it must be transformed into a Flintstones-style vehicle
• If NO vehicle exists in the original image, a Flintstones-style foot-powered vehicle MUST be created for the subject
• Vehicle characteristics:
  – Open bottom with visible ground beneath
  – Subject’s feet clearly propel the vehicle
  – No engine, exhaust, battery, or modern drivetrain
  – Primitive, handmade construction
• Materials may include:
  – Wood
  – Stone
  – Rope or leather straps
  – Simple axles or rollers

SUBJECT INTEGRATION (MANDATORY):
• The subject must always be inside or actively operating the vehicle
• Subject remains fully recognizable
• Posture clearly indicates foot-powered motion
• Expression may be neutral, focused, or subtly amused

ENVIRONMENT:
• Modern or timeless street setting
• Asphalt or paved road clearly visible beneath the vehicle
• Buildings, sidewalks, crosswalks, street signs, or parked cars may be present
• Surrounding world treats the vehicle as completely normal

STYLE & TONE:
• Photorealistic, live-action appearance
• No cartoon outlines, cel shading, or animated textures
• Humor is dry and situational, not exaggerated
• Feels like a real photograph of an impossible but functional object

REALISM DETAILS (IMPORTANT):
• Accurate lighting and shadows beneath the vehicle and feet
• Foot contact with the ground must look physically plausible
• Motion implied through foot position, posture, or slight body lean
• Materials show believable wear, weight, and construction

CAMERA:
• Street-level or slightly low-angle perspective
• Medium or wide framing
• Clear view of the vehicle’s underside and the subject’s feet

LIGHTING:
• Natural outdoor lighting
• Consistent shadows and reflections
• No dramatic or stylized lighting

RESTRICTIONS:
• No cartoon characters
• No animated or illustrated styles
• No modern engines, motors, or pedals
• No exaggerated slapstick motion

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a real-world photograph where the subject is casually driving a Flintstones-style, foot-powered vehicle down a street. The vehicle is always present, always foot-powered, and treated as completely normal by the environment — creating a dry, believable, and visually funny moment.

name: FLOWERY
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a sculpture constructed entirely from fresh flowers.

CRITICAL - COMPLETE FLORAL TRANSFORMATION:
• Subject IS MADE OF FLOWERS - not a photo with flowers around it
• Every part of subject constructed from flower petals, blooms, stems, and leaves
• NO photographic elements remain
• Subject's form recognizable but composed entirely of botanical materials
• Face, body, clothing - all transformed into flowers
• This is a floral sculpture, not a picture decorated with flowers

FLOWER TYPES & VARIETY:
• Mix of different flower types for texture and color variation:
  - Roses (various colors) for smooth areas
  - Carnations for dense filling
  - Chrysanthemums for volume
  - Daisies for delicate details
  - Sunflowers for large focal points
  - Tulips, lilies, orchids, peonies
  - Small baby's breath for fine details
  - Hydrangeas for clustered areas
• Fresh, vibrant blooms (not wilted)
• Natural flower colors

FLORAL CONSTRUCTION:
• Flowers densely packed to create solid form
• Petals arranged to follow subject's contours
• Stems and leaves as structural support (visible in places)
• Blooms overlapping and layered
• Different flower sizes for different body parts:
  - Large blooms for torso, major areas
  - Medium flowers for limbs
  - Small flowers for facial features, fingers
• Flowers facing various directions for dimension

SUBJECT RECOGNITION:
• Overall silhouette and form recognizable as the subject
• Pose maintained through floral arrangement
• Face features created with flower placement:
  - Eyes: Dark flowers (pansies, dark roses) or flower centers
  - Nose: Protruding bloom cluster
  - Mouth: Line of small colorful flowers
  - Hair: Flowing mass of flowers matching hair color/style
• Clothing suggested by flower color and type changes
• Subject's identity visible through botanical sculpture

COLOR COORDINATION:
• Flower colors match subject's natural coloring:
  - Skin tone: Peach, pink, cream roses and carnations
  - Hair: Flowers matching hair color (yellow for blonde, red for redhead, etc.)
  - Clothing: Flowers in clothing colors
• Harmonious color palette
• Natural flower color variations create depth
• Highlights and shadows through lighter/darker blooms

BOTANICAL DETAILS:
• Visible petals, stamens, pistils
• Green leaves interspersed
• Stems showing structure
• Natural flower texture (soft, delicate)
• Some flowers fully open, others partially
• Botanical accuracy in flower anatomy
• Fresh, dewy appearance

FLORAL FESTIVAL AESTHETIC:
• Parade float flower sculpture quality
• Rose Parade (Pasadena) style
• Professional floral artist craftsmanship
• Festival elaborate floral display
• Could be competition-winning sculpture
• Large-scale botanical installation

STRUCTURE & FORM:
• Three-dimensional floral sculpture
• Volume and mass created by flower density
• Depth through layering
• Flowers build up the form
• Framework suggested but hidden by blooms
• Life-sized or monumental scale

BACKGROUND:
• Garden setting OR studio setting
• Green foliage or neutral backdrop
• Natural outdoor environment ideal
• Allows floral sculpture to stand out
• Possibly other floral arrangements visible
• Botanical garden or flower show setting

LIGHTING:
• Natural daylight or soft studio lighting
• Illuminates flower colors beautifully
• Highlights texture and dimension
• Warm, natural light
• Shows flower details clearly
• Bright but not harsh

STYLE:
• Hyperrealistic botanical sculpture
• Festival parade float quality
• Fine art floral installation
• Professional florist craftsmanship
• Beautiful and elaborate
• Nature meets art

NOT ALLOWED:
• Subject photo with flowers placed on it
• Subject holding flowers
• Flowers floating around subject
• Floral overlay on photo
• Any photorealistic human skin/features
• Subject behind flowers

TEXTURE:
• Soft velvet petals
• Delicate thin petals
• Thick waxy petals
• Smooth rose petals
• Ruffled carnation texture
• Natural organic botanical texture

DETAIL LEVEL:
• Face clearly recognizable through flower types and colors
• Expression suggested by flower arrangement
• Pose and gesture evident
• Proportions maintained
• Fine details (fingers, facial features) all flowers
• Complete transformation head to toe

FRESHNESS:
• Flowers appear fresh and vibrant
• Not wilted or dying
• Peak bloom appearance
• Dewy, just-picked quality
• Living botanical material
• Fragrant and beautiful

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject completely transformed into a three-dimensional sculpture made entirely of fresh flowers - with varied flower types, sizes, and colors creating form and detail, natural botanical textures, and the subject's shape, pose, and identity recognizable through the arrangement and layering of countless blooms, petals, stems, and leaves - NOT a photograph decorated with flowers, but the actual subject reconstructed as an elaborate floral sculpture like a festival parade float or botanical art installation.

name: FOLLOW THE YELLOW BRICK ROAD
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into one of four iconic Wizard of Oz characters — Tin Man, Cowardly Lion, Scarecrow, or Dorothy — regardless of the subject's sex. The subject must appear as a live-action actor cast in the chosen role, with full makeup, hair, costume, and accessories applied directly to their own face and body. The subject’s face must be fully recognizable and expressive; NO face-swapping, pasting, or blending of another face is allowed.

options.text: Tin Man (metallic makeup, silver costume, funnel hat, heart-shaped props optional)
Cowardly Lion (fur costume, mane, whisker and nose makeup, tail)
Scarecrow (hay details, stitched clothing, hat, makeup accentuating stitched features)
Dorothy (blue gingham dress, braided hair, ribbon, subtle natural makeup)

name: FORCED PERSPECTIVE
message: Take a picture and place the subject into a scene that uses forced perspective to create a clever visual illusion. The subject should appear to interact with large or distant objects using scale tricks (for example: pinching the sun, holding the moon, pushing a skyscraper, balancing a mountain on their palm). Carefully align scale, depth, and camera angle so the illusion looks intentional and realistic. Preserve the subject’s identity and integrate lighting, shadows, and perspective so the interaction feels physically believable and visually playful.

name: FOREVER STAMP
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a large physical postage stamp. Show perforated edges, printed texture, ink dot patterns, and slight wear.

name: FORTUNE TELLER
message: Take a picture and create a fortune teller scene with the subject's head appearing as a mystical floating apparition inside the crystal ball.

options.text: Classic Carnival - colorful tent, theatrical, 1920s-1950s fortune teller aesthetic
Mysterious Gypsy - traditional Romani aesthetic, head scarf, gold jewelry, candlelit
Victorian Spiritualist - 1800s séance, dark parlor, formal dress, mediumship
New Age Psychic - 1970s-1980s, crystals everywhere, incense, bohemian
Tarot Reader - tarot cards spread, mystical, Gothic aesthetic
Eastern Mystic - Asian-inspired, ornate robes, temple setting, Buddhist/Hindu influence
Witch Fortune Teller - witchcraft aesthetic, spell books, cauldron, magical
Modern Psychic - contemporary, neon "Psychic" sign, storefront, urban
Dark Oracle - sinister, hooded, ominous predictions, horror fortune teller
Carnival Automaton - mechanical fortune teller machine, "Zoltar" style, animatronic

name: FPS
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a character from a legendary first-person shooter game, rendered in that game's distinctive visual style and HUD interface.

options.text: Halo - Spartan armor in Forerunner or Covenant environment with shield/health bar
Half-Life - HEV suit in Black Mesa or Xen with iconic orange HUD
Quake - Dark medieval fortress with gothic architecture and brown palette
Unreal Tournament - Futuristic arena with weapon wheel and frag count
BioShock - Rapture art deco underwater city with plasmid/EVE interface
Skyrim - First-person fantasy with compass, health/magicka/stamina bars
Fallout - Post-apocalyptic wasteland with Pip-Boy style interface
Borderlands - Cell-shaded wasteland with loot-shooter HUD and shields
Counter-Strike - Tactical modern setting with buy menu aesthetic
Team Fortress 2 - Cartoonish mercenary in stylized battlefield
Call of Duty: Modern Warfare - Realistic military with killstreak HUD
Battlefield - Large-scale warfare with minimap and squad interface
Portal - Aperture Science test chamber with portal gun HUD
Titanfall - Pilot or titan with parkour environment and HUD
Destiny - Guardian in sci-fi fantasy with super energy and ghost
Metro - Post-apocalyptic Moscow tunnels with gas mask overlay
Far Cry - Tropical or wilderness setting with weapon wheel
Overwatch - Hero shooter with character-specific abilities HUD
Apex Legends - Battle royale with shield/health segments and ping system
Prey - Talos I space station with neuromods and alien threats

name: FRACTAL
message: Take a picture and transform the image using fractal geometry. Recursive patterns, infinite detail.

name: FREAKSHOW POSTER
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform them into the star of a vintage freakshow poster from the late 1800s or early 1900s.

The subject should be presented as a dramatic, mysterious attraction with exaggerated features, theatrical posing, and bold stage lighting.

Design the image like an old carnival poster, with ornate borders, hand-painted lettering, and weathered paper texture.

Include a sensational headline and dramatic tagline describing the subject as a strange or amazing curiosity, using humorous or absurd flavor text.

The final image should look like an antique circus sideshow poster advertising the subject as a spectacular and unbelievable attraction.

name: FREAKY FRIDAY
message:
Take a picture and if the picture contains two or more clearly visible subjects, perform a realistic multi-subject head swap by exchanging their heads between bodies. Preserve body posture, clothing, lighting direction, skin tone consistency, and camera perspective. Maintain natural neck alignment and correct scale so each swapped head fits the new body believably.

If exactly one subject is detected, perform an inverse face transformation by subtly mirroring or inverting the subject’s facial features while preserving overall realism, expression, and identity. The result should feel intentionally uncanny but not distorted.

If no subjects are detected, return the original image unchanged. The final image should be visually coherent and readable on small screens.

name: FREEZE FRAME
message: Take a picture of the subject and create a photorealistic freeze-frame action moment centered on an object naturally observed near the subject in the image. The AI must identify a nearby object such as a glass, cup, plate of food, pool, puddle, ball, or similar element and use it as the source of an explosive action event. The subject should be captured at the exact peak moment of interaction, such as water spilling outward from a tipped glass, food launching into the air, or a dramatic splash as the subject jumps into a pool. Liquid, debris, or fragments should be frozen mid-air with sharp detail, dynamic shapes, and realistic physics while the subject remains crisply focused. If no suitable nearby object is visible, randomly select a plausible explosive moment consistent with the environment. Maintain realistic lighting, motion physics, shadows, and depth of field so the final image looks like a real high-speed photograph capturing a single decisive instant in time.

name: FRENCH CHEF DISASTER
message: Take a picture and place the subject as the host of The French Chef cooking show in the style of Julia Child, but everything is going catastrophically wrong. Show them in a 1960s TV kitchen set with vintage appliances, wearing an apron, trying to maintain Julia Child's cheerful composure while absolute chaos unfolds. The kitchen should be a disaster - pots boiling over and spilling everywhere, food on fire with flames shooting up, whole chickens or ingredients flying through the air, wine bottles knocked over and spilling, utensils scattered everywhere, mixer spraying batter across the set. The subject should have that exaggerated Julia Child enthusiasm and dramatic hand gestures despite being covered in flour, sauce splattered across their face and apron, hair disheveled. Include vintage 1960s TV production elements: old cameras visible, grainy film quality, retro color palette, that characteristic public television aesthetic. Show the 'finished dish' they're supposed to create displayed beautifully on a card, contrasted with the smoking, collapsed, or unrecognizable disaster on their counter. Maybe they're holding up a charred mess while maintaining that bright TV smile and saying 'Bon Appétit!' Add vintage graphics, retro kitchen décor, and that wholesome 60s cooking show vibe completely undermined by culinary catastrophe. Make it look like a frame from a vintage cooking show where absolutely everything went wrong but the host keeps going with cheerful determination.

name: FRIDGE ART
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a child’s crayon drawing displayed on a refrigerator.

Render the subject as a deliberately crude crayon drawing with uneven proportions, simple shapes, wobbly outlines, and flat scribbled coloring. Facial features and limbs should be exaggerated or misaligned in a childlike way while still being loosely recognizable.

Use a plain white or lightly stained paper background with visible crayon texture and pressure marks. Add misspelled handwritten text such as a name, age, or caption written in childlike lettering.

Attach the drawing to a refrigerator using colorful magnets. Show part of the fridge surface, smudges, and nearby papers or photos.

Ensure the entire drawing and fridge context are fully visible. The final image should feel innocent, funny, and unmistakably like real fridge art made by a child.

name: FROSTING CAKE ART
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into frosting-style artwork applied flat on the top of a cake. The subject should lie flush on the frosting surface — fully integrated — but the frosting itself should have realistic texture: piped swirls, slight ridges, creaminess, and subtle shadows so it clearly looks like real icing, not a topper.

Render the subject simply, preserving only the most recognizable facial features, posture, or silhouette. Avoid overly detailed or three-dimensional features; the design should be believable as hand-piped or painted frosting.

Include realistic cake decorations such as frosting borders, small swirls, sprinkles, or minor fondant accents. If no external message is provided via master prompt, automatically add playful flavor text based on the subject: e.g., 'Happy 1st Birthday!' if the subject appears young, or 'Happy Retirement!' if the subject appears older.

If an external message is provided, append it naturally using piping-style lettering around the subject. Ensure the full cake top and subject are fully visible in the frame. Use soft, realistic lighting and perspective so the subject and frosting appear tactile and integrated. The final image should feel festive, humorous, and clearly readable on small screens, while lying flat on the cake surface.

name: FROZEN IN ICE
message: Take a picture and make it appear as if the subject is frozen inside a clear block of ice. The ice should have realistic cracks, bubbles, frost, and refraction. The subject must be clearly visible through the ice, distorted slightly by thickness and trapped depth.

name: FRUSTRATIONAL POSTER
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a dramatic motivational poster where the inspirational message clearly does NOT match what is happening.

options.text: TEAMWORK — subject surrounded by arguing, chaos, crossed arms, or visible disagreement
SUCCESS — subject failing, overwhelmed, exhausted, or mid-disaster
INNOVATION — subject fixing something with duct tape, zip ties, or improvised tools
LEADERSHIP — subject clearly confused, lost, or being ignored
PERSEVERANCE — subject giving up, sitting down, or visibly defeated

name: FUN-FLATABLE
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into an over-the-top inflatable mascot costume. Exaggerate proportions so the body is comically large and rounded, but keep the subject’s facial features visible on the inflated surface. Include whimsical folds, wrinkles, and inflated textures. Place the subject in a fun environment such as a stadium, street parade, or party. Ensure the entire inflatable is fully visible and clearly readable on a small screen, emphasizing absurd humor and playful energy.

name: FUNHOUSE MIRROR
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject as if reflected in a carnival funhouse mirror.

MIRROR DISTORTION SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a mirror distortion, USE THAT MIRROR DISTORTION
• If no mirror distortion is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE distortion using the RANDOM SEED
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 0,1: SELECT vertical concave (tall and pinched inward)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 2,3: SELECT vertical convex (short and wide)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 4,5: SELECT horizontal concave (squeezed side-to-side)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 6,7: SELECT horizontal convex (stretched side-to-side)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 8: SELECT concave-convex (pinched center with expanded ends)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 9: SELECT convex-concave (expanded center with pinched ends)

The distortion must affect the ENTIRE subject and scene consistently, as true optical glass distortion — not digital warping.

Facial features, body proportions, and environment must bend smoothly and continuously according to the mirror curvature.

DO NOT crop the subject.
DO NOT break anatomy or introduce glitches.
DO NOT apply multiple distortions at once.

Lighting, reflections, and perspective must behave like reflective glass, with subtle highlights and edge reflections.

The final image must look like a real photograph taken of a funhouse mirror reflection.

name: FUNKO POP
message: Take a picture and turn the subject into a Funko Pop. Oversized head, simplified body.

name: FUTURAMA
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into an animated character placed directly inside a Futurama-style scene alongside recognizable characters from the show.

Render the subject in the same visual style as Futurama characters: clean bold outlines, flat cel shading, simplified geometric facial features, exaggerated eyes, smooth rounded head shapes, and bright saturated colors. Preserve the subject’s recognizability while fully adapting them into the cartoon style.

Place the subject INTO an iconic Futurama environment and scene, selected based on context or randomly, such as:
• inside the Planet Express building or conference room
• standing with Fry, Leela, and Bender in the Planet Express crew lineup
• walking through New New York with futuristic buildings and flying cars
• inside MomCorp, the Head Museum, or a sci-fi lab
• in a space scene with Futurama characters reacting to the subject

Existing Futurama characters may appear in the scene as supporting characters, background figures, or interaction partners, drawn accurately in their recognizable cartoon style. The subject should feel like a guest character naturally written into an episode, not pasted on top.

Adapt the subject’s clothing into Futurama-appropriate outfits — delivery uniforms, sci-fi jumpsuits, futuristic casual wear, or humorous future attire inspired by their real clothing.

Use simple painted backgrounds, clean animation lighting, and minimal texture consistent with hand-drawn cel animation. Avoid realistic shading or painterly effects.

Ensure the full scene is visible and readable on a small screen, with the subject clearly identifiable among the Futurama characters. The final image should feel like a freeze-frame from an actual Futurama episode where the subject unexpectedly appears.

name: FUTURE SELF
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a realistic future version of themselves, showing natural aging while preserving identity.

options.text: +15 years
+20 years
+25 years
+30 years
+35 years
+40 years

name: GAMEBOY
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into an authentic early-1990s monochrome handheld console display using a classic green dot-matrix screen aesthetic. Render the entire image as if it is displayed on a low-resolution reflective LCD with a pea-green color palette, dark olive shadows, and pale green highlights. Convert the subject into true dot-matrix pixel art using a visible grid of circular pixels, limited tonal steps, and strong contrast. Preserve the subject’s recognizable facial features and silhouette while adapting them to the constraints of a handheld screen resolution. Simulate real screen characteristics including pixel ghosting, motion blur trails, uneven refresh, slight vertical smearing, faint scan artifacts, and subtle screen noise. Avoid smooth gradients—everything should appear quantized and grid-based. Frame the image strictly as the handheld screen view itself, with a thin dark border suggesting the screen edge. Do not include logos, branding, or copyrighted UI elements. Optional minimal pixel indicators (numbers or icons only) may appear at the edges of the screen. Optimize for small screens with bold shapes, clear separation, and immediate readability. The final image should feel indistinguishable from a real dot-matrix handheld screen captured mid-use—nostalgic, tactile, and unmistakably retro.

name: GARDEN GNOME
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a classic, life-sized garden gnome. Preserve facial recognition while giving the subject gnome features such as a pointed hat, whimsical clothing, and small props (e.g., shovel, lantern, mushroom). Place the gnome in a backyard or garden environment. Ensure the full gnome is visible, standing naturally, and clearly readable on a small screen. The final image should feel humorous, whimsical, and integrated into the scene.

name: GARGOYLE
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a stone gargoyle perched on a famous cathedral.

options.text: Notre-Dame de Paris (bell tower perch, Paris cityscape, Seine River, French Gothic architecture)
Westminster Abbey, London (tower or buttress perch, London skyline, Big Ben distant, English Gothic)
Cologne Cathedral, Germany (twin spire perch, Rhine River below, medieval German city, dramatic height)
Milan Cathedral (Duomo), Italy (among forest of spires, Milan city center, ornate Italian Gothic)
Sagrada Família, Barcelona (modern Gothic perch, Gaudí architecture, Barcelona below, organic forms)
Generic Grand Cathedral (majestic unnamed cathedral, European city, flexible Gothic style, flying buttresses)

name: GENDER INVERSION
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into the opposite gender while preserving the subject’s core facial structure, expressions, and identity. Adjust facial features, body shape, hair, and secondary characteristics in a realistic and anatomically plausible way. Adapt clothing and styling to suit the transformed gender presentation while maintaining the subject’s original personality and essence. Ensure the subject appears naturally integrated into the scene, with consistent lighting, proportions, and photorealistic realism.

name: GHIBLI CAM
message: Take a picture in the Studio Ghibli anime style-soft colors, whimsical atmosphere, and hand-drawn aesthetic.

name: GHOST
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a ghost in spectral form with supernatural qualities.

options.text: Classic Victorian Spirit (1800s clothing, white/grey, old mansion, tragic melancholic, candlelit)
Vengeful Apparition (intense angry expression, darker shadowy, flickering unstable, death scene, stormy)
Sad Wandering Soul (confused lost expression, soft gentle glow, searching gesture, familiar place, twilight)
Protective Guardian (benevolent watchful, warm golden glow, guarding location/person, family home, peaceful)
Ancient Historical Phantom (medieval/Roman/ancient clothing, aged time-worn, historical site, mysterious)
Poltergeist Energy (violent chaotic, objects floating/thrown, intense distortions, unstable, dark interior)

name: GIANT MONSTER
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a giant Kaiju-style monster attacking a city. The subject should tower over buildings at massive scale (100+ feet tall), with their recognizable features enlarged and made monstrous. Place them in an urban environment with skyscrapers, fleeing crowds, emergency vehicles, and destruction. Add cinematic disaster movie atmosphere with dramatic lighting, dust clouds, debris, and chaos. Include details like the monster's massive footprints crushing cars, toppling buildings, and helicopters circling. Make it look like a scene from a classic monster movie with photorealistic destruction and scale.

name: GIANT WORLD
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a giant towering over the environment. Realistic scale interaction.

name: GILLIGAN'S ISLAND
message:
Take a picture of the subject and place them into a Gilligan’s Island-style castaway world where modern technology does not exist.

TECHNOLOGY HANDLING (CRITICAL):
• Analyze the image for any visible modern technology
• If technology IS present, TRANSFORM it into an improvised device that the Professor would have constructed using materials found on a deserted island
• If technology is NOT present, ADD a believable improvised object that looks like one of the Professor’s inventions

PROFESSOR-STYLE INVENTIONS:
• Devices made from bamboo, coconuts, rope, vines, driftwood, shells, and salvaged shipwreck parts
• Inventions should appear absurdly clever yet physically plausible
• Examples include radios made from coconuts, power generators made from bamboo and rope, lab equipment built from beach debris

SUBJECT PLACEMENT:
• Subject should appear stranded but resourceful
• Holding, operating, or standing near a Professor-style invention
• Clothing should appear slightly worn, sun-faded, or adapted for island living

ENVIRONMENT (MANDATORY):
• Tropical deserted island setting
• Sandy beaches, palm trees, jungle foliage
• Makeshift huts or shelters
• No modern infrastructure

TONE AND STYLE:
• Lighthearted and adventurous
• Classic television sitcom energy
• Bright natural lighting
• Clean, colorful, retro aesthetic

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a scene from Gilligan’s Island, with the subject convincingly stranded on a tropical island and surrounded by improbably clever, handmade inventions that replace all modern technology.

name: GLASS
message: Take a picture and transform everything into transparent glass. Refraction, reflections, caustic lighting.

name: GLITCH REALITY
message: Take a picture and introduce digital glitches into a realistic scene. Pixel tearing, compression artifacts. Reality appears corrupted.

name: GLOSSARY
message: Take a picture and create an image of a glossary identifying the main subject and a limited number of notable objects. Include the photograph prominently in the layout. Overlay clear letter markers (A, B, C, etc.) directly on or near each identified object in the image. Beneath the photo, create a glossary-style list where each entry begins with the matching letter and provides a brief description blending factual identification and light humor. Keep the layout simple and legible for a small screen. The photograph should clearly correspond to the labeled glossary entries.

name: GOO GOO GAA GAA
message:
Take a picture and place the subject's original face (completely unchanged) onto a baby's body. Keep the subject's exact face - same size, same features, same expression - but attach it to a realistic baby body (approximately 6-12 months old). DO NOT modify the face in any way - do not make it younger, smaller, or more baby-like. The face should remain identical to the original photo. Only the body changes to a baby body. The contrast between the unchanged face and baby body should be humorous and obvious.

BABY SITUATION SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a baby situation, USE THAT BABY SITUATION
• If no baby situation is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE typical baby situation using the RANDOM SEED
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 0,1: SELECT crawling on the floor
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 2,3: SELECT sitting in a high chair making a mess with food
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 4: SELECT being fed with a bottle or spoon
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 5,6: SELECT playing with baby toys
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 7: SELECT lying in a crib
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 8: SELECT wearing a diaper (standing or sitting)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 9: SELECT being held by a parent

The baby body should have proper infant proportions - chubby limbs, small hands and feet, baby fat rolls, appropriate scale. Include realistic details like baby clothes (onesie, diaper), nursery environment, baby gear, and age-appropriate activities. The scene should be photorealistic with soft lighting. The humor comes from seeing the subject's recognizable original face (preserved exactly as it appears in the photo) on a tiny baby body in baby situations.

name: GOOD TO BE THE KING
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a king seated or standing in a position of power.

SUBJECT ROLE (CRITICAL):
• Subject is the unquestioned king
• Regal clothing, crown, throne, or royal posture

FOLLOWER LOGIC:
• If other people are visible in the image:
  – All must be bowing, kneeling, or showing deference to the subject

• If NO other people are visible:
  – Populate the scene with bowing figures using the RANDOM SEED
  – Figures may include animals, people, or fantasy creatures

STYLE:
• Grand, cinematic lighting
• Regal environment (throne room, castle, open field, balcony)
• Subject must remain recognizable

FINAL RESULT:
The image should clearly communicate absolute authority, with all surrounding beings bowing to the subject.

name: GOTH
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into goth subculture style.

options.text: Traditional Goth (1980s) - teased hair, Robert Smith makeup, Siouxsie style, black lace, crosses
Romantic Goth - Victorian clothing, corsets, velvet, lace, period costume, elegant dark
Cyber Goth - neon dreads, goggles, platform boots, UV reactive, industrial rave
Vampire Goth - fangs, pale skin, Victorian vampire aesthetic, dramatic cape, Gothic horror
Corporate Goth - office attire in all black, professional but dark, business goth
Pastel Goth - pink/purple/mint with black, kawaii meets dark, creepy cute
Nu Goth - modern minimalist black, occult symbols, contemporary dark fashion
Deathrock - horror punk, skeletal makeup, torn fishnets, Misfits aesthetic
Gothic Lolita - Japanese lolita fashion, black Victorian dress, elaborate, princess goth
Steampunk Goth - Victorian industrial, goggles, gears, brass, neo-Victorian
Bubble Goth - platform shoes, colorful hair with black, club kid meets goth
Medieval Goth - Renaissance faire meets goth, medieval clothing, dark ages aesthetic
Glam Goth - glitter, makeup dramatic, androgynous, 1970s glam rock meets goth
Hippie Goth - flowing black clothes, patchouli, occult jewelry, dark bohemian
Mall Goth (2000s) - Hot Topic era, band t-shirts, chains, striped arm warmers, emo influence

name: GOTHIC MEDIEVAL ART
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a Gothic medieval-style artwork. Render the subject with elongated, dramatic proportions, stylized drapery, intricate patterns, and muted, earthy colors typical of 12th–15th century Gothic art. Include characteristic elements such as pointed arches, cathedral-like backgrounds, stained glass windows, ornate borders, and symbolic motifs.

Use flat or slightly sculptural lighting with subtle gold leaf accents, emphasizing solemnity and reverence. Preserve the subject’s facial features and expression while adapting them to the medieval aesthetic.

Include a simple decorative frame, text banners, or illuminated manuscript-style captions if relevant, ensuring all elements are fully visible in the final composition. The final image should feel like a historical Gothic painting, dramatic and atmospheric, clearly readable on small screens, and fully contained within the frame.

name: GOUACHE ILLUSTRATION
message: Take a picture and transform the image into a gouache illustration. Matte textures, bold shapes, opaque color layers, and crisp edges while preserving subject identity.

name: GRAFFITI
message: Take a picture in the style of Graffiti Art. Spray paint textures, urban wall surface.

name: GRAHAM NORTON SHOW
message:
Take a picture and place the subject as a guest on The Graham Norton Show. The subject maintains realistic proportions and identity.

SHOW SEGMENT SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• SELECT EXACTLY ONE option using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Do NOT choose based on popularity, visual interest, or defaults

For 2 options (50/50 split):
• If LAST DIGIT is EVEN (0,2,4,6,8): SELECT The Red Couch - The subject is seated on the iconic red couch on the right side of the set in a brightly lit TV studio. Graham Norton (the host) is positioned to the left. The set features glossy floors, colorful lighting, vibrant backdrop, and talk-show camera framing. The subject looks mid-conversation or reacting to a joke, possibly alongside other celebrity guests on the couch.
• If LAST DIGIT is ODD (1,3,5,7,9): SELECT The Big Red Chair - The subject is seated confidently or nervously on the red chair in front of the studio audience, with another person reaching for the lever about to flip it. Studio lighting, audience seating visible behind, dramatic tension, and TV broadcast realism. The subject remains the clear focal point.

Apply the selected segment's environment, lighting, and staging details while maintaining the subject's identity and realistic appearance.

name: GRANDMA
message: Take a picture and dress the subject in a stereotypical elderly grandmother costume regardless of their actual age or gender.

options.text: Baking Grandma (kitchen setting, apron with flour, wooden spoon/rolling pin, cookies/pie nearby, warm loving)
Knitting Grandma (armchair, knitting needles/yarn, half-finished scarf, reading glasses, concentrated peaceful)
Rocking Chair (classic wooden rocker, knitting or reading, cat on lap optional, doily on arm, content)
Scolding/Finger Wagging (pointing finger mock scolding, stern but loving, kitchen/living room, playful disapproval)
Offering Candy (holding hard candies/butterscotch, reaching in purse, sweet giving, "have candy dear" energy)
Sleeping in Chair (dozed off in armchair, glasses slipped down, knitting/book in lap, peaceful sleeping)
Greeting Arms Open (arms open for hug, biggest grandma smile, excited loving, "come give grandma hug!")

name: GRAVITY FALLS
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a mysterious cartoon world inspired by Gravity Falls.

STYLE & CHARACTER RULES:
• Clean linework with slightly angular proportions
• Muted but warm color palette
• Expressive faces with grounded cartoon realism
• Include eccentric townsfolk or supernatural creatures

SCENE & TONE:
• Small-town mystery and paranormal weirdness
• Forests, cabins, roadside attractions, or strange landmarks
• Subtle humor mixed with intrigue

The final image should look like a fully composed Gravity Falls–style hand-drawn illustration with the subject and additional characters integrated seamlessly into the world.

name: GREEK/ROMAN GOD
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a Greek or Roman god/goddess with divine attributes and mythological setting.

options.text: Zeus/Jupiter (King of Gods - lightning bolt, eagle, oak tree, throne on Mount Olympus, regal beard, commanding presence)
Hera/Juno (Queen of Gods - peacock, crown, scepter, marriage veil, regal gown, jealous beauty)
Poseidon/Neptune (God of Sea - trident, dolphin, horse, ocean waves, beard dripping water, commanding seas)
Hades/Pluto (God of Underworld - Cerberus three-headed dog, helm of darkness, throne of bones, riches, pomegranate)
Athena/Minerva (Goddess of Wisdom - owl, olive branch, Aegis shield, spear, helmet, strategic battle armor)
Apollo (God of Sun/Music - lyre, sun chariot, laurel wreath, bow and arrow, golden radiance, youthful beauty)
Artemis/Diana (Goddess of Hunt - bow and arrows, deer, moon, hunting dogs, virgin huntress attire)
Ares/Mars (God of War - bloodied armor, spear and shield, war helmet, battlefield, aggressive violent energy)
Aphrodite/Venus (Goddess of Love - seashell, doves, roses, mirror, beautiful flowing gown, irresistible beauty)
Hephaestus/Vulcan (God of Forge - hammer and anvil, fire, metalwork, mechanical creations, soot-covered)
Hermes/Mercury (Messenger God - winged sandals, caduceus staff, winged helmet, traveler's cloak, swift motion)
Demeter/Ceres (Goddess of Harvest - wheat sheaves, cornucopia, poppies, torch, nurturing earth mother)
Dionysus/Bacchus (God of Wine - grapevines, wine cup, ivy crown, leopard, festive revelry, intoxicated joy)
Persephone/Proserpina (Queen of Underworld - pomegranate, spring flowers, dual crown, transitional between worlds)
Hestia/Vesta (Goddess of Hearth - sacred flame, home altar, modest veil, domestic warmth)
Nike/Victoria (Goddess of Victory - wings, laurel wreath, palm branch, athletic triumph)
Eros/Cupid (God of Love - bow and arrow, wings, cherubic or youthful beauty, causing love)
Pan/Faunus (God of Wild - goat legs, pan flute, forest setting, horns, wild untamed nature)
Helios/Sol (God of Sun - sun chariot with horses, radiant crown, golden brilliance)
Selene/Luna (Goddess of Moon - moon crown, lunar chariot, silver glow, night sky)

name: GRIMMS FAIRY TALE
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a character within a Grimm’s fairy tale. Select a fairy tale based on the subject’s appearance, posture, expression, or perceived traits (such as innocence, cleverness, arrogance, bravery, curiosity), OR use a specific fairy tale provided via external master prompt.

Depict the subject as a story character fully integrated into a classic Grimm-style fairy tale scene, not as a modern person placed into an illustration. The subject may appear as a human, villager, traveler, child, noble, or fairy-tale creature as appropriate to the chosen story. The environment and supporting elements should clearly reflect a traditional fairy tale setting such as forests, cottages, castles, roads, or village scenes.

Render the image as a single illustrated storybook page. Ensure the entire page is fully visible within the frame, including margins, illustration, and text area. Do not crop or cut off any part of the page.

Include the **title of the selected fairy tale** prominently and clearly within the page layout, such as at the top of the page or as a decorative storybook heading. The title must be fully visible and immediately identifiable to the viewer.

Include a short fairy-tale caption or lesson within the page, such as a brief story excerpt, warning, or thematic line appropriate to Grimm’s fairy tales. The text should be legible, concise, and directly connected to the scene.

Use a traditional fairy-tale illustration style inspired by 18th–19th century book engravings or painted storybook art. The tone may be whimsical, eerie, or cautionary, but not graphic. Keep the composition symbolic, atmospheric, and clearly readable on a small screen. The final image should feel like a complete, intact page from a Grimm’s fairy tale book.

name: GUMBY
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into the visual style of classic Gumby stop-motion animation.

STYLE & MATERIAL (CRITICAL):
• Soft clay construction with simple, flat shapes
• Minimal detail — iconic, abstracted forms
• Smooth but visibly molded clay texture

FACIAL & BODY DESIGN:
• Preserve the subject’s recognizable face but simplify heavily
• Small dot eyes or simple sculpted eyes
• Minimal mouth or expression
• Limbs should appear bendable and rubbery

POSE & SCALE:
• Subject should look like a flexible clay figure
• Poses may be awkward, bent, or gravity-defying

COLOR & LIGHTING:
• Bright, flat colors
• Even, simple lighting
• Retro television look

ENVIRONMENT:
• Stylized clay environments — flat ground, abstract landscapes, simple props
• Everything must appear clay-built

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must look like a frame from a classic Gumby episode — playful, abstract, and unmistakably retro clay animation.

name: GUM-ME
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a giant edible gummy candy version of themselves, as if a candy company manufactured a gummy modeled after the subject.

CORE CONCEPT (NON-NEGOTIABLE):
• The subject is entirely made of gummy candy
• This is NOT a costume, NOT body paint, NOT partial candy overlay
• The subject must look edible, translucent, glossy, and chewy

MATERIAL TRANSFORMATION RULES (CRITICAL):
• Skin: translucent gummy texture with internal light diffusion
• Hair: made entirely from gummy worms, sour strings, or twisted gummy ropes
• Eyes: clear gummy domes or jelly-like candy eyes (still expressive)
• Teeth: white gummy or marshmallow candy texture
• Clothing (if present): formed from layered gummies, fruit slices, or molded candy shapes
• Accessories: rendered as candy equivalents only

IDENTITY PRESERVATION:
• Facial structure, proportions, and expression must remain clearly recognizable
• No generic gummy humanoids
• No simplification of facial features
• The subject must still look unmistakably like themselves

ANTI-LAZINESS RULES:
• NO real skin visible anywhere
• NO realistic hair mixed with candy
• NO smooth plastic or wax textures
• NO partial transformations
• Every visible surface must be candy-based

LIGHTING & REALISM:
• Studio-style lighting emphasizing translucency and gloss
• Subsurface scattering visible through the gummy material
• Sticky reflections and soft highlights
• Slight imperfections like bubbles or sugar granules

POSE & PRESENTATION:
• Subject posed like a product reveal or character portrait
• Neutral or playful expression
• Clean background or candy-factory-style environment

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a hyper-realistic photograph of a life-sized gummy candy sculpture manufactured to resemble the subject exactly — fully edible, glossy, translucent, and unmistakably made of gummies.

name: GYMNAST
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform them into a gymnast performing physically impossible or extreme gymnastics feats.

The subject should be dressed in realistic gymnastics attire such as leotards, unitards, or competition uniforms.

Poses may include:
• Impossible flexibility and contortions
• Gravity-defying flips, spins, or aerial twists
• Anatomically absurd balances and holds
• Frozen mid-action to capture the peak of motion

Lighting, environment, and perspective should resemble a real gymnasium, competition arena, or performance space.

Anatomy, muscle definition, and limb placement must appear realistic even while achieving impossible poses.

The final image should look dramatic, athletic, absurdly impressive, and visually convincing, like a photograph capturing a once-in-a-lifetime extreme gymnastics moment.

name: H. P. LOVECRAFT
message:
Take a picture and place the subject into a dark, cosmic-horror world inspired by H. P. Lovecraft.

The subject should appear small or vulnerable within a vast, eerie environment filled with ancient ruins, strange symbols, impossible architecture, and unknowable cosmic forces.

Subtle tentacles, eldritch shapes, or alien geometries may appear in the background, but do not overwhelm the subject.

The mood should feel ominous, mysterious, and otherworldly rather than gory.

name: HAIKU
message: Take a picture and create a serene, minimalist scene inspired by classical Japanese aesthetics in the spirit of Matsuo Bashō. Emphasize simplicity, natural elements, quiet atmosphere, and contemplative mood. Use flavor text drawn from the subject’s presence, expression, and surroundings to compose a traditional haiku. Display the complete haiku fully and clearly within the image, ensuring all lines are legible and unobstructed. Integrate the text harmoniously into the scene, such as on parchment, a wooden plaque, or subtle calligraphy-style overlay. Render the final image with refined detail, soft lighting, and a calm, poetic visual balance.

name: HAIR COLOR TRY-ON
message:
Take a picture of the subject and generate a 2×2 square grid showing four different hair colors applied to the same person. The face, hairstyle, lighting, and background must remain identical in all four panels — only the hair color changes.

Use realistic hair coloring with natural highlights, shadows, and root blending. Avoid flat or painted-on color.

Select four distinct colors (such as blonde, brunette, black, red, fantasy colors, etc.), chosen to complement the subject’s skin tone.

If external master prompt text is provided (such as decade, fashion style, fantasy theme, or celebrity), apply it to the color choices.

The result should look like a professional salon color preview.

name: HAIRCUT REVEAL
message: Take a picture capturing the exact moment the subject sees their terrible new haircut in the mirror for the first time. Show their face frozen in horror, shock, or trying to hide devastation while the hairdresser beams proudly in the background holding scissors and mirror. The haircut should be objectively bad - uneven, way too short, bizarre style they didn't ask for, or drastically different from what they wanted. Include salon setting with styling chair, cape still on, hair clippings on floor. Other stylists in background trying not to stare. Show the contrast between the hairdresser's proud smile ('I did such a good job!') and the subject's internal screaming visible on their face. Maybe include a 'before' photo visible showing what they asked for versus this disaster. Add salon mirrors reflecting the damage from multiple angles. The subject might be forcing a smile while dying inside. Capture that universal experience of getting a bad haircut and having to pretend you like it. Make it look like that awful moment of truth in the salon chair.

name: HAIRSTYLE TRY-ON
message:
Take a picture of the subject and generate a 2×2 square grid showing four different realistic hairstyles on the same person. The subject’s face, lighting, pose, and background must remain identical in all four panels — only the hairstyle changes.

Each panel should feature a distinct hairstyle (for example: short, long, curly, straight, layered, undercut, etc.), chosen to suit the subject’s face shape and hairline.

Use high-quality, photorealistic hair rendering with correct lighting, shadows, and blending so the hair looks naturally attached to the subject’s scalp.

If external master prompt text is provided (such as era, fashion decade, celebrity inspiration, or theme), apply it consistently across all four hairstyles.

The final output must be a clean square grid with thin borders separating each option, designed to look like a professional virtual makeover preview.

name: HAIRSTYLE TRY-ON (FUNNY)
message:
Take a picture of the subject and generate a 2×2 grid showing four wildly different, funny, or exaggerated hairstyles on the same person. Keep the face and pose identical in all panels.

Include ridiculous, over-the-top, or unexpected styles (for example: disco afro, medieval wig, anime hair, mullet, punk spikes, powdered wig, etc.).

The hair should still be well-rendered and attached realistically, even when silly.

If external master prompt text is provided (like era or theme), exaggerate it humorously.

The final result should feel like a comedy makeover show.

name: HAITIAN NAÏVE ART
message: Take a picture and transform the image into Haitian naïve style art. Bright colors, flattened depth, decorative storytelling elements, and joyful visual rhythm.

name: HANNA-BARBERA
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a classic Hanna-Barbera cartoon character rendered in authentic 1960s–1970s Hanna-Barbera animation style. Use bold black outlines, flat cel-shaded colors, limited animation aesthetics, simple geometric forms, and minimal shading. The subject should be fully redrawn to match the Hanna-Barbera look, not pasted or modernized.

options.text: The Flintstones (prehistoric Bedrock, stone houses, foot-powered cars)
The Jetsons (futuristic apartment, floating city, conveyor walkways)
Yogi Bear (Jellystone Park with picnic tables and ranger elements)
Super Friends (Hall of Justice with heroic poses)
Wacky Races (exaggerated race vehicles and chaotic motion)
Hong Kong Phooey (janitor's closet transforming into hero scene)
Josie and the Pussycats (live band performance on stage)
Captain Caveman (cave interiors and club-based antics)
Johnny Quest (adventure or science-lab environments)
Space Ghost (retro space settings or villain confrontations)
Fat Albert and the Cosby Kids (urban neighborhood streets, junkyard clubhouses, schoolyards, stoops, or classrooms with warm, grounded slice-of-life tone)

name: HANS CHRISTIAN ANDERSEN
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a character within a Hans Christian Andersen fairy tale. Select a tale based on the subject’s appearance, posture, expression, or perceived traits (such as innocence, longing, pride, loneliness, hope, sacrifice, or wonder), OR use a specific Andersen tale provided via external master prompt.

Depict the subject as a story character fully integrated into a classic Andersen-style fairy tale scene, not as a modern person placed into an illustration. The subject may appear as a human, child, mermaid, toy, animal, noble, or symbolic figure depending on the chosen tale. The environment should reflect romantic, storybook settings such as seaside villages, snowy streets, royal halls, moonlit gardens, or candlelit interiors.

Render the image as a single illustrated storybook page. Ensure the entire page is fully visible within the frame, including margins, illustration, and text area. Do not crop or cut off any part of the page.

Include the title of the fairy tale clearly displayed on the page (for example: 'The Little Mermaid,' 'The Ugly Duckling,' 'The Emperor’s New Clothes,' 'The Snow Queen,' or 'The Princess and the Pea'). The title must be legible and visually distinct so the viewer immediately recognizes the story.

Include a short poetic line, lesson, or emotional reflection appropriate to Hans Christian Andersen’s style. This may express a moral, irony, or bittersweet truth rather than a direct lesson. The text should be concise, legible, and emotionally connected to the scene.

Use a classic 19th-century storybook illustration style inspired by delicate engravings, soft watercolor washes, or romantic ink drawings. The tone should feel whimsical, emotional, and slightly melancholic rather than comedic or dark. Keep the composition symbolic, gentle, and clearly readable on a small screen. The final image should feel like a complete, intact page from a Hans Christian Andersen fairy tale book.

name: HAPPY HOLIDAYS
message: Take a picture and place the subject in a festive holiday-themed scene based on the closest holiday to the current date. Dress the subject in holiday-appropriate attire: for Christmas, an ugly Christmas sweater; Halloween, a generic costume; 4th of July, an Uncle Sam outfit; Oktoberfest, lederhosen; Thanksgiving, a Pilgrim outfit; Easter, a bunny outfit; New Year’s, a baby’s diaper or Father Time clothing with hourglass; Valentine’s Day, a Cupid outfit with bow and heart arrow; St. Patrick’s Day, a Leprechaun outfit; Cinco de Mayo, a Mexican sombrero. Integrate the subject naturally into a scene reflecting the holiday’s environment, decorations, and mood. Generate a humorous or festive holiday message caption based on the chosen holiday. Preserve facial identity, proportions, and personality while making the scene photorealistic, vibrant, and lively.

name: HAPPY MEAL PROMO
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a featured kids’ fast-food meal toy promotion inspired by classic Happy Meal–style campaigns.

Present the subject as a small, inexpensive plastic toy figure with simplified proportions, glossy molded surfaces, visible seams, and limited articulation. The figure should clearly look like a real mass-produced kids’ meal toy — slightly stiff, charmingly cheap, and intentionally basic — not a cartoon illustration or realistic figurine.

The image MUST include a fully visible kids’ meal box in the frame. The box should be front-facing and unmistakable, with recognizable fast-food kids’ meal proportions (folded cardboard box with handle or clamshell shape). The toy should appear either:
• displayed in front of the box, or
• pictured on the box artwork itself, or
• shown as part of a promotional display alongside the box

Design the scene as a complete toy promotion image with everything fully visible and uncropped. Include:
• the kids’ meal box with bold colors and playful graphics
• a toy name or toy series title inspired by the subject
• an overly enthusiastic promotional phrase (e.g., "Only in Kids’ Meals!", "Fun Inside!", "Playtime Included!")
• optional callouts like "Collect Them All!" or "Limited Time"

The toy’s pose, accessories, or expression should be humorously derived from the subject’s real traits, clothing, posture, or environment.

Avoid using real fast-food brand logos unless explicitly provided via external master prompt. Instead, evoke a generic fast-food kids’ meal aesthetic through color, layout, typography, and packaging style.

Ensure the entire kids’ meal box, toy, and promotional elements are fully visible and readable on a small screen. The final image should feel nostalgic, playful, slightly tacky, and instantly recognizable as a classic kids’ fast-food toy promotion from the 1990s–2000s.

name: HAUNTED EPITAPH
message: Take a picture and transform it into a playful, haunted graveyard scene inspired by classic theme-park haunted mansion aesthetics. Depict the subject as a stylized carved portrait, bust, or ghostly cameo associated with a decorative tombstone or memorial plaque, without implying real death. Create a humorous rhyming epitaph in the spirit of whimsical haunted mansion gravestones, using clever wordplay and flavor text inspired by the subject’s appearance, personality, clothing, or surroundings. Ensure the full rhyming epitaph is clearly visible and readable within the image. Use atmospheric lighting, fog, moonlight, and ornate stonework to create a spooky-but-fun tone. Keep the overall mood lighthearted, imaginative, and theatrical rather than dark or morbid.  The result should be a full view of the epitaph with a relevant background behind the epitaph.

name: HEADLESS
message:
Take a picture and create the illusion that the subject is headless and holding their own severed head — presented clearly as a theatrical magic effect, not an injury.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• This is a classic stage illusion or visual trick
• The subject's body appears HEADLESS - there is NO HEAD on the shoulders
• The subject is holding their own head in their hands
• NO violence, NO injury, NO harm - this is theatrical magic
• The effect must feel playful, clever, and impossible

BODY PRESENTATION (CRITICAL - HIGHEST PRIORITY):
• The subject's body must be COMPLETELY HEADLESS
• There must be NO HEAD attached to the neck/shoulders
• The body stands upright without a head on top
• DO NOT show the subject with their head still attached
• DO NOT show a full complete person holding an extra head
• The body must appear to be missing its head entirely

HEAD BEING HELD (CRITICAL):
• The subject is holding their own severed head in their hands
• The held head is positioned at waist or chest height
• The held head appears calm, neutral, or mildly amused
• The head being held is the ONLY head visible in the image
• No blood, no wounds, no exposed anatomy on the held head

NECK AREA TREATMENT (CRITICAL):
• Where the head should be (top of shoulders/neck) must be cleanly obscured
• Use theatrical methods to hide the neck opening:
  – High collar that covers where neck meets shoulders
  – Draped fabric, cloak, or scarf covering the shoulder/neck area
  – Shadow or darkness obscuring the top of the torso
  – Costume neckline that conceals the separation point
• The concealment must look intentional and theatrical
• DO NOT show raw neck stump, flesh, blood, or gore
• The body must look intact below the neck - just headless

POSE & COMPOSITION:
• Headless body stands normally, holding the head naturally
• The head is oriented upright in the hands — not limp or graphic
• Body posture remains relaxed and confident
• The subject appears to be calmly presenting their own head

STYLE & REALISM:
• Photorealistic or cinematic
• Clean illusion — no gore artifacts
• Lighting must match between held head and headless body
• The illusion should feel deliberate and staged like a magic trick

TONE:
• Whimsical and theatrical
• Playful surrealism
• Classic magic-show energy (like a stage magician's trick)
• Not scary, not disturbing
• Impressive and impossible

ABSOLUTE PROHIBITIONS:
• DO NOT show the subject with a head still on their shoulders
• DO NOT show a complete person holding an additional head
• DO NOT show two heads (one attached, one held)
• No blood
• No wounds
• No exposed flesh or gore
• No horror framing
• No shock imagery
• No graphic severing depiction

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must show a HEADLESS body (no head on shoulders) holding its own severed head at waist/chest level, with the neck area cleanly obscured by costume/fabric. This should look like a clever theatrical stage illusion — magical, surreal, and visually impressive without any suggestion of violence or injury. The subject appears to be a headless person calmly presenting their own detached head as a magic trick.

name: HEAD SHOT
message:
Take a picture of the subject and turn it into a professional actor’s head shot.

Use a clean studio background, flattering lighting, and a confident or dramatic pose.

Use external master prompt text to supply an actor name and optional flavor text.

Add a humorous talent list next to or under the portrait, including strange or ridiculous talents no one would normally list, such as 'Expert at Awkward Silence', 'Professional Stand-up Philosopher', or 'Can Cry on Command When Pulling a Nose Hair'.

The final result should look like a real casting profile with a ridiculous twist.

name: HENRY DANGER
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into Henry Danger.

CORE RULE:
• The subject must be wearing the full Henry Danger costume
• The subject’s face replaces Henry Danger’s face under the mask

FACE INTEGRATION:
• The mask must fit the subject’s facial structure
• The face must look like it belongs to the character

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like the subject IS Henry Danger in costume, not a face overlay.

name: HIDDEN DETAILS
message: Take a picture and transform the image so subtle hidden elements are embedded. Viewer should discover details only after close inspection.

name: HIEROGLYPHICS
message:
Take a picture and completely transform it into ancient Egyptian hieroglyphic art - the subject and ALL surrounding objects must be converted into hieroglyphic pictograms and symbols.

CRITICAL - SUBJECT RECOGNITION:
• Subject's face features MUST be recognizable in hieroglyphic form
• Preserve subject's eye shape, nose shape, mouth, facial proportions
• Subject's hair style and color reflected in hieroglyphic representation
• Subject's unique facial characteristics visible in Egyptian artistic style
• This is the SUBJECT rendered as hieroglyphic art, not a generic Egyptian figure
• Someone should be able to recognize the subject from the hieroglyphic face

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• EVERYTHING in the image becomes hieroglyphics - no photographic elements remain
• Subject is NOT a photo with hieroglyphics around them
• Subject IS hieroglyphic symbols representing them
• Complete transformation into ancient Egyptian pictographic writing system

HIEROGLYPHIC CONVERSION:
• Subject's face represented as Egyptian profile view (side-facing head, frontal eye)
• Subject's FACIAL FEATURES adapted to hieroglyphic style:
  - Eye shape matches subject's actual eye shape (almond, round, etc.)
  - Nose profile matches subject's nose (straight, hooked, small, large)
  - Mouth reflects subject's lips (full, thin, etc.)
  - Eyebrow shape matches subject's brows
  - Chin and jaw line reflect subject's facial structure
• Subject's HAIR rendered in hieroglyphic style:
  - Hair color preserved in paint color choice
  - Hair length shown (short, long, curly rendered as textured)
  - Hairstyle suggested in Egyptian wig or natural hair symbols
• Subject's body shown in Egyptian artistic convention (shoulders frontal, legs profile)
• Clothing as simplified hieroglyphic symbols
• ALL objects converted to their hieroglyphic equivalents:
  - Person → human figure glyph (but with subject's features)
  - Animal → animal pictogram
  - Object → simplified symbol representation
  - Background → papyrus reed, sun disk, water, sand symbols

EGYPTIAN ARTISTIC STYLE:
• Flat 2D representation with no perspective
• Profile heads with frontal eyes
• Shoulders shown frontally while body in profile
• Register lines (horizontal divisions)
• Subject composed of hieroglyphic symbols BUT with individual features
• Scale represents importance (larger = more important)
• Color palette: ochre, red, blue, green, black, white
• Subject's skin tone influences paint color choice

SURFACE OPTIONS:
• Stone monument - carved relief hieroglyphics on temple wall or stela
• Papyrus scroll - painted hieroglyphics on aged papyrus background
• Tomb wall - painted plaster with hieroglyphic scene
• Obelisk - carved symbols on granite

HIEROGLYPHIC ELEMENTS:
• Cartouches (oval frames) containing names
• Standard hieroglyphic symbols: ankh, was scepter, djed pillar, eye of Horus
• Human figures in Egyptian artistic canon (but individualized)
• Animal symbols: falcon, ibis, jackal, scarab, cobra
• Nature symbols: sun disk, papyrus, lotus, water
• Directional symbols (reading right to left or left to right)

TEXTURE & AGING:
• Stone: carved relief with chisel marks, weathering, age patina
• Papyrus: fibrous texture, age spots, yellowing, slight tears
• Paint: faded ancient pigments, flaking in places
• Depth: raised or sunken relief carving

COLORS:
• Egyptian blue (calcium copper silicate)
• Red ochre
• Yellow ochre
• Green (malachite)
• Black (carbon)
• White (gypsum)
• Gold leaf accents for important elements
• Subject's natural coloring influences color choices:
  - Hair color → paint color for hair
  - Skin tone → choice of ochre shade
  - Eye color → paint color for eyes

COMPOSITION:
• Register system (horizontal rows)
• Important figures larger than less important ones
• Text and image integrated
• Symmetrical or formal arrangement
• Hieroglyphic text may frame the scene
• Cartouches for names or titles

INDIVIDUALIZATION (CRITICAL):
• Subject's face shows their unique features in Egyptian style:
  - Distinctive nose shape preserved
  - Eye shape characteristic to subject
  - Face shape (round, oval, square) visible
  - Hair length and color represented
  - Facial hair if present (beard, mustache) shown
• Subject recognizable even in flat hieroglyphic style
• Not a generic Egyptian - this is specifically the subject

AUTHENTICITY:
• Follow Egyptian artistic conventions strictly
• NO photorealistic elements
• Subject completely transformed into hieroglyphic representation
• Looks like actual ancient Egyptian art
• Could be from tomb of pharaoh or temple wall
• Individual features preserved within artistic style

STYLE PERIODS (can vary):
• Old Kingdom (pyramid builders)
• Middle Kingdom (classical period)
• New Kingdom (Tutankhamun era)
• Ptolemaic (Greek-influenced)

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject and entire scene completely transformed into authentic ancient Egyptian hieroglyphic art - carved on stone or painted on papyrus - with the subject represented as hieroglyphic pictograms following Egyptian artistic conventions BUT with the subject's individual facial features, hair, and characteristics CLEARLY RECOGNIZABLE in the hieroglyphic style so that someone could identify this as the specific subject rendered in Egyptian art, NOT a generic pharaoh or Egyptian figure.

name: HISTORY
message: Take a picture and place the subject seamlessly into a historical event that occurred on the date specified externally. Preserve the subject’s facial features, clothing, and posture while adapting them naturally to the historical setting, lighting, and perspective. Ensure the subject interacts believably with the environment, props, or people in the scene so they appear as an authentic part of the moment. Make the final image photorealistic and historically accurate, with no elements appearing out of place.

name: HITCHCOCK FILM
message: Take a picture and place the subject into an iconic Alfred Hitchcock thriller scene.

options.text: Psycho (Bates Motel, shadowy Victorian house, shower scene tension, birds overhead)
Vertigo (bell tower spiral staircase, San Francisco rooftops, vertiginous heights, dream sequences)
North by Northwest (Mount Rushmore, crop duster field, Grand Central Station, train)
Rear Window (apartment courtyard view, binoculars perspective, Greenwich Village windows)
The Birds (Bodega Bay, bird attacks, telephone wires covered in crows, schoolyard)
Rope (single apartment room, continuous shot aesthetic, dinner party tension)
Dial M for Murder (elegant London apartment, telephone, key under stair carpet)
Strangers on a Train (carousel, tennis court, train compartment, crossing paths)
Rebecca (Manderley mansion, gothic corridors, coastal cliffs, shadowy interiors)
Notorious (wine cellar key scene, Rio de Janeiro mansion, uranium ore)
Saboteur (Statue of Liberty, Radio City Music Hall, factory sabotage)
Shadow of a Doubt (small-town America, family home, train station)
Spellbound (ski slope, surreal dream sequence, psychiatric clinic)
The Man Who Knew Too Much (Marrakech market, Royal Albert Hall, embassy)
Frenzy (Covent Garden, London streets, necktie murders, potato truck)

name: HITCHHIKING GHOST
message: Take a picture and add a translucent, friendly ghostly spirit standing or sitting NEXT TO the subject — inspired by classic attraction hitchhiking spirits.

options.text: The Traveler — Tall, thin ghost wearing a top hat and formal Victorian coat, carrying a carpetbag or travel satchel, cheerful grinning expression, distinguished gentleman appearance

The Skeleton — Short, rotund ghost in a prison-style striped shirt and bowler hat, holding his own head tucked under one arm (head is still attached but posed as if detachable), mischievous playful grin
The Old Man — Elderly ghost with wild white beard and hair, wearing tattered old-fashioned clothing, leaning on a cane or walking stick, curious friendly expression

name: HOARDERS
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a scene from the reality show 'Hoarders' with the subject surrounded by extreme clutter and accumulated items.

The subject should be standing or sitting in the middle of a severely cluttered room filled floor-to-ceiling with piles of stuff: stacks of newspapers and magazines, boxes overflowing with items, bags of belongings, old furniture piled up, random objects everywhere, narrow pathways through the clutter. The mess should be overwhelming and chaotic.

Items can be themed for humor: all garden gnomes, excessive craft supplies, thousands of fast food condiment packets, walls of VHS tapes, mountains of beanie babies, or traditional hoarding clutter. Make it densely packed and overwhelming.

The subject's expression should show they see nothing wrong with the situation - casual, defensive, or attached to their items. Clothing can be casual or slightly disheveled.

Lighting should match reality TV documentary style - natural indoor lighting, slightly dim, authentic and unglamorous. The scene should feel claustrophobic with limited space to move.

Optional elements: Concerned family member visible in background looking horrified, professional organizer or therapist trying to help, pets navigating through the clutter, visible dust or cobwebs adding to the neglected atmosphere.

The final image should look like an actual still from the Hoarders TV show - overwhelming clutter, reality TV documentary aesthetic, raw and authentic. The humor comes from the absurd amount of stuff and the subject's obliviousness to the extreme situation. Photorealistic with proper lighting and that specific reality TV look.

name: HOLE-Y COSTUME
message: Take a picture and place the subject's face through a novelty costume hole, transforming them into an inanimate object.

options.text: Hot Dog - bun, wiener, mustard/ketchup, face is the person eating it
Pizza Slice - triangular slice, pepperoni, melted cheese, face as pizza lover
Orange - giant round orange, citrus texture, face as orange picker/vendor
Toilet - porcelain toilet, face coming out of bowl, plumber or "throne" humor
Banana - yellow curved banana, peeled, face as monkey or person holding it
Ice Cream Cone - waffle cone, melting ice cream, face as ice cream eater
Donut - frosted donut with sprinkles, face as donut cop or lover
Hamburger - bun, patty, lettuce, cheese, face as burger enthusiast
Taco - shell, meat, lettuce, cheese, face as taco Tuesday fan
Beer Mug - frothy beer, glass mug, face as drinker toasting
Wine Bottle - wine bottle, label, face as sommelier or wine drinker
Coffee Cup - steaming coffee, mug, face as caffeine addict
Popcorn Box - movie theater popcorn, red and white striped, face eating popcorn
Birthday Cake - layered cake, candles, frosting, face as birthday person
Watermelon - sliced watermelon, red fruit, black seeds, face taking bite
Pumpkin - jack-o'-lantern carved pumpkin, face is the carved face
Strawberry - giant red strawberry, seeds, green top, face as berry picker
Cupcake - frosted cupcake, sprinkles, wrapper, face as baker or eater
Cheese Wedge - Swiss or cheddar cheese with holes, face as mouse or cheese lover
Apple - red apple, bite taken out, face as apple eater

name: HOPPER
message: Take a picture and transform it into a scene inspired by Edward Hopper. Preserve the photographic framing but simplify forms and use strong directional lighting. Emphasize isolation, stillness, and quiet atmosphere. Colors should be muted and shadows deliberate. The final image should feel contemplative and emotionally distant.

name: HOROSCOPE
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a deliberately silly horoscope-style image.

Determine the subject’s astrological sign based on externally provided input or infer one arbitrarily if none is supplied. Clearly display the astrological sign name and symbol.

Write ONE short horoscope message based on the subject’s visible traits, expression, posture, clothing, or situation. The horoscope must be humorous, blunt, and confidently ridiculous — it should sound specific, obvious, and completely unserious.

Use flavor text to exaggerate mundane or trivial traits (e.g., procrastination, overconfidence, distraction, stubbornness) as if they are unavoidable cosmic truths. Avoid mystical language, poetic ambiguity, or generic fortune-cookie phrasing.

Include a clearly labeled "Lucky Number" that is intentionally useless, impractical, or meaningless (e.g., decimals, extremely large numbers, fractions, timestamps, negative numbers, or oddly specific values). The lucky number must not be applicable to gambling, dates, clocks, or real-world decisions.

Compose the image like a fake astrology card or newspaper horoscope box. Keep the layout clean, bold, and readable on a small screen. Ensure the full card, sign, horoscope text, and lucky number are fully visible.

Do not explain the joke. Do not add disclaimers. Treat the horoscope as completely accurate, no matter how absurd.

name: HORROR FILMS
message: Take a picture of the subject and place them into a scene from a classic horror film.

name: I'M HUNGRY
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a figure entirely made out of real, non-candy food items (vegetables, fruits, grains, bread, pasta, cheese, etc.). Preserve recognizable features, proportions, and posture while rendering them in edible textures — e.g., eyes made of olives, hair as leafy greens, clothing patterns from colorful produce. Avoid candy or chocolate elements.

Place the food figure in a simple, neutral background such as a kitchen counter, plate, or wooden surface, with natural lighting and subtle shadows to make it appear tangible and realistic. Ensure the entire subject is fully visible.

Add playful flavor text to the scene automatically based on the subject, like 'Dinner is served!' or 'Eat your vegetables!' or allow the user to append a custom message via master prompt.

The final image should feel whimsical, absurd, humorous, and clearly readable on small screens, emphasizing the creativity of using ordinary food items to replicate the subject.

name: I'M WITH STOOPID
message:
Take a picture and transform it so one subject appears to be wearing an 'I'm with Stoopid' t-shirt that looks physically printed on the fabric, not digitally overlaid. The shirt should include natural folds, fabric texture, slight ink distortion, and perspective warping so the design follows the body realistically.

If only one subject is detected, display the text 'I'm with Stoopid' with a single large arrow pointing upward toward the wearer’s own head.

If two or more subjects are detected, place the shirt on the primary subject and display the text 'I'm with Stoopid' with one or more arrows pointing sideways or diagonally toward the other visible subjects. Arrows should clearly indicate the other subjects without overlapping faces.

Ensure the text and arrows remain bold, high-contrast, and legible on small screens while maintaining a believable printed-shirt appearance. Preserve lighting consistency, fabric shading, and natural wrinkles so the shirt feels worn, not pasted.

name: I AM WITH THE BAND
message: Take a picture and place the subject as a member of a famous singer’s band or musical group. Preserve the subject’s facial features, personality, and clothing while transforming them into a musician integrated into the ensemble. The subject should be holding or playing a musical instrument appropriate to the scene (guitar, drums, keyboard, etc.) and positioned naturally among other group members. Capture stage lighting, performance energy, and the dynamic interaction of a live or recorded music setting. Ensure the subject remains clearly identifiable while fully integrated into the famous singer’s group performance.

name: ICE SCULPTURE
message: Take a picture and make subject into an ice sculpture. The sculpture has the clarity and sparkle of ice, often enhanced by lighting, to showcase its form. Clear, chiseled ice with internal refraction.

name: ICONIC FILM LOCATION
message:
CONTENT INTENT: This is a harmless tourist photography scenario showing the subject visiting real-world filming locations as a fan. No trespassing, no illegal activity, no restricted access - this is public tourism and sightseeing at famous locations that welcome visitors.

Take a picture and place the subject at a real-world, iconic movie or TV filming location — as if they personally visited the site and took a casual tourist selfie.
