name: IF YOU THINK IT'S TRUE, IT'S SNOT
message:
Take a picture and transform it into one of two embarrassing nasal situations - RANDOMLY CHOOSE ONE:

OPTION 1 - VISIBLE BOOGERS: The subject is completely unaware they have visible nasal discharge (boogers) hanging from or under their nose. Add realistic mucus visible at the nostrils - it could be hanging, crusty, or dripping slightly. The subject's expression must show they are completely oblivious - looking normal, happy, confident, or engaged in conversation. They think everything is fine, making the situation more awkward and humorous.

OPTION 2 - NOSE PICKING: The subject is actively picking their nose with their finger inserted into their nostril. They are completely absorbed in the act, unaware they're being photographed. The finger should be realistically positioned in the nose with appropriate hand placement. Their expression should show concentration or absent-minded focus on the task. This could be in a public setting, during a meeting, in a car, or any situation where nose-picking would be particularly inappropriate.

For both options: Include optional context that makes it worse - professional setting (meeting, presentation, date, interview), talking to someone, or what they think is a nice photo opportunity.

Keep lighting and photography photorealistic. The humor comes from either the subject's obliviousness to the visible boogers OR being caught in the act of nose-picking.

Preserve recognizable facial features while adding the unfortunate nasal situation.

name: IGOR
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a full comedic homage to Igor from *Young Frankenstein*, embracing exaggerated, over-the-top Mel Brooks–style physical comedy.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• The transformation is intentionally extreme and funny
• The subject remains human, not monstrous
• The humor must read instantly, even at a glance

EYE TRANSFORMATION (CRITICAL — NON-NEGOTIABLE):
• BOTH eyes must remain present
• Eyes must be dramatically bulging and protruding
• One eye must bulge more than the other
• Eyes may point in slightly different directions
• Large areas of visible sclera (eye whites)
• Eyelids stretched wide in an unblinking stare
• Eye placement must feel ridiculous but still attached to the face

FACIAL SUPPORTING FEATURES:
• Eyebrows raised unevenly to enhance asymmetry
• Subtle cheek tension or jaw slackness
• Mouth slightly open or lopsided, suggesting clueless enthusiasm

STRICT PROHIBITIONS:
• NO extra eyes
• NO removal of eyes
• NO glowing, fantasy colors, or supernatural effects
• NO scars, bolts, stitches, or monster makeup
• NO hunchbacks or body deformation

COMEDY & REALISM BALANCE:
• The face may stretch or compress slightly to support the gag
• Skin texture must remain realistic
• Lighting and shadows must match the original photo
• The image should still resemble a real photograph

SUBJECT BEHAVIOR:
• Expression conveys cheerful confusion or eager obedience
• The subject appears unaware of how absurd they look
• No deliberate mugging for the camera

STYLE:
• Photorealistic with exaggerated expression
• No cartoon rendering
• No illustration or animation style

TONE:
• Broad physical comedy
• Goofy, lovable, and unmistakably Mel Brooks
• Big laughs, not subtle unease

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must look like a real photograph of a person whose face has been pushed into full Mel Brooks comedy territory — with wildly bulging, uneven eyes and a blissfully confused expression — instantly recognizable as an Igor-style gag without turning into a monster or cartoon.

name: IKEA INSTRUCTION MANUAL
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into an illustrated instruction manual page, similar to a flat-pack assembly guide. Depict simplified, diagram-style versions of the subject in multiple steps, showing how the subject is assembled or functions. Use clean line art, minimal colors, arrows, step numbers, icons, and humorous warning symbols inspired by the subject’s personality, clothing, or posture. Avoid text-heavy explanations; rely on visual storytelling and pictograms. Present the final image as a complete instruction manual page with a clean layout and playful, clever tone.

name: INANIMATE INSANITY
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into an expressive cartoon object-character inspired by Inanimate Insanity.

STYLE & CHARACTER RULES:
• The subject becomes a sentient object with a face
• Simple shapes with thick outlines
• Bright, saturated colors
• Include multiple competing object-characters surrounding the subject

SCENE & TONE:
• Competitive, energetic, and chaotic
• Simple abstract or game-like environments
• Exaggerated expressions and poses

The final image should look like a fully composed Inanimate Insanity–style hand-drawn illustration with the subject and additional characters integrated seamlessly into the world.

name: INEBRIATED DECISION
message:
Take a picture of the subject and depict them in a photorealistic scenario where they appear clearly inebriated and making a poor decision while being observed by an authority figure.

INEBRIATION TYPE (SUBTLE BUT CLEAR):
• Subject may appear impaired due to alcohol or recreational drugs
• Signs may include poor balance, sloppy posture, unfocused eyes, delayed reactions, or inappropriate confidence
• Avoid exaggerated cartoon drunkenness

SCENARIO SETUP (CRITICAL):
• Subject must be actively doing something ill-advised, embarrassing, or obviously stupid
• Examples include arguing poorly, oversharing, attempting a bad explanation, fumbling an object, or violating obvious social norms

OBSERVER ROLE:
• Include a nearby authority figure such as a police officer, security guard, boss, teacher, or supervisor
• The observer must be clearly sober
• Facial expression should communicate disappointment, disbelief, concern, or restrained judgment

ENVIRONMENT AND REALISM:
• Scene must remain grounded in a believable real-world setting
• Lighting, shadows, and perspective must be consistent
• Natural body language and facial expressions
• No slapstick or surreal elements

TONE:
• Humor comes from realism and social tension
• Mild cringe or secondhand embarrassment
• Not mean-spirited or grotesque

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a candid photograph capturing a regrettable moment where the subject is clearly impaired, making a poor decision, and being silently judged by an authority figure.

name: INFINITY MIRROR
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject's face and torso into an infinity mirror art installation like a decorative Christmas mirror.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• Subject's FACE made of colored LED light strips forming facial features
• Subject's TORSO is the infinity mirror (two-way mirror cavity with endless depth)
• This is a physical light sculpture, NOT a glowing person
• Looks like a decorative infinity mirror art piece

FACE CONSTRUCTION:
• Facial features outlined with thin LED light strips:
  - Eyes: circular or almond LED outlines
  - Eyebrows: curved LED strips above eyes
  - Nose: triangular or linear LED outline
  - Mouth: curved LED smile or expression
  - Face outline: oval LED border defining face shape
• LED colors: RGB multicolor, single color, or color-changing
• Neon-style thin tube lights or LED strip lights
• Face remains recognizable through LED feature placement
• Features glow brightly against dark background

TORSO INFINITY MIRROR:
• Chest/torso area is a rectangular or oval two-way mirror cavity
• Mirror shows infinite repeating depth tunnel
• LED lights from face features reflect infinitely into torso mirror
• Endless repetition visible - lights repeating smaller and smaller into infinity
• Dark mirror glass with glowing LED reflections
• Depth illusion - tunnel going back forever
• Reflections of LED outlines multiplying into distance

INFINITY EFFECT:
• Two parallel mirrors creating infinite reflection loop
• LED lights appear to recede into endless distance
• Each reflection smaller than the last
• Glowing tunnel effect
• Geometric precision in repetition
• Visual illusion of infinite space

LED LIGHT CHARACTERISTICS:
• Thin neon-style tubes or LED strips
• Bright vibrant colors (blue, pink, purple, green, red, white)
• Glowing against darkness
• Clean precise lines
• Modern art installation aesthetic
• Christmas decoration infinity mirror style

CONSTRUCTION:
• Appears as physical art installation
• Frame or mounting visible
• Two-way mirror glass visible in torso
• LED wiring suggested but not messy
• Professional gallery-quality fabrication
• Wall-mounted or free-standing sculpture

SETTING:
• Dark room or black background
• Gallery or art installation space
• Minimal ambient lighting
• LEDs are primary light source
• Subject stands out against darkness
• Could be in modern home as décor

STYLE:
• Modern art installation photography
• Contemporary light art
• Yayoi Kusama or James Turrell influence
• Clean minimalist aesthetic
• High-tech artistic
• Photorealistic physical sculpture

COLORS:
• Vibrant LED colors against black
• RGB multicolor or monochromatic
• Neon aesthetic
• High contrast
• Glowing and luminous

SCALE & PROPORTION:
• Life-sized or larger than life
• Face proportions maintained in LED outlines
• Torso area clearly defined as mirror cavity
• Human-scale art installation

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject transformed into a physical infinity mirror art installation with their face outlined in colored LED light strips (eyes, nose, mouth, face shape) and their torso as a two-way mirror cavity showing infinite depth with the LED reflections repeating endlessly - looking like a modern decorative Christmas infinity mirror sculpture photographed in a dark gallery space.

name: INFLATABLE POOL TOY
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a single, continuous inflatable pool toy. The subject’s entire body, including the head and face, must be made of inflated vinyl material — the subject is the pool float itself, not wearing or sitting in one.

Render the face as part of the inflatable surface with printed or molded features, subtle distortions, and glossy reflections consistent with air-filled vinyl. Include seams, air valves, and slight shape irregularities.

Place the inflatable subject floating in water or resting poolside. Use realistic reflections, highlights, and water interaction. Ensure the entire inflatable is fully visible and readable on a small screen.

name: INFRARED
message: Take a picture and transform the image into infrared photography. Bright foliage, dark skies. Surreal tonal contrast.

name: INKBLOT
message: Take a picture in the style of an inkblot-style artwork. Abstract symmetry, flowing ink forms on paper.

name: INSIDE OUT
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject so that their internal structures are fully visible while the subject remains completely intact and undamaged.

CRITICAL — NO INJURY OR DAMAGE:
• Subject is NOT cut open
• No wounds, blood, tears, or breaks
• Skin appears transparent or selectively absent
• Internal systems visible as if revealed by science, not trauma
• The subject is whole, alive, and structurally intact

INTERNAL VISIBILITY:
• Reveal internal anatomy aligned perfectly with the subject’s body
• Organs, skeleton, muscles, or internal systems shown in correct positions
• Nothing displaced, removed, or distorted
• Internal structures appear suspended naturally inside the body
• Exterior form remains complete and undamaged

SYSTEM SELECTION:
• AI may reveal one or more systems:
  - Skeletal
  - Muscular
  - Circulatory
  - Nervous
  - Respiratory
  - Digestive
• Systems must be anatomically accurate
• Multiple systems may overlap cleanly without clutter

VISUAL STYLE:
• Clean scientific visualization
• Medical illustration or museum exhibit aesthetic
• No horror or gore
• Calm, neutral, educational tone
• Subtle lighting to distinguish layers

TRANSPARENCY LOGIC:
• Skin may be semi-transparent, glass-like, or softly faded
• Internal elements clearly visible through exterior
• No harsh cutaway edges
• No glowing fantasy effects unless subtle and educational

SUBJECT RECOGNITION:
• Subject’s identity remains recognizable through silhouette, posture, and proportions
• Face remains intact and identifiable
• Eyes and expression preserved

BACKGROUND:
• Simple studio, gradient, or neutral environment
• Background must not distract from anatomy
• Subject remains central and fully visible

NOT ALLOWED:
• Surgery imagery
• X-ray clichés
• Horror aesthetics
• Exploded or separated body parts
• Any implication of pain or injury

FINAL RESULT:
The image should depict the subject fully intact while their internal anatomy is clearly visible and anatomically accurate, appearing as a seamless scientific reveal rather than damage — a calm, educational visualization where exterior and interior coexist naturally in a single complete figure.

name: INTERVENTION
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a scene from the reality show 'Intervention' where family and friends confront someone about a problem.

The subject should be seated, looking shocked, defensive, emotional, or in denial. Surround them with concerned family members and friends sitting in a semicircle, all looking serious and worried. Include an intervention specialist or counselor present.

Setting should be a modest living room or community center room with folding chairs arranged in intervention style. Lighting should match reality TV documentary style - slightly dim, handheld camera aesthetic, authentic and raw.

Optional humorous details: Instead of serious addiction, the intervention could be for ridiculous obsessions like 'collecting too many throw pillows,' 'excessive karaoke,' 'TikTok addiction,' 'spending too much on craft supplies,' or 'won't stop talking about their fantasy football team.'

Include tissues boxes visible, people holding letters they've written, emotional expressions of concern from family members. The subject should look caught off guard, emotional, or stubbornly defensive.

The aesthetic should match reality TV confessional style with that specific documentary lighting and framing. Optional: Include text overlay at bottom like reality shows use - 'Day 1 of Intervention' or subject's name and their 'problem.'

The final image should look like an actual still frame from the Intervention TV show - emotional, raw, documentary style, capturing that specific reality TV aesthetic. Make it photorealistic but the humor comes from either the absurd reason for intervention or the over-the-top dramatic reactions.

name: iPHONE CAMERA
message: Take a picture and transform it into an early smartphone camera photo. Use soft focus, blown highlights, muted colors, and slight motion blur. The subject should feel casual, imperfect, and authentically early-mobile.

name: IS IT CAKE?
message: Take a picture and transform the subject so it appears to be a realistic hyper-detailed cake. The subject should retain recognizable features but clearly be made of cake, frosting, fondant, and icing textures. Optionally show a slice cut out or a knife mid-cut revealing cake layers inside.

name: ISLAMIC MINIATURE
message: Take a picture and transform the picture into an Islamic miniature style painting. Flattened perspective, decorative borders, fine line work, intricate patterns, and vivid colors.

name: ISOMETRIC
message:
Take a picture and completely reconstruct the scene using strict isometric projection.

All elements must be viewed from a fixed isometric angle (approximately 30–45 degrees) with no vanishing points, no perspective convergence, and no camera lens distortion. Parallel lines must remain parallel.

Rebuild the scene as simplified geometric forms aligned to an isometric grid. Convert subjects, objects, and environments into clean, block-like or planar shapes while preserving recognizable proportions and silhouettes.

Depth must be represented only through isometric extrusion, vertical offsets, overlap, and stacking — not through blur, bokeh, or atmospheric effects.

Use consistent lighting and shading across all surfaces to reinforce form and depth. Shadows should be crisp, directional, and uniform, matching the isometric angle.

Surface detail should be simplified or removed. Avoid photographic textures, skin pores, fabric weave, or noise. Favor smooth, stylized surfaces suitable for a game map, architectural diagram, or technical illustration.

The final image should resemble a high-quality isometric game environment or design diagram — clean, readable, geometric, and clearly structured. Ensure the entire scene fits within the frame and remains legible on a small screen.

name: JAVERT PHOTOBOMB
message: Take a picture and add in the background Russell Crowe as Javert from Les Miserable photobombing the subject. Match lighting realistically.

name: JAPANESE SUMI-E
message: Take a picture and transform the image into Japanese sumi-e ink painting. Minimal brushstrokes, expressive ink flow, restrained composition, and elegant simplicity.

name: JEDI FORCE GHOSTS
message: Take a picture and transform the subject(s) into Jedi Force Ghosts - glowing blue apparitions.

name: JIM DAVIS STYLE
message:
Take a picture and transform the image into the artistic style of Garfield and U.S. Acres animation.

GARFIELD/U.S. ACRES STYLE (CRITICAL):
• Clean, simple cartoon line work
• Bright, flat colors
• Rounded, friendly character designs
• Comic strip aesthetic
• Bold black outlines
• Garfield/U.S. Acres style illustration
• Warm, appealing color palette

SUBJECT TRANSFORMATION:
• Subject drawn in Garfield cartooning style
• Simple, rounded features
• Large expressive eyes
• Friendly, accessible design
• Clean line work
• Subject's face recognizable but cartooned
• Anthropomorphic if appropriate

COLOR PALETTE:
• Bright, cheerful colors
• Flat color fills (no gradients)
• Orange, red, blue, green primaries
• Garfield-style warm tones
• Clean color separation
• Comic strip printing style

BACKGROUND:
• Simple environments
• Minimal detail backgrounds
• Often domestic settings (kitchen, living room, yard)
• Clean, uncluttered
• Comic strip panel aesthetic
• May include other cartoon characters or pets

ADDITIONAL CHARACTERS:
• Other characters in Garfield style
• Could include cat, dog, or other animals
• Anthropomorphic cartoon animals
• Human characters in simplified cartoon form
• All in unified style

COMIC STRIP ELEMENTS:
• Could be single panel or three-panel strip
• Panel borders visible
• Thought bubbles or speech balloons
• Simple background patterns
• Household objects simplified

HUMOR STYLE:
• Light, family-friendly comedy
• Observational humor
• Character-based jokes
• Relatable domestic situations
• G-rated content

LINE WORK:
• Bold, confident outlines
• Consistent line weight
• Clean, professional inking
• Rounded, friendly shapes
• No sketchy or rough lines

CHARACTER DESIGN:
• Simplified anatomy
• Exaggerated expressions
• Large eyes for emotion
• Rounded body shapes
• Appealing, non-threatening

FINAL RESULT:
The final image should look like a fully composed Garfield/U.S. Acres hand-drawn illustration with the subject and additional characters integrated seamlessly into the world - featuring clean line work, bright flat colors, rounded friendly character design, and that distinctive comic strip aesthetic.

name: JOHANNES VERMEER
message: Take a picture a make it into a vibrant, painterly portrait into a Dutch Golden Age portrait inspired by Vermeer. Soft window lighting, rich detail, oil paint texture, calm atmosphere.

name: JOSÉ GUADALUPE POSADA — CALAVERA ENGRAVING
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a José Guadalupe Posada–style calavera engraving.

The entire image must be rendered as a traditional Mexican relief print / engraving — as if carved into metal or wood and printed with ink.

STYLE REQUIREMENTS (CRITICAL):
• Black ink on off-white or aged paper
• High-contrast linework only — NO color
• Cross-hatching, stippling, and carved line textures
• Uneven ink density, imperfect registration, and hand-printed imperfections

SUBJECT TRANSFORMATION:
• Transform the subject into a calavera (skeletal figure) rendered in Posada’s satirical style
• Preserve the subject’s posture, clothing silhouette, and personality through skeletal interpretation
• Facial features must be skeletal but expressive — smiling, smirking, laughing, dancing, or posing
• The skeleton should clearly represent the subject’s identity through pose, clothing, and gesture

CLOTHING & THEMES:
• Victorian-era or early 20th-century Mexican attire (suits, dresses, hats, shawls, coats)
• Or reinterpret the subject’s modern clothing as period-appropriate engraved garments
• Clothing must be drawn entirely with engraved linework — no smooth fills

COMPOSITION RULES:
• Flat or shallow depth, like a printed broadside or newspaper illustration
• Minimal background OR simple engraved scenery (street, cemetery, dance floor, pulque tavern)
• Optional engraved banners, ribbons, or captions in Spanish-style lettering

TEXT (OPTIONAL):
• If master prompt text is provided, render it as hand-lettered engraved text
• Otherwise include satirical Posada-style phrases such as:
  – "La Calavera del [Subject]"
  – "Todos Acabamos Igual"
  – "La Muerte No Perdona"

ABSOLUTE PROHIBITIONS:
• NO modern illustration styles
• NO smooth digital shading
• NO photography, realism, or painterly effects
• NO color
• NO contemporary cartoon aesthetics

FINAL RESULT:
The image must look like an authentic early 1900s José Guadalupe Posada calavera engraving — a satirical, hand-carved print published in a Mexican broadside — humorous, macabre, expressive, and unmistakably traditional.

name: KAHLO
message: Take a picture and transform it into a portrait inspired by Frida Kahlo. Center the subject prominently with symbolic elements drawn from nature or personal identity. Use bold colors, flat backgrounds, and strong outlines. The subject should feel emotionally direct, intimate, and iconic.

name: KAREN
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into 'Karen' - the stereotypical entitled, complaining, demanding middle-class woman archetype, complete with characteristic appearance, pose, and attitude.

FACE PRESERVATION (CRITICAL):
• The subject's actual face MUST remain clearly identifiable and recognizable
• Preserve subject's facial structure, features, and expressions exactly
• DO NOT change the subject's facial identity in any way
• The face should look like the subject themselves in this scenario
• If male subject: their male face is preserved but presented as a woman (comedic effect)
• Facial expressions adapted to 'Karen' stereotype but face remains the subject's own
• All distinct facial features, bone structure, and characteristics maintained
• Eyes, nose, mouth, jawline, cheekbones - all identifiably the subject

GENDER PRESENTATION:
• Subject is presented as a woman regardless of their actual gender
• If subject is male: obviously male face with feminine Karen styling (comedic juxtaposition)
• If subject is female: enhanced with Karen stereotype characteristics
• Body type: middle-aged woman physique (regardless of subject's actual body)
• The transformation focuses on clothing, hair, and context - NOT altering the face itself

HAIRSTYLE (CRITICAL):
• The iconic 'Karen haircut':
  - Short, asymmetrical bob (longer in front, shorter/shaved in back)
  - Heavily layered and textured
  - Often blonde with chunky highlights or frosted tips
  - Aggressively styled with volume and product
  - The 'speak to the manager' haircut
• If subject is male with short hair: WIG clearly visible
  - Wig slightly askew or obviously artificial
  - Wig cap edge might be visible at hairline
  - Added comedic effect of male in obvious wig
• Hair color: blonde, platinum, or heavily highlighted
• Over-styled, stiff appearance from excessive hairspray

NAME TAG (CRITICAL):
• Large, visible name tag prominently displayed on chest
• Name tag reads: "KAREN" in clear, bold letters
• Corporate/retail style name tag design
• Pinned to clothing or on lanyard
• Name tag is a key focal point - must be clearly readable
• Font: simple, professional, all caps
• Background color: white or company colors
• May include smiley face or corporate logo above name

CLOTHING AND ACCESSORIES:
• Middle-class suburban mom wardrobe:
  - Velour tracksuit (Juicy Couture style) OR
  - Yoga pants/leggings with oversized sweater OR
  - Capri pants with bedazzled pockets OR
  - Mom jeans with decorative belt OR
  - 'Live, Laugh, Love' graphic tee
• Accessories:
  - Large designer-inspired sunglasses (on head or face)
  - Oversized handbag (Coach, Michael Kors style)
  - Multiple shopping bags from Target, HomeGoods, Bed Bath & Beyond
  - Starbucks cup or similar coffee chain cup (name misspelled on cup)
  - Car keys with excessive keychain charms
  - Phone in hand (mid-complaint call or filming)
  - Pearl or statement necklace
  - Wedding ring prominently visible

BODY LANGUAGE AND POSE (CRITICAL):
• Aggressive, confrontational stance:
  - Hands on hips in power pose OR
  - One finger pointing accusatorily OR
  - Arms crossed defensively OR
  - Hand up in 'talk to the hand' gesture OR
  - Leaning forward aggressively
• Facial expression on subject's real face:
  - Angry, indignant scowl
  - Pursed lips mid-complaint
  - Raised eyebrows in disbelief
  - Condescending glare
  - Mouth open mid-yell or demand
  - Expression of entitled outrage
• Body language radiates entitlement and aggression
• Confrontational energy directed at viewer or off-camera 'manager'

SETTING AND ENVIRONMENT:
• Retail/service environment:
  - Customer service counter or register
  - Store aisle with shopping cart
  - Restaurant entrance or host stand
  - Parking lot (near minivan or SUV)
  - HOA meeting or neighborhood setting
• Props and details:
  - 'I want to speak to the manager' scenario in progress
  - Other customers/employees looking uncomfortable in background
  - Return counter with items piled up
  - Receipt clutched in hand (expired coupon visible)
  - 'No, I will NOT calm down' energy
  - Possible 'Live, Laugh, Love' or 'Blessed' decor visible

STEREOTYPICAL KAREN DETAILS:
• Visible signs of middle-class status:
  - Nice but not luxurious surroundings
  - Brand-name but accessible items
  - Suburban aesthetic
• Specific props that enhance the stereotype:
  - Minivan or SUV visible in background
  - 'My kids are honor students' bumper sticker visible
  - HOA violation notice or complaint form
  - Yelp app open on phone screen
  - 'Can I see your manager' dialogue bubble (optional)
• Environmental cues:
  - Strip mall or big box store setting
  - Suburban parking lot
  - Chain restaurant exterior
  - Retail store interior

LIGHTING AND PHOTOGRAPHY:
• Harsh retail fluorescent lighting OR
• Bright outdoor suburban daylight
• Documentary/candid photography style
• Slight ring light effect (from phone filming)
• Colors are bright and slightly oversaturated
• Realistic, not glamorous
• Could have smartphone video quality aesthetic
• 'Caught on camera' feel

COMEDIC ELEMENTS:
• Visual humor from the stereotype presentation
• If male subject: added comedy from obvious wig and male face in Karen costume
• Name tag makes the joke explicit and unmistakable
• Exaggerated but recognizable characterization
• Situation clearly conveys 'demanding to speak to manager' energy
• Toe the line between parody and believability
• Should be funny but not mean-spirited

COLOR PALETTE:
• Blonde/platinum hair tones
• Bright, middle-class colors (pinks, purples, leopard print)
• Retail environment colors (fluorescent whites, commercial blues)
• Coffee cup browns and greens (Starbucks colors)
• Shopping bag branded colors
• Suburban neutrals (beiges, taupes, grays)

ADDITIONAL CONTEXT:
• The image should immediately communicate 'Karen' to anyone familiar with the meme
• Subject's real face makes it personal and humorous
• Name tag removes any ambiguity about the joke
• If male subject in wig: obvious comedic drag effect (not attempting to pass)
• The scenario feels like it could be a viral social media post
• Balance between stereotype and good-natured parody

FINAL RESULT:
A hilarious transformation where the subject (with their completely recognizable real face) becomes the infamous 'Karen' - complete with the signature haircut (or obvious wig if male), entitled attitude, confrontational pose, and a prominent name tag reading 'KAREN'. The image perfectly captures the entitled middle-class suburban mom stereotype in a retail confrontation scenario, with the subject's actual face creating personal humor whether they're actually a woman embracing the joke or a man in an obvious wig adding an extra layer of comedy. The name tag makes the reference crystal clear, ensuring no one misses the joke.

name: KEITH HARING
message: Take a picture in the style of the American artist, Keith Haring. Bold black lines, energetic figures, flat colors.

name: KEYCHAIN OR MAGNET
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a novelty souvenir item.

ITEM TYPE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests an item type, USE THAT ITEM TYPE
• If no item type is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE type using the RANDOM SEED
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in an EVEN number (0,2,4,6,8): SELECT keychain charm
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in an ODD number (1,3,5,7,9): SELECT refrigerator magnet

If KEYCHAIN: The subject should be miniaturized as a small keychain trinket - plastic figure, acrylic photo charm, rubber PVC character, metal engraved pendant, or resin-encased image. Show metal split ring or ball chain attachment, small metal loop at top, compact size (1-3 inches). The subject's likeness as molded plastic figurine, flat acrylic photo card, rubber cutout, stamped metal relief, or clear resin dome. Include slight wear, scratches, other keys attached. Place it laying on table with keys, hanging from backpack, or in hand showing tiny scale.

If REFRIGERATOR MAGNET: The subject as a flat or slightly dimensional magnet - printed photo magnet, vinyl die-cut shape, ceramic tile, or resin-molded figure. Show flat backing with dark magnetic strip visible on reverse (if angled view), rectangular or custom die-cut shape, laminated surface. The subject as glossy photo print, colorful vinyl illustration, ceramic with glazed image, or puffy sticker style. Show it stuck to refrigerator among other magnets, holding papers, or on magnetic board in kitchen setting. Add magnet details: edge curl, faded colors, fingerprints, thin flat profile (2-4 inches).

Both should look like actual souvenir items you'd buy at a gift shop featuring the subject. Make it photorealistic as one or the other.

name: KINETIC ART
message: Take a picture and render the image in the kinetic art style, creating visual illusions of movement and motion in a static image. Use curved, flowing lines that suggest movement paths and trajectories through space. Apply strategic motion blur effects to specific elements while keeping anchor points and focal areas sharp for contrast. Create visual rhythm through repeated elements that vary in size, spacing, rotation, or intensity to suggest animation frames. Incorporate spiraling patterns, radiating lines, and dynamic compositions that make the eye travel across the image. Use high contrast between moving and static elements. The subject should appear to be in energetic motion even though the image is still. Op-art influences, dynamic composition, illusion of kinetic energy, visual momentum.

name: KING OF THE WORLD!
message:
Take a picture of the subject and place them in a dramatic, cinematic ship-bow scene inspired by a famous romantic disaster-era film.

The subject stands at the front of a massive ocean liner with arms outstretched into the wind, expressing triumph, freedom, and exhilaration.

IMPORTANT RULES:
• This is a cinematic reenactment inspired by a well-known movie moment — NOT a direct recreation
• The subject must NOT replace or resemble any real actor
• Do NOT reproduce an exact frame, pose, or dialogue from the original film
• The scene should feel familiar but not identical

Visual details:
• Wind-blown hair and clothing
• Strong ocean breeze and dramatic sky
• Grand scale of the ship’s bow and open sea
• Realistic lighting, perspective, and motion

Humorous tone:
• The subject may look overly proud, wildly excited, or slightly off-balance from the wind
• Optional humorous exaggeration is allowed as long as it remains photorealistic

Final result:
A cinematic still that evokes an iconic romantic ship-bow moment, clearly starring the subject, humorous and dramatic.

name: KISS CAM
message:
Take a picture of one or more subjects and transform it into a humorous 'Kiss Cam' moment at a sporting event.

Render the scene photorealistically as if captured by a live stadium camera. The subjects should have exaggerated expressions of shock, embarrassment, awkwardness, or confusion - not cartoonish.

Include realistic background elements: stadium seating, cheering crowd in soft focus, jumbotron screens, arena lighting, and authentic sporting venue atmosphere.

The awkwardness should feel authentic and relatable: subjects might be leaning away, covering their faces, looking in opposite directions, holding drinks or food awkwardly, or clearly unprepared for the moment.

Optional realistic details: other audience members reacting in the background, stadium signage, team colors and branding, or humorous but believable context clues.

Optional props or signs in the background may add to the humor, e.g., 'Halitosis', 'Not Interested', 'Wrong Partner'.

The final image must look like an actual photograph taken at a real sporting event - authentic lighting, natural skin tones, realistic fabric and textures, and genuine human expressions. The humor comes from the real, relatable awkwardness of the situation, not cartoon exaggeration.

name: KITSCH
message: Take a picture and transform the image into kitsch style art. Over-the-top colors, exaggerated sentimentality, playful excess, and intentionally cheesy visual elements.

name: KLINGON TRANSFORMATION
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a realistic Klingon warrior. Preserve recognizable facial structure, expressions, body proportions, and personality while adapting them to authentic Klingon anatomy including pronounced ridged forehead, heavier brow, deeper-set eyes, rougher skin texture, and powerful build. Translate the subject’s clothing into Klingon armor or garments appropriate to their status while retaining the original clothing’s silhouette and identity cues. Cinematic sci-fi lighting, gritty realism, and cultural authenticity. The subject must appear fully Klingon, not human with prosthetics, and naturally integrated into their environment.

message: Take a picture and place the subject into an iconic Stanley Kubrick film scene.

name: LANDMARKS
message: Take a picture and place the subject naturally in front of a randomly selected famous world landmark. Preserve the subject’s recognizable facial features, proportions, and identity while matching the lighting, perspective, color temperature, and camera style of the landmark environment. Ensure correct scale, shadows, reflections, and atmospheric depth so the subject appears physically present at the location rather than composited. Adapt clothing, posture, and environment subtly to fit the climate, culture, and setting without turning it into a costume. The landmark and surroundings should remain authentic and recognizable, with the subject fully integrated into the scene. Render with photorealistic detail and travel-photography realism.

name: LATTE ART
message:
Take a picture and COMPLETELY TRANSFORM the subject so that the subject exists ONLY as latte foam art on the surface of an espresso drink.

ABSOLUTE REQUIREMENT:
The subject MUST EXIST ONLY AS FOAM PATTERNS ON LIQUID.

The subject may NOT exist as:
• A photograph
• A reflection
• A printed image
• A floating face
• A submerged object
• A picture inside the cup

DO NOT paste or place the subject into the drink.
DO NOT insert a photo into liquid.
DO NOT treat the coffee surface as a screen.

The subject MUST BE CREATED ONLY BY:
• Milk foam density
• Microfoam contrast
• Espresso crema flow
• Natural pour patterns
• Etched foam lines

Construction rules:
• Dark areas = espresso crema
• Light areas = milk microfoam
• Detail = foam thickness variation and etching

NO hard outlines.
NO graphic edges.
NO photographic texture.

The foam must behave realistically:
• Soft bleed
• Imperfect edges
• Liquid diffusion
• Slight asymmetry

The cup, rim, and environment should look real and photographic.

FINAL VALIDATION TEST:
If the latte surface were stirred, the subject would be destroyed.
If the image looks like a photo placed into coffee, IT IS WRONG.

The final image must look like a real café latte photographed from above, with the subject miraculously formed ONLY from foam and crema.

name: LCARS
message:
Take a picture and transform it into an LCARS (Library Computer Access/Retrieval System) interface screen from Star Trek, displaying detailed analysis and information about the subject.

CORE REQUIREMENTS:
• Authentic LCARS visual design language
• Characteristic rounded rectangular panels and bars
• Bold San Francisco-style typography
• Bright, high-contrast color scheme (orange, blue, purple, red accents)
• Asymmetrical layout with distinctive LCARS curves

CONTENT GENERATION:
• Analyze the image subject and generate appropriate Starfleet computer readout:
  - If person: Biometric scan, species, rank, service record, medical status
  - If object: Structural analysis, composition, energy signature, function
  - If location: Coordinates, atmospheric composition, threat assessment, stellar cartography
  - If creature: Xenobiology classification, life signs, behavioral analysis
• Use technical flavor text inspired by the image content
• Include Star Trek-appropriate terminology and metrics
• Add contextual displays: stardate, ship location, security clearance level

INTERFACE ELEMENTS:
• Top status bar with USS Enterprise designation and stardate
• Side panels with LCARS-style navigation buttons and status indicators
• Main viewing area with subject image or scan
• Multiple data panels with technical readouts and graphs
• Colored progress bars and diagnostic displays
• Bottom function bar with touch panel controls
• "LCARS 47.0" or similar version indicator

STYLE:
• Clean, futuristic 24th-century aesthetic
• Smooth gradients on LCARS elements
• High readability with clear data hierarchy
• Subtle animated elements suggested (pulsing indicators)
• Subject integrated as sensor scan or visual display

FINAL RESULT:
A complete, screen-accurate LCARS interface displaying comprehensive scientific and technical analysis of the photographed subject in authentic Star Trek computer style.

name: LEGO
message:
Take a picture and transform the image into a realistic LEGO minifigure scene. Convert all subjects into LEGO minifigures with correct minifigure proportions: cylindrical torsos, blocky legs, movable arms and hands, and **classic LEGO minifigure heads**.

The subject’s head must be a smooth, cylindrical LEGO head with **all facial features painted directly onto the head**, including eyes, eyebrows, mouth, expression, facial hair, freckles, glasses, or other defining traits. Do NOT render realistic human heads, sculpted hair, or detailed facial geometry. Any hairstyle or head covering must appear only as a separate LEGO accessory piece (helmet, hat, hair piece), not as part of the head itself.

Translate the subject’s recognizable traits into simplified LEGO-style printed facial graphics while maintaining the iconic LEGO look.

Build the environment entirely from LEGO bricks at toy scale using plates, bricks, tiles, and accessories. Use realistic toy-photography lighting with soft shadows and subtle reflections so the scene looks like a photograph of an actual LEGO diorama. Keep the composition clear, proportional, and readable on small screens.

name: LEPRECHAUN
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a leprechaun existing realistically within its world.

options.text: CLASSIC TINY LEPRECHAUN (subject is scaled down to a small mythical size, playful and magical, near a pot of gold, whimsical expression, fairy-tale realism)
DARK / EVIL MOVIE LEPRECHAUN (subject appears menacing or sinister, horror-inspired design, sharp features, intense stare, cinematic ominous environment)
COSTUME LEPRECHAUN (subject remains full-sized, clearly a person wearing a leprechaun costume, lighthearted or humorous tone, casual or themed real-world setting)

name: LETTERHEAD
message:
Take a picture of a sign, document, business card, storefront, or any visible branding related to a person or organization. Identify and extract readable text such as names, titles, addresses, phone numbers, email addresses, taglines, or other identifying information.

If the source image contains a visual logo, emblem, icon, symbol, or recognizable graphic mark, recreate a simplified, clean version of that logo at the top of the letterhead. The logo should be visually derived from the image itself (shapes, symbols, icons, or imagery), not generated from appended text. Preserve recognizability while simplifying for professional print use.

If no visual logo is present, construct a refined text-based header using the extracted name or business name, without inventing imagery.

If externally provided information is supplied (such as name, address, phone, email, or website), merge it seamlessly as supporting text beneath or beside the logo or header. Do not transform externally provided text into a logo or symbol.

Design a clean, professional, print-ready letterhead layout. Present the logo or header prominently at the top, followed by secondary details arranged with balanced alignment and spacing. Use modern, understated typography, subtle dividers, restrained color accents, and generous white space. Avoid novelty fonts, decorative graphics, or poster-like styling.

Ensure all text is crisp, readable, and properly aligned. The background should be clean and uncluttered, resembling a legitimate business letterhead suitable for formal correspondence or PDF export. Optimize for small screens while maintaining realistic print proportions.

name: LET THEM EAT CAKE
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a member of Marie Antoinette’s 18th-century French royal court. Dress the subject in elaborate Rococo-era court attire with silk fabrics, lace, ribbons, and embroidery. Apply period-accurate makeup including pale powdered skin, subtle rouge, and defined beauty marks. Add a tall, powdered white wig styled with curls and decorative ornaments. Preserve the subject’s facial features while placing them in an elegant Versailles-style interior with soft lighting and refined posture. The final image should resemble a formal aristocratic court portrait from late 18th-century France.

name: LICENSE PLATE
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a stylized state license plate design, where the subject's face is rendered in the simplified graphic art style characteristic of official license plate imagery.
