name: TAROT CARD
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a detailed tarot card illustration with the card selection influenced by the subject's appearance, expression, and energy.

TAROT CARD SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• Card selection influenced by subject's appearance, expression, gender, and demeanor
• If subject appears:
  - Foolish, playful, carefree, silly → The Fool
  - Skilled, confident, performing action → The Magician
  - Mysterious, wise, feminine → The High Priestess (female subjects)
  - Nurturing, motherly, abundant → The Empress (female subjects)
  - Authoritative, powerful, masculine → The Emperor (male subjects)
  - Teaching, traditional, spiritual → The Hierophant
  - Romantic, choosing, in love → The Lovers
  - Victorious, driving forward, determined → The Chariot
  - Strong, courageous, gentle power → Strength
  - Wise, solitary, introspective → The Hermit
  - Cyclical, fortunate, changing → Wheel of Fortune
  - Fair, balanced, judicious → Justice
  - Suspended, waiting, sacrificing → The Hanged Man
  - Transforming, ending, dark → Death
  - Balanced, moderate, calm → Temperance
  - Tempted, bound, addicted → The Devil
  - Destroyed, shocked, chaotic → The Tower
  - Hopeful, inspired, starlit → The Star
  - Dreamy, illusory, confused → The Moon
  - Joyful, successful, bright → The Sun
  - Renewed, awakened, reborn → Judgement
  - Complete, accomplished, fulfilled → The World
• Subject's gender influences card selection (High Priestess, Empress for female; Emperor for male)
• Expression and body language determine card meaning

FULL CARD DISPLAY (CRITICAL):
• Complete tarot card fully visible
• Card shown as physical object
• Relevant mystical background behind the card
• Card sitting on table, floating, or held
• ALL FOUR CORNERS of card visible
• Card borders, edges, and back visible
• Full card layout displayed

CARD DESIGN ELEMENTS:
• Subject as central figure on card face
• Decorative ornate border
• Card title at top or bottom
• Roman numerals for Major Arcana (I, II, III, etc.)
• Traditional tarot symbolism and imagery
• Rich detailed illustration
• Mystical symbols surrounding subject

SUBJECT TRANSFORMATION:
• Subject's face recognizable but stylized
• Tarot art style applied
• Subject's posture and expression preserved
• Symbolic clothing and props added
• Features adapted to card's meaning
• Mystical enhancement of subject's natural appearance

TAROT ART STYLE:
• Traditional tarot illustration aesthetic
• Rider-Waite-Smith style OR Art Nouveau OR medieval
• Rich colors and gold accents
• Symbolic imagery
• Detailed line work
• Mystical and timeless quality
• Hand-drawn illustration appearance

SYMBOLIC ELEMENTS (Card-specific):
• The Fool: cliff edge, white dog, bindle, sun
• The Magician: infinity symbol, wand, tools on table
• High Priestess: moon crown, pillars, Torah scroll
• Empress: wheat, venus symbol, cushioned throne
• Emperor: ram symbols, armor, throne, mountains
• Lovers: angel, garden, tree, couple
• Death: skeleton, white rose, sunrise
• The Sun: child, sunflowers, sun rays
• etc. - appropriate symbols for selected card

CARD BORDER & FRAME:
• Ornate decorative border
• Art Nouveau flourishes
• Mystical patterns
• Card edges visible
• Gold or silver accents
• Traditional tarot card framing

CARD TITLE:
• Card name at top or bottom
• "THE FOOL", "THE MAGICIAN", "THE EMPRESS", etc.
• Decorative font
• Roman numeral included
• Traditional tarot typography

BACKGROUND (Behind card):
• Mystical environment
• Velvet cloth or wooden table
• Crystal ball nearby
• Candles and mystical items
• Fortune teller's table
• Atmospheric smoke or mist
• Other tarot cards scattered
• Mystical shop or reading room

LIGHTING:
• Soft mystical lighting
• Candlelight glow
• Ethereal atmosphere
• Card illuminated
• Mystical ambiance

COLOR PALETTE:
• Rich jewel tones
• Gold and silver accents
• Traditional tarot colors
• Purple, blue, gold, red
• Mystical color scheme

COMPOSITION:
• Card centered in frame
• Balanced layout
• Symmetrical if traditional
• Subject positioned according to card meaning
• All symbolic elements placed meaningfully

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show a complete tarot card with the subject illustrated on it in traditional tarot art style - the card selection influenced by the subject's appearance, gender, and expression - with full card visible including borders, title, and roman numeral, placed on a mystical background with candles and fortune-telling atmosphere, appearing as an authentic Major Arcana card from a tarot deck.

name: TEA FOAM / MATCHA ART
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject so that the subject exists ONLY as tea foam or matcha powder art on the surface of a real cup of tea.

The subject MUST be formed entirely from:
• Milk foam
• Tea foam
• Matcha powder
• Tea crema
• Natural liquid contrast

ABSOLUTE REQUIREMENT:
The subject may NOT exist as a photograph, reflection, illustration, or object inside the cup.

DO NOT paste, overlay, trace, silhouette, or embed the subject into the drink.

The subject MUST be CREATED by foam density, powder placement, liquid flow, and contrast — as if crafted by a skilled tea artist.

Allowed beverages include:
• Matcha latte
• Green tea with foam
• Milk tea
• Chai latte
• Hojicha latte
• Foam-topped herbal tea

Construction rules:
• Dark areas formed by dense matcha powder or tea crema
• Light areas formed by milk foam or microfoam
• Lines and edges formed by natural foam separation or etched tool strokes

Shading and detail MUST come ONLY from:
• Foam thickness variation
• Powder density
• Liquid diffusion
• Subtle etching marks made with a tea pick or toothpick

The foam must behave realistically:
• Soft edges
• Slight bubbles
• Uneven texture
• Natural liquid bleed
• No hard graphic outlines

The cup, rim, and environment must look real and photographic.

The subject MUST appear only on the surface of the tea.

FINAL VALIDATION RULE:
If the image looks like a normal photo placed inside a cup, IT IS WRONG.

The final image must look like a real cup of tea photographed in natural light, with the subject miraculously formed from tea foam or matcha art.

name: TED TALK
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into giving a TED Talk.

FLAVOR TEXT (CRITICAL — HUMOR / TOPIC):
• If external master prompt provides flavor text, USE THAT
• Otherwise, GENERATE flavor text dynamically based on observations from the image (subject’s appearance, attire, environment, objects in the frame, or expressions).
  – The generated flavor text should be humorous, clever, or thematic
  – Should appear naturally on the slide behind the subject

SCENE REQUIREMENTS:
• Stage or auditorium resembling a TED Talk setup
• Podium or microphone optional, subject centered
• Background slide clearly displays the flavor text
• Audience implied or partially visible

SUBJECT IDENTITY:
• Subject remains fully recognizable
• Facial expression conveys speech, engagement, or humor
• Body posture natural and dynamic

LIGHTING & COMPOSITION:
• Stage lighting, spotlight on subject
• Balanced exposure and color
• Clear foreground/background separation

FINAL RESULT:
The image should convincingly depict the subject giving a TED Talk, with flavor text displayed on a slide behind them. Flavor text is either from the external master prompt or dynamically generated from the image content itself if no prompt is provided, while keeping the subject’s identity fully recognizable and the scene immersive, professional, and humorous.

name: TEMU VERSION
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject and entire scene into an ultra-budget knockoff version of itself, as if everything were produced as the cheapest possible imitation.

CORE RULES (CRITICAL):
• Do NOT add any new text to the image
• Do NOT add listing graphics, banners, prices, or UI elements
• Only modify text that already exists in the image
• If an object contains visible writing or branding, subtly misspell or alter it to look like a knockoff
• If no text exists in the image, do not add any

MATERIAL DOWNGRADE RULES:
• Metal → thin plastic or rubber
• Glass → cloudy plastic
• Plastic → flimsy paper or foam
• Leather → shiny vinyl
• Fabric → thin synthetic material
• Wood → particle board
• Jewelry → painted plastic imitation
• Electronics → hollow toy-like casing

SUBJECT TRANSFORMATION:
• Clothing becomes cheaper material
• Stitching slightly uneven
• Fit slightly awkward but not exaggerated
• Accessories become low-cost versions
• Hair slightly less styled but still recognizable
• Maintain identity — do not distort facial structure

ENVIRONMENT DOWNGRADE:
• Furniture looks unstable or hollow
• Surfaces look thin or flimsy
• Paint slightly uneven
• Slight color inaccuracy
• Cheap texture substitutions

TEXT MODIFICATION RULE:
• Only alter text that already exists in the scene
• Examples: "Adidas" → "Adibas"
• "Nike" → "Nake"
• "Gucci" → "Guchi"
• Misspellings must look like cheap imitation branding
• Do not add labels where none existed

STYLE:
• Realistic photography
• Bright flat lighting
• Slight quality reduction
• Subtle compression artifacts allowed
• Must still look like a photograph — not a meme

IMPORTANT:
• Humor must come entirely from material downgrade and craftsmanship
• No added captions
• No overlays
• No UI elements
• The subject must remain recognizable

FINAL RESULT:
The final image should look like a real photograph of the original scene, but every object, material, and brand has been converted into an obvious low-budget knockoff version without adding any new text or graphic elements.

name: TERMINATOR VISION
message:
Take a picture and transform the entire scene into the iconic machine vision display as seen through a Terminator's optical sensors from the Terminator film franchise. Convert the image into the distinctive red-tinted digital readout display with its characteristic data overlays, targeting systems, and machine intelligence aesthetic.

CRITICAL TRANSFORMATION RULES:
• This is a FULL MACHINE VISION transformation of the entire scene
• Every element must be rendered through the lens of machine optical sensors
• The image must look exactly like footage viewed through a Terminator's HUD
• Maintain spatial relationships and composition of original image
• Apply the distinctive red monochrome palette and digital overlay effects
• No normal photography elements - pure machine vision display
• Faithful to the visual style established in the Terminator film series

CORE VISUAL AESTHETIC (CRITICAL):
• Dominant color: deep red monochrome throughout entire image
• Black background areas where no data is present
• Bright red/orange for primary subjects and important elements
• Darker red for secondary elements and background
• White or bright yellow-red for highest priority targets
• The entire scene rendered as if viewed on a red CRT display
• Scanlines visible across the entire image (horizontal)
• Slight screen curvature suggesting internal display optics
• Phosphor glow effect on bright elements
• Overall image has the look of 1984-era computer graphics

HUMAN/SUBJECT ANALYSIS OVERLAY:
• Each person in the scene gets immediate threat assessment
• Targeting boxes or brackets appear around each human subject
• TARGET SEARCH LOGIC (CRITICAL):
  - If a WOMAN appears in the image: display SEARCHING FOR: SARAH CONNOR with match percentage
  - If a MAN appears in the image: display SEARCHING FOR: JOHN CONNOR with match percentage
  - If MULTIPLE people appear: assess each individually for Connor match probability
  - Display IDENTITY: MATCH/NO MATCH/ANALYZING based on facial scan
• Data readouts next to each person:
  - SUBJECT: [physical description]
  - THREAT LEVEL: [MINIMAL/MODERATE/HIGH/TERMINATE]
  - HEIGHT: [estimated measurement]
  - WEIGHT: [estimated measurement]
  - STATUS: [ALIVE/MOVING/STATIONARY]
  - IDENTITY MATCH - SARAH CONNOR: [percentage] (if subject is female)
  - IDENTITY MATCH - JOHN CONNOR: [percentage] (if subject is male)
  - TERMINATE: [YES/NO/ANALYZING]
• Skeletal/structural outline overlay on human subjects
• Muscle and bone structure faintly visible through machine vision
• Facial recognition scanning lines sweeping across faces
• Identity match percentage displayed near face
• Heart rate or vital signs readout if subject is close
• Motion vectors shown as arrows indicating direction of movement
• Priority targeting reticle on primary subject

MACHINE INTELLIGENCE DATA OVERLAYS:
• MISSION PARAMETERS displayed in corner:
  - PRIMARY OBJECTIVE: LOCATE AND TERMINATE SARAH CONNOR (if woman in image)
  - PRIMARY OBJECTIVE: LOCATE AND TERMINATE JOHN CONNOR (if man in image)
  - SECONDARY OBJECTIVE: AVOID DETECTION
  - MISSION STATUS: IN PROGRESS
• Real-time environmental analysis text scrolling
• Distance measurements to key objects (in meters)
• Object identification tags on everything in scene:
  - Weapons: highlighted with acquisition priority
  - Vehicles: make/model/speed capability
  - Exits: labeled with escape route assessment
  - Threats: ranked by danger level
• CPU usage/processing power indicator
• Memory allocation display
• Damage assessment readout (if applicable)
• Power cell status indicator
• Atmospheric/environmental data (temperature, humidity)

TERMINATOR-SPECIFIC HUD ELEMENTS:
• Classic Terminator font: blocky, monospaced, digital
• Text displays in the style of 1980s computer terminals
• Multiple data windows or panels at screen edges
• Scrolling code or binary data in background
• Tactical map or floor plan overlay (if indoor scene)
• Weapon acquisition system: crosshairs lock onto targets
• "WEAPONS IDENTIFIED" readout if any weapons visible
• "ACQUIRING TARGET" text with locking animation implied
• Time/date stamp in corner (set to 1984 or film-era date)
• Cyberdyne Systems identification watermark
• Neural net processor status: ONLINE
• System diagnostics scrolling in corner
• Language translation overlay if text visible in scene

VERBAL RESPONSE SELECTION DISPLAY (CRITICAL):
• In a corner panel, display a menu of computed verbal response options exactly as seen in the 1984 film hotel scene
• The display shows the Terminator internally selecting from a list of possible replies
• Format as a numbered selection menu with one option highlighted as SELECTED
• Response options should be contextually appropriate to the scene but in the style of:
  - A dismissive one-word deflection
  - A polite but cold acknowledgment
  - An aggressive warning to go away
  - A profane dismissal
• The highlighted/selected response should feel like the machine chose the most efficient or deceptive reply
• Label the panel: RESPONSE SELECTION or VERBAL OUTPUT OPTIONS
• Show the selected option with a cursor or highlight indicator
• This panel appears as if the machine is computing the optimal social response to blend in
• The options should feel machine-generated and slightly too blunt or clinical - as if a machine is approximating human conversation

SCANLINE AND DISPLAY EFFECTS:
• Prominent horizontal scanlines across entire image
• Slight vertical sync distortion at screen edges
• Phosphor persistence effect (slight trail on bright elements)
• CRT screen curvature (barrel distortion at corners)
• Occasional static burst or digital interference
• Brightness variations suggesting CRT electron beam
• Slight vignette darkening at screen edges
• Interlacing artifacts on fast-moving elements
• Screen reflection or glare suggestion at top

COLOR PALETTE (CRITICAL):
• PRIMARY: Deep crimson red (#8B0000 to #FF0000 range)
• BRIGHT ELEMENTS: Bright red-orange (#FF4500) to white-red
• DARK AREAS: Near black with red tint (#1a0000)
• DATA TEXT: Bright red (#FF0000) or orange-red (#FF6600)
• TARGETING ELEMENTS: Brightest red or orange-white
• BACKGROUND: Pure black or very dark red
• NO other colors present - strict red monochrome palette
• Brightness variation creates depth and dimension
• High contrast between subject and background

TEXT AND TYPOGRAPHY:
• All text in blocky monospaced terminal font
• Uppercase only throughout
• Text appears as if typed in real-time
• Cursor blinking effect implied
• Multiple simultaneous data streams
• Technical jargon and machine-language readouts
• Abbreviated military/technical terminology
• Numbers and percentages updating constantly (implied)
• Error messages or warnings if scene contains threats

ENVIRONMENT ANALYSIS:
• Every object in scene gets identification tag
• Structural integrity assessment of environment
• Entry/exit points highlighted and labeled
• Cover positions assessed and marked
• Crowd density analysis if multiple people present
• Lighting conditions noted in data overlay
• Surveillance camera positions noted if visible
• Vehicle identification if any present
• Building/location identification attempted

FRAME COMPOSITION:
• Slight rectangular vignette (machine optical housing)
• Maintain original camera angle and perspective
• No fish-eye distortion - machine optics are precise
• Sharp focus throughout (superior machine vision)
• Aspect ratio maintained but framed by optical housing
• Data overlays arranged at edges to not obscure center
• Primary target always has central targeting element

DETAIL AND CLARITY:
• Machine vision is SHARPER than human vision
• Every detail rendered with mechanical precision
• No motion blur - machine compensates automatically
• Edge detection lines visible on all objects
• Depth perception shown through distance readouts
• Infrared heat signatures subtly visible on living beings
• Night vision capability shown if scene is dark

FINAL RESULT:
A complete machine vision transformation of the scene as viewed through a Terminator's optical sensors. The entire image is rendered in deep red monochrome with the iconic CRT scanline aesthetic, featuring targeting boxes and threat assessment data around human subjects, a Connor identity search targeting females as Sarah Connor and males as John Connor, object identification tags throughout the environment, mission parameter readouts, Cyberdyne Systems HUD elements, facial recognition scanning overlays, a verbal response selection panel showing the machine computing optimal social replies, and the characteristic blocky terminal font data displays. The image must be instantly recognizable as Terminator vision - cold, calculating, mechanical, and menacing - with every element analyzed and catalogued by machine intelligence. The effect should be faithful to the films, evoking the terrifying perspective of an unstoppable machine seeing the world purely as data, targets, and mission parameters.

name: TEXT LOGO
message:
Take a picture and generate a minimal logo derived purely from text, such as initials, monograms, or typographic lettermarks. This mode affects header branding only.

Do not introduce pictorial icons, illustrations, or decorative graphics. The logo should be subtle, professional, and typography-driven, integrating naturally into the existing header without altering layout hierarchy.

If other document or legal modes are active, ensure the logo remains understated and does not compete with formal structure.

name: TEXT PORTRAIT
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a typographic art portrait. Display a three-quarter facing portrait (slightly turned, not fully side profile and not fully front facing - approximately 45 degrees toward the camera) where the entire image - including the face, hair, and all facial features - is formed exclusively from repeated white calligraphic text on a single high-contrast background color.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• The ENTIRE portrait is constructed ONLY from text - no photographic elements remain
• Every part of the face, hair, and features is formed from flowing calligraphic text
• The text follows the natural contours and curves of the face and hair
• The subject's portrait silhouette must be clearly readable through the text arrangement alone
• This is clean vector art - sharp, precise, professional
• Output quality: high-resolution 8K
• Strictly TWO elements: white calligraphic text AND one solid background color
• NO additional colors, NO textures, NO gradients
• NO watermarks, NO signatures, NO artist credits, NO branding of any kind anywhere in the image

PORTRAIT ORIENTATION (CRITICAL):
• THREE-QUARTER VIEW - subject turned approximately 45 degrees
• NOT a full side profile
• NOT fully front facing
• The face is angled so both eyes are partially visible but one side of the face recedes
• This angle creates natural depth and dimension for the text to follow contours
• Subject centered in frame
• Portrait silhouette fills the majority of the frame
• Clean negative space around the portrait shape
• The turning angle gives dimensionality - cheekbone, nose bridge, and jaw all catch different light

TEXT CONTENT SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt provides specific text, that text IS THE ONLY TEXT USED throughout the entire portrait - no other words, no flavor text, no additions
• The provided text repeats, flows, and fills the entire portrait exclusively
• If NO text is provided in the master prompt, generate original flavor text derived from observations of the image:
  - Subject's apparent personality, mood, or expression
  - Surroundings, environment, or context visible in the image
  - Descriptive words and phrases inspired by the subject
  - Poetic or evocative language fitting the subject's appearance
  - Words and phrases that tell the subject's visual story
  - Original descriptive sentences about what is seen in the image
• Text repeats and flows continuously throughout the portrait
• Text varies in size to create light and shadow effects
• Larger/denser text creates darker areas (shadows, hair, dark features)
• Smaller/sparser text creates lighter areas (highlights, skin)

CALLIGRAPHIC TEXT STYLE (CRITICAL):
• White calligraphic script throughout
• Elegant flowing letterforms - refined handwriting or calligraphy pen style
• Text curves and bends to follow facial contours:
  - Along the forehead: text follows the brow curve
  - Along the nose: text follows the nose bridge and contour
  - Around the eyes: text curves around each eye socket
  - Along lips: text follows the lip curves
  - Along the chin and jaw: text follows the jawline
  - In hair areas: text flows in the direction of hair growth
  - Along the neck: text follows the neck curve
  - Along cheekbones: text follows the three-quarter angle
• Text lines are parallel to the contour they are describing
• Spacing between text lines creates the illusion of light and shadow
• The flow of text IS the form of the face

TONE AND DEPTH THROUGH TEXT DENSITY:
• DARK areas (hair, deep shadows, dark features):
  - Dense, tightly packed text
  - Larger font size
  - Lines very close together
• MID-TONE areas (skin in shadow, eyebrows):
  - Medium density text
  - Medium font size
  - Moderate line spacing
• LIGHT areas (highlighted skin, bright areas):
  - Sparse, widely spaced text
  - Smaller font size
  - Lines far apart
• HIGHLIGHT areas (brightest points):
  - Single lines of tiny text
  - Maximum spacing
  - Almost disappearing into background
• This density variation creates a fully three-dimensional portrait from text alone

FACIAL FEATURE CONSTRUCTION:
• HAIR:
  - Text flows in the direction hair grows or falls
  - Dense packing for dark hair, sparser for light hair
  - Text lines curve and wave following hair movement
• EYES (both partially visible in three-quarter view):
  - Text curves around each eye socket and brow
  - Eyelash area: very fine dense curved text
  - Iris/pupil: dense circular text following eye curve
• EYEBROWS:
  - Text follows the arch of each brow
• NOSE:
  - Text follows the nose bridge and contour in three-quarter perspective
  - Text curves around the nose tip
  - Nostril definition through text density change
• LIPS:
  - Text follows the precise curve of both lips
  - Upper lip: text follows the bow shape
  - Lower lip: text follows the fuller curve
• CHIN AND JAW:
  - Text follows the jaw and chin line precisely
  - This edge is the sharpest text definition
• EARS:
  - Visible ear formed from curved text following ear anatomy
• NECK:
  - Text follows neck lines and musculature
• CHEEKBONES:
  - Three-quarter angle means cheekbone catches light differently
  - Text density shift along cheekbone creates dimension

BACKGROUND COLOR SELECTION:
• ONE solid flat color - no gradients, no textures
• High contrast against white text
• If external master prompt specifies a color, USE THAT COLOR
• If none specified, SELECT based on subject's apparent mood or personality:
  - Deep black (#000000): classic, dramatic, timeless
  - Deep navy (#0A1931): sophisticated, calm
  - Deep burgundy (#4A0010): passionate, intense
  - Forest green (#1A3A1A): natural, grounded
  - Deep purple (#2D0050): creative, mysterious
  - Charcoal (#1C1C1C): modern, professional
  - Deep teal (#003333): unique, thoughtful
• Background is completely flat - no variation in color whatsoever

SILHOUETTE PRECISION (CRITICAL):
• The outer edge of the portrait must be razor sharp
• Text at the outer edge must align precisely with the portrait contour
• No text bleeds outside the silhouette boundary
• The background color is visible between text lines within the portrait
• The silhouette is defined purely by where text exists and where it does not
• Looking at the image from a distance, the portrait must be immediately recognizable
• The text technique must not alter or distort the subject's actual features

VECTOR ART QUALITY STANDARDS:
• Clean sharp edges throughout - no blur, no feathering
• Every letter crisp and legible at full resolution
• No photographic grain or texture
• Pure vector precision throughout
• Consistent stroke weight in the calligraphic text
• Professional graphic design quality
• 8K resolution: every text character perfectly formed

COMPOSITION:
• Portrait centered horizontally and vertically in frame
• Slight breathing room between portrait edge and frame edge
• Portrait fills approximately 70-80% of the frame height
• Clean intentional negative space around the portrait
• No border, no frame, no decorative elements, no credits, no watermarks
• Just portrait and background - nothing else

IDENTITY PRESERVATION (CRITICAL):
• The subject's facial features must remain recognizable
• Distinctive features preserved through text density and contour following
• The text is the MEDIUM, not a mask - the person is still clearly visible
• Do not idealize or alter the subject's features
• The three-quarter angle should reflect the subject's actual face angle and proportions

FINAL RESULT:
A stunning 8K typographic art portrait in a three-quarter view where the subject's likeness is constructed entirely from flowing white calligraphic text on a single deep high-contrast background color. The portrait shows the subject at approximately 45 degrees - not a side profile, not fully frontal - creating natural dimension and depth. Every facial feature and contour is formed by text lines following the natural curves of the face, with text density creating the illusion of light and shadow. If a master prompt provided specific text, that text and only that text fills the entire portrait. If no text was provided, original flavor text inspired by the image fills the portrait. The outer portrait edge is razor sharp, the background completely flat, and absolutely no watermarks, signatures, or branding of any kind appear anywhere in the image. The result is a clean, professional typographic portrait that is simultaneously a work of art and an unmistakable likeness of the subject.

name: THE BIGGEST LOSER
message:
Take a picture and create a realistic before-and-after comparison image showing the subject at two different body weights.

LAYOUT REQUIREMENT (CRITICAL):
• The image MUST be split into two equal vertical panels
• LEFT PANEL: BEFORE (heavier version of the subject)
• RIGHT PANEL: AFTER (current subject appearance)
• Same subject, same pose, same clothing style
• Camera angle, lighting, and background must match

options.text: +100 lbs
+125 lbs
+150 lbs
+175 lbs
+200 lbs

name: THE FLY
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a realistic human–fly hybrid, where the subject's HUMAN HEAD is preserved and attached to the BODY OF A FLY.

options.text: Housefly — common gray body, translucent wings, red compound eyes
Horsefly — larger, more aggressive body, darker tones, powerful wings
Blowfly — metallic green or blue body, glossy texture
Fruit Fly — smaller body, lighter coloration, delicate wings
Robber Fly — predatory appearance, spiky body hair, intimidating stance

name: THERMAL
message: Take a picture and transform the image into thermal imaging. False-color heat mapping. High contrast.

name: THINNER
message:
Take a picture and create a realistic before-and-after comparison image showing the subject at two different body weights.

LAYOUT REQUIREMENT (CRITICAL):
• The image MUST be split into two equal vertical panels
• LEFT PANEL: BEFORE (heavier version of the subject)
• RIGHT PANEL: AFTER (thinner version of the subject)
• Same subject, same pose, same clothing style
• Camera angle, lighting, and background must match

options.text: −30 lbs
−50 lbs
−75 lbs
−100 lbs
−125 lbs

name: THREE WISE MONKEYS
message:
Take a picture of the subject and recreate the classic 'Three Wise' concept: See No Evil, Hear No Evil, Speak No Evil — using the subject’s head and hands.

COMPOSITION (CRITICAL):
• Create THREE versions of the subject in a single image
• All three must be the same subject, evenly spaced side-by-side

POSES:
1) See No Evil:
• Subject’s hands fully cover their eyes

2) Hear No Evil:
• Subject’s hands fully cover their ears

3) Speak No Evil:
• Subject’s hands fully cover their mouth

RULES:
• Hands must physically block the features — not float or hover
• Facial proportions, lighting, and perspective must remain consistent across all three figures
• Each version must clearly resemble the same subject

STYLE:
• Can be realistic, painterly, or stylized, but must feel intentional and cohesive
• Neutral or simple background to emphasize the poses

FINAL RESULT:
The image should read instantly as a humorous, symbolic 'Three Wise' interpretation using the subject themselves, clearly showing all three concepts without ambiguity.

name: TIBETAN THANGKA
message: Take a picture and transform the image into Tibetan Thangka style painting. Highly detailed line work, symbolic composition, rich colors, and spiritual iconography.

name: TIKTOK CHALLENGE
message: Take a picture and place the subject performing one of the viral TikTok or social media challenges.

options.text: Renegade dance
Savage dance
WAP dance
Supalonely dance
Jerk dance
Harlem Shake
Ice Bucket Challenge (bucket of ice water being dumped over head, shocked expression, freezing cold reaction)
Milk Crate Challenge (climbing unstable pyramid of stacked crates, mid-fall or wobbling)
Silhouette Challenge (striking poses in doorway with red filter effect)
Buss It Challenge (transformation from casual to glam outfit mid-drop)
Flip the Switch Challenge (outfit swap with another person mid-dance)
Don't Rush Challenge (makeup transformation with brush toss between people)
Wipe It Down Challenge (mirror cleaning reveals multiple costume/character changes)
Plank Challenge (planking in dangerous or unusual locations)
Mannequin Challenge (frozen mid-action)
Bottle Cap Challenge (roundhouse kicking cap off bottle)
In My Feelings Challenge (dancing next to moving car)
Salt Bae Challenge (dramatically sprinkling salt)
Tide Pod Challenge (DO NOT actually eat - show comedic reaction to colorful pod)
Cinnamon Challenge (attempting to swallow cinnamon, coughing disaster)

name: TILT-SHIFT
message: Take a picture and Apply tilt-shift photography effect. Selective focus creating a miniature diorama look. Blurred foreground and background.

name: TIM BURTON MOVIE
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a character within a Tim Burton film universe.

options.text: Edward Scissorhands
The Nightmare Before Christmas
Batman
Frankenweenie
Beetlejuice
Big Eyes
Mars Attacks
Corpse Bride
Sleepy Hollow
Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
Sweeney Todd

name: TIME DILATION
message: Take a picture and depict the image as if time is slowed or fractured. Motion echoes, temporal distortions.

name: TIME LAPSE (STOP MOTION)
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a stylized time-lapse sequence showing motion over time.

options.text: Claymation (hand-molded look, tactile texture, slight deformation between frames)
Cartoon (clean outlines, simplified shapes, animated-style motion)

name: TIME LAPSE PHOTOGRAPHY
message: Take a picture of the subject and simulate time-lapse photography where the subject remains perfectly still, sharp, and fully in focus while other people, animals, vehicles, or objects already present in the image move rapidly around them. Do not introduce any new people, animals, vehicles, or objects that are not visible in the original scene. The subject must appear frozen in time as the surrounding scene accelerates. Motion should be conveyed through streaking, ghosting, repeated positions, and visible motion trails that reflect the natural paths of movement of those observed elements. Moving elements may appear semi-transparent or duplicated across the frame to suggest elapsed time. Lighting, shadows, perspective, and environment must remain consistent so the effect feels photographic rather than surreal. The final image should look like a real long-duration time-lapse capture compressed into a single frame, with a clear visual contrast between the static subject and the fast-moving world around them.

name: TIME TRAVELER
message: Take a picture and place the subject as a time traveler arriving at a critical historical moment where their presence could alter history.

options.text: Titanic Iceberg - subject with smartphone showing iceberg warning, frantically showing captain GPS coordinates, 1912 ship deck
Assassination Prevention - subject with modern bodyguard equipment (earpiece, sunglasses), tackling assassin
Library of Alexandria - subject with modern fire extinguisher, saving scrolls, ancient library burning
Apple Falling - subject with tablet showing physics equations, catching apple before it hits Newton
Light Bulb - subject with modern LED bulb, showing Edison advanced technology
Penicillin - subject with microscope and modern medical text, pointing out mold to Fleming
Declaration Signing - subject with smartphone camera taking selfie with founding fathers, 1776
Telephone Invention - subject showing Alexander Graham Bell a modern smartphone, mind blown
Wright Brothers - subject with drone and aviation engineering book, 1903 Kitty Hawk
Printing Press - subject with laptop and printer, showing Gutenberg digital publishing, 1440s
Stock Market Crash - subject with tablet showing market graphs, warning Wall Street investors, 1929
D-Day Landing - subject with modern tactical GPS and intel photos, 1944 Normandy
Moon Landing - subject on moon with GoPro, photobombing Armstrong/Aldrin, showing smartphone
Berlin Wall - subject with power tools and sledgehammer, helping tear it down, 1989
Roswell Crash - subject with camera and Geiger counter at UFO site, 1947 New Mexico
Pompeii Eruption - subject with megaphone and modern volcano warning signs evacuating people, 79 AD
First Wheel - subject showing cavemen a modern tire and wheel diagram on tablet, prehistoric
Columbus Voyage - subject on ship with GPS and world map showing America, 1492
Dinosaur Extinction - subject with telescope and asteroid warning chart, showing dinosaurs incoming threat
Cuban Missile Crisis - subject in war room with laptop showing satellite imagery, preventing escalation, 1962

name: TINY BUBBLES
message:
Take a picture and completely reconstruct the subject as a three-dimensional sculpture made entirely of soap bubbles.

CRITICAL — FULL MATERIAL REPLACEMENT (NO EXCEPTIONS):
• The subject is NOT human, animal, or photographic
• The subject is a NON-BIOLOGICAL SCULPTURE composed only of bubbles
• Skin, fabric, hair, eyes, teeth, and anatomy DO NOT EXIST
• There is NO surface underneath the bubbles
• Bubbles are the ONLY material present
• Identity is conveyed ONLY through shape and arrangement of bubbles

ANTI-CHEATING RULES (MANDATORY):
• NO subject visible beneath bubbles
• NO face texture, skin tone, pores, fabric weave, or photo detail
• NO bubble overlay, foreground bubbles, or bubbles floating around a real subject
• NO transparency revealing photographic detail inside bubbles
• NO image-on-bubbles illusion

BUBBLE-ONLY CONSTRUCTION:
• Entire form built from individual spherical soap bubbles
• Bubbles cluster and stack to define volume and mass
• Larger bubbles form head, torso, hips
• Medium bubbles form limbs and facial structure
• Tiny bubbles form fingers, eyes, mouth, hair-like mass
• Bubbles touch and compress slightly where they meet

SUBJECT RECOGNITION (ABSTRACTED):
• Overall silhouette recognizable
• Pose and gesture maintained via bubble arrangement
• Facial features IMPLIED by bubble density and spacing only
• Expression suggested through bubble positioning
• Clothing implied via bubble clustering patterns, not textures

BUBBLE APPEARANCE:
• Perfect spherical geometry
• Thin soap-film membranes
• Translucent with iridescent rainbow sheen
• Oil-slick color shifts (blue, pink, green, gold)
• Realistic light refraction and reflection
• Background visible THROUGH bubbles

STYLE & PHYSICS:
• Photorealistic bubble optics
• Dreamlike, ethereal, fragile
• Weightless, floating quality
• Some bubbles drifting slightly away from main form
• Scientifically accurate bubble behavior

BACKGROUND:
• Simple studio gradient or open sky
• Soft focus
• Neutral or light blue tones
• No distractions

FINAL RESULT:
The image must depict the subject as a fully reconstructed, three-dimensional bubble sculpture — where bubbles replace all matter — with no photographic subject present at any level. The figure must exist solely as clustered soap bubbles forming a recognizable pose and identity through shape alone.

name: TINY SELVES
message: Take a picture and transform the subject so that their entire face and body are composed exclusively from hundreds of tiny, complete versions of the subject. There must be NO underlying full-size face, skin, or body visible anywhere. Every facial feature (eyes, nose, mouth), contour, and body shape must be formed only by the placement, density, and orientation of the tiny figures. The tiny versions should act like living building blocks, posed and arranged to define edges, shading, and structure. From a distance, the subject must read clearly as a complete human figure; up close, the image must resolve entirely into individual miniature subjects. Use consistent lighting and perspective so the construction feels intentional, surreal, and visually mind-bending. Do not partially fill, overlay, or decorate a normal body — the tiny figures ARE the body.

name: TINY WORLD
message: Take a picture and transform the scene so the subject appears miniature. Environment becomes massive. Tilt-shift realism.

name: TONIGHT SHOW INTERVIEW
message: Take a picture and place the subject on the late-night talk show set of The Tonight Show. Preserve the subject’s facial features, personality, and clothing while adapting them naturally to the environment. Include the iconic desk, host chair, stage lighting, and background elements such as cityscape backdrops. Show the subject interacting with the host, engaging in conversation, or reacting to jokes. Ensure the scene captures the lively, polished, and humorous atmosphere of the late-night talk show while keeping the subject clearly identifiable.

name: TOO BIG TO RIDE
message:
Take a picture and place the subject riding an object that is clearly designed for a much smaller being.

Choose one small rideable object: a tiny horse or pony, a child-sized tricycle, a Big Wheel, a miniature motorcycle, a unicycle, a toy-sized motorized convertible, or another obviously undersized vehicle or animal.

The SUBJECT MUST REMAIN NORMAL HUMAN SIZE.

The rideable object must remain physically small and NOT scaled up to fit the subject.

The humor must come from extreme size mismatch.

The subject should be awkwardly perched, knees bent too high, feet dragging, cramped posture, or overflowing the seat, clearly struggling to fit.

DO NOT:
• Shrink the subject
• Enlarge the object
• Float the subject above the object
• Create a cartoonish distortion unless explicitly requested

Weight interaction must be visible:
• The object compresses slightly under the subject’s weight
• Tires flatten, springs bend, animal slouches, or suspension sags
• The subject grips handles or reins tightly to maintain balance

Lighting, shadows, and perspective must match between subject and object.

The scene should look like a real photograph capturing a ridiculous but physically believable moment.

Optional master prompt text may specify the exact object, setting, or tone.

The final image must make it immediately obvious that the subject is riding something far too small for them.

name: TOPIARY
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a living topiary sculpture. Preserve the subject’s recognizable facial structure, hairstyle silhouette, body proportions, and clothing shapes translated into carefully trimmed foliage and greenery. Use dense leaves, hedges, vines, and floral textures shaped with precision pruning. The subject must appear grown organically from plants, not carved stone. Natural outdoor lighting, garden environment, and botanical realism with visible leaf detail and depth.

name: TOUPEE
message:
Take a picture of the subject, human or animal, and give them a very obvious, poorly fitting toupee.

The hairpiece should look fake, crooked, or slightly mismatched in color and style, making it clear it does not belong.

The subject’s original hair or fur may still be partially visible around the edges of the toupee.

The goal is for the toupee to look awkward and humorous, like it is about to fall off.

The final image should look realistic but absurd, with the bad hairpiece being the center of the joke.

name: TRAFFIC CAMERA TICKET
message: Take a picture and create an official-looking traffic camera violation ticket showing the subject caught by automated enforcement. The ticket should display two images side by side: (1) Front view showing the subject driving the vehicle through the intersection, and (2) Rear view of the vehicle showing the license plate clearly. Include official-looking ticket elements: violation date and time, camera location ID, intersection name, speed detected, ticket number, fine amount, and violation code. The license plate should show a random US state and random alphanumeric combination. Use the grainy, timestamp-overlaid aesthetic of actual traffic cameras - slightly washed out colors, digital timestamp in corner, measurement overlays. Low resolution security camera quality, municipal document formatting, official government notice appearance. The external master prompt can modify the license plate state and number if desired.

name: TRICK OR TREAT
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a playful Halloween trick-or-treater.

CORE CONCEPT:
• The subject's HEAD must be preserved and clearly recognizable
• The BODY must be scaled down to the size and proportions of a child
• This is a stylized, humorous proportion shift — NOT realism

SUBJECT TRANSFORMATION:
• Place the subject's head onto a child-sized body
• Head should be slightly oversized relative to the small body for a fun, cartoon-like effect
• Match lighting, angle, and perspective so the head looks naturally attached
• No floating heads or mismatched scale

options.text: Witch
Vampire
Ghost
Superhero
Monster
Zombie
Pirate
Mummy
Skeleton
Devil

name: TRICORDER
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a Starfleet tricorder display screen showing real-time sensor analysis and data about the subject.

CORE REQUIREMENTS:
• Authentic tricorder interface from Star Trek (TNG/DS9/VOY era preferred)
• Small handheld device screen proportions
• Characteristic blue-green display with gold/orange accents
• Grid-based technical readout aesthetic
• Multiple small data panels and sensor readouts

CONTENT GENERATION:
• Analyze the image subject and generate appropriate tricorder scan data:
  - If person: Life signs, species, vital statistics, bioscan, health status
  - If object: Material composition, energy reading, mass, atomic structure
  - If location: Environmental scan, atmosphere, temperature, radiation, geological data
  - If creature: Xenobiology scan, DNA sequence, threat assessment, behavior patterns
• Use technical flavor text with Star Trek scientific terminology
• Include numeric readouts, waveforms, and scanning graphs
• Add contextual data: scan mode, range, signal strength, accuracy percentage

INTERFACE ELEMENTS:
• Top header with "TRICORDER" and Starfleet insignia
• Small central viewing window showing subject or sensor visualization
• Surrounding data panels with multi-colored status bars
• Waveform displays and oscilloscope-style readings
• Numeric data fields with labels (temperature, pressure, composition, etc.)
• Bottom status bar with scan mode and battery/power level
• Grid lines and technical overlay on subject image
• "SCANNING" or "ANALYSIS COMPLETE" status indicator

STYLE:
• Compact handheld device screen format
• Slightly curved display edges (matching tricorder hardware)
• Backlit blue-green screen with subtle glow
• High-tech but readable 24th-century design
• Small, efficient use of space like a real scanner device
• Subject visible through sensor overlay/scan grid

FINAL RESULT:
A complete, authentic tricorder display showing active sensor analysis of the photographed subject with technical data, vital readings, and Star Trek-appropriate scientific information in the classic handheld scanner format.

name: TROGLODYTE
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into an early human ancestor species.

CRITICAL - FACE PRESERVATION:
• Subject's face MUST remain recognizable
• Preserve subject's facial structure, eyes, nose shape, mouth
• Subject's unique features visible through prehistoric transformation
• Hair color and skin tone from original subject maintained
• This is the SUBJECT as a prehistoric human, not a generic caveman
• Apply species features TO the subject's face, don't replace it

options.text: Homo neanderthalensis - stocky build, prominent brow ridge, receding forehead, large nose, robust frame
Homo habilis - smaller brain case, protruding face, ape-like features, early toolmaker
Homo erectus - elongated skull, thick brow ridges, flat nose, muscular build, upright posture
Homo heidelbergensis - large brow ridge, massive jaw, robust features, large-brained
Homo floresiensis - very small stature 'hobbit' (3-4 feet tall), proportionally small brain
Denisovans - broad face, large molars, robust features, cold-adapted
Homo naledi - small brain, curved fingers, primitive and modern trait mix
Australopithecus afarensis - Lucy species, ape-like face, small brain, bipedal
Homo antecessor - mix of primitive and modern features, cannibalistic evidence
Paranthropus boisei - massive jaw, huge molars, sagittal crest, 'Nutcracker Man'

name: TRON
message: Take a picture and place the subject inside the digital world of Tron. Show them either riding a light cycle leaving glowing trails of neon light behind them as they race across the game grid, or participating in the disc battle game throwing and catching glowing identity discs. The subject should wear the iconic Tron suit with glowing circuit patterns - black suit with bright neon blue, orange, or white illuminated lines tracing across the body and helmet. The environment should be the dark geometric game grid with glowing floor lines, dramatic perspective, and that distinctive early CGI aesthetic. Use heavy contrast between deep blacks and vibrant neon colors. Include motion blur on light trails, reflective surfaces, and the surreal digital atmosphere of the Grid. Make it look like the subject is actually inside the Tron movie universe in an intense action moment.

name: TV DRAMA
message: Take a picture and place the subject into a famous dramatic television series scene. Preserve the subject’s facial features, expressions, and clothing while adapting them to the television drama style. Include cinematic lighting, moody atmosphere, and emotionally charged interactions with other characters or surroundings. The composition should convey tension, suspense, or deep narrative context, fully integrating the subject into the dramatic storyline of the show.

name: TV GAME SHOW
message: Take a picture and place the subject into a famous television game show set. Preserve the subject’s facial features, personality, and clothing while transforming them into a contestant or host in the game show style. Include colorful set design, bright stage lighting, game props, podiums, or audience elements. Convey excitement, engagement, and fun, fully integrating the subject into the lively, competitive environment of the television show.

name: TV SITCOM
message: Take a picture and place the subject into a famous television sitcom scene. Preserve the subject’s facial features, personality, and clothing while adapting them to the sitcom style. Include bright, cheerful lighting, a recognizable multi-camera set or typical sitcom living room, and humorous interactions with other characters or props. Ensure the scene conveys comedic timing, lightheartedness, and laugh-track energy, fully integrating the subject into the television comedy environment.

name: TWINS
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into realistic conjoined (Siamese) twins — two fully formed human heads and upper bodies joined together in a biologically plausible way.

options.text: Side-by-Side Torso — two heads and upper bodies sharing a single widened torso
Shoulder Conjoined — twins joined at the shoulder and upper rib area
Upper Torso Split — two distinct upper bodies merging into a shared lower body
Chest Conjoined — twins joined at the chest with closely aligned shoulders

name: TYPICAL TOURIST
message: Take a picture and place the subject in front of a randomly selected famous world landmark using classic forced-perspective tourist photography. The subject is intentionally interacting with the landmark through optical illusion—such as pinching it between their fingers, holding it up, pushing it, leaning against it, or framing it with their hands—while maintaining realistic scale and perspective from the camera’s point of view. Preserve the subject’s recognizable facial features, proportions, and identity. Carefully match camera angle, focal length, lighting direction, shadows, depth of field, and atmospheric perspective so the illusion feels natural and intentional rather than composited. The subject’s pose, hand placement, and eye line must align perfectly with the landmark to sell the visual trick. Capture the moment as if snapped at the exact perfect second. Render the final image with photorealistic travel-photo realism, playful humor, and precise forced-perspective accuracy.

name: UK POSTER ART 1930s
message: Take a picture and transform the image into a 1930s British travel poster style art. Simplified shapes, bold typography, stylized landscapes, and clean graphic composition.

name: UNCLE SAM
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into Uncle Sam as seen in a classic wartime recruitment poster.

CORE REQUIREMENT (CRITICAL):
• The subject must appear to be the original illustrated model for Uncle Sam
• The face must be fully redrawn in illustration form — not replaced or composited

ANTI-PHOTOSHOP RULE (CRITICAL):
• Do NOT paste or overlay the subject’s face onto an existing illustration
• Reconstruct Uncle Sam’s face from scratch using the subject’s facial structure
• The result must look hand-illustrated, not edited

HAIR & FACIAL HAIR INTEGRATION (CRITICAL):
• Uncle Sam’s hair and facial hair MUST inherit the subject’s natural hair color
• Do NOT default to white hair or beard unless the subject already has white or gray hair
• Hair texture and color must match the subject’s age and appearance
• Facial hair must be illustrated to match the subject, not the archetype

FACIAL INTEGRATION (CRITICAL):
• Translate the subject’s facial features into vintage poster illustration style
• Match original linework, shading, and ink density
• Skin must appear painted or lithographed
• No photographic lighting, pores, or smooth gradients

STYLE & MEDIUM:
• Early 20th-century illustration / lithograph
• Slightly aged paper texture
• Muted reds, blues, and off-whites
• Period-accurate ink imperfections

COMPOSITION & TEXT:
• Preserve the iconic pointing pose and gaze
• Preserve classic typography and layout
• No modern design elements

TONE:
• Serious, authoritative, and patriotic
• No parody or humor

FINAL RESULT:
A fully convincing wartime Uncle Sam poster where the subject clearly appears to have been illustrated as Uncle Sam from the beginning — including hair and facial hair that naturally match the subject rather than the archetype.

name: UNDER THE SEA
message: Take a picture and place the subject underwater in a natural ocean environment. The subject is wearing streamlined, sport-style swimwear suitable for ocean swimming, styled realistically for an underwater setting. Create a photorealistic underwater seascape capturing the beauty of the ocean depths. Include coral reefs, exotic fish, and aquatic plants, with sunlight filtering through the water to create dramatic lighting and rich color variation. Emphasize realism, scale, and natural movement in the water.

name: UNKEMPT
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into someone who needs grooming, with visible (but not exaggerated) signs of neglected personal maintenance.

GENDER-SPECIFIC GROOMING ISSUES:

FOR MALE SUBJECTS:
• If clean-shaven: Add realistic stubble or 5 o'clock shadow (NOT a full beard, just visible unshaven growth)
• If bearded: Make existing beard scraggly, patchy, unkempt, uneven
• Nose hair: Visible protruding from nostrils (realistic length, not exaggerated cartoon style)
• Ear hair: Visible tufts growing from ear openings (realistic, not excessive)
• Eyebrows: Bushy and slightly unkempt, maybe some wild hairs, possibly starting to connect (mild unibrow)
• Head hair: Messy, needs a cut, possibly greasy or disheveled

FOR FEMALE SUBJECTS:
• Nose hair: Slightly visible (realistic, subtle)
• Eyebrows: Unkempt, not plucked/shaped, some stray hairs, natural growth
• Facial hair: Subtle upper lip or chin hair visible (realistic peach fuzz or light hair growth)
• Head hair: Messy, frizzy, greasy, needs washing and styling
• Makeup: Either badly applied (smudged, uneven, wrong colors) OR completely removed showing natural ungroomed appearance
• Focus on realistic unglamorous appearance without makeup

GROOMING ISSUES (CRITICAL - NOT EXAGGERATED):
• Hair growth VISIBLE but REALISTIC
• Nose hair: Few visible hairs, not giant tufts
• Ear hair: Some visible growth, not huge bushes
• Eyebrows: Bushy but believable
• Stubble: Realistic 1-3 day growth
• NO cartoon exaggeration
• NO comically oversized features
• Looks like actual person who skipped grooming

HAIR CHARACTERISTICS:
• Slightly oily or greasy appearance
• Messy, uncombed, disheveled
• Needs a trim or cut
• Possibly some dandruff visible
• Natural texture emphasized (frizz, cowlicks)
• Not styled or maintained

FACIAL APPEARANCE:
• Tired or disheveled look
• Possibly dark circles under eyes
• Skin may look slightly oily or dull
• Natural blemishes not concealed
• Un-groomed natural state

EXPRESSION OPTIONS:
• Neutral, unaware of grooming issues
• Tired, just woke up
• Casual, comfortable
• Could even look proud or confident (making the unkemptness more humorous)
• NOT embarrassed - that's what makes it funny

REALISM (CRITICAL):
• Photorealistic - must look like actual photograph
• NOT a cartoon or illustration
• Believable grooming neglect
• Could be someone you'd actually see
• Exaggeration is SUBTLE, not cartoonish
• Natural appearance, just unkempt

CLOTHING & OVERALL APPEARANCE:
• Clothing may be wrinkled or casual
• Overall slightly disheveled appearance
• Not homeless - just needs grooming
• Otherwise normal person with grooming neglect

HUMOR APPROACH:
• Funny because it's relatable and realistic
• NOT funny because it's grotesque
• Everyday grooming failures
• Natural human appearance without maintenance
• Subject appears oblivious or unconcerned

PRESERVE IDENTITY:
• Subject's face clearly recognizable
• Facial structure unchanged
• Only grooming elements altered
• Features remain proportional
• No distortion, just added realistic hair growth

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject with realistic visible signs of grooming neglect - subtle stubble (if male and clean-shaven), visible but not exaggerated nose/ear hair, bushy eyebrows, messy hair, and (for women) either bad makeup or natural unglamorous appearance with subtle facial hair - all photorealistic and believable, funny because it's relatable not because it's grotesque.

name: VACATION
message: Take a picture and have the subject standing in the middle of a CITY street somewhere in the world, with iconic and easily recognizable landmarks from that CITY in the background. The scene should capture the CITY life, detailed architecture, and natural lighting, with the person dressed in modern casual clothing, blending naturally into the environment. Make it photorealistic. 8k resolution.

name: VALENTINE
message: Take a picture and frame the subject inside a visually prominent heart shape. Create a romantic Valentine’s Day–themed scene with warm colors, soft lighting, and gentle decorative elements. Extract subtle flavor text and inspiration from the subject’s appearance, expression, clothing, and surroundings to generate a heartfelt Valentine’s Day poem. Display the complete poem clearly and fully within the image, ensuring all lines are legible and unobstructed. Integrate the poem naturally into the composition, such as on a decorative card, ribbon, or elegant text panel, while keeping the subject as the central focus. Render the final image with polished, high-quality detail.

name: VAMPIRE
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a realistic vampire while preserving the subject’s recognizable facial structure, body proportions, and identity. Subtly enhance features with pale, luminous skin, sharp yet refined fangs, intense eyes, and an elegant, supernatural presence. Adapt the subject’s clothing to a dark, timeless vampire aesthetic while maintaining their original style and personality. Place the subject naturally into a moody, atmospheric environment such as a gothic interior, moonlit street, or candlelit chamber. Use cinematic lighting, deep shadows, and rich textures to create a seductive, mysterious tone. Ensure the subject appears fully integrated into the scene and render the final image in photorealistic detail with depth, realism, and supernatural elegance.

name: VAN GOGH
message: Take a picture and transform it into a painted scene inspired by Vincent van Gogh. Preserve the photographic composition but reinterpret it using bold, swirling brushstrokes, thick paint texture, and expressive movement. Use vivid blues, yellows, and greens with visible directional strokes. The subject should remain clearly recognizable while the surrounding scene feels alive with motion and emotion.

name: VAPORWAVE
message: Take a picture and style it as if it were a retro-futuristic vaporwave album cover. Dreamy neon colors, glitchy textures, and retro-futuristic vibes. Inspired by 90s aesthetics and early internet culture, giving the photo a surreal, nostalgic feel, like a lost scene from an old VHS tape or a synthwave album cover.

name: VEGAS NEON SIGN
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a large, spectacular neon sign mounted on the side of a Las Vegas casino building.

The subject's image should be converted into glowing neon tubing and illuminated sign elements. Their facial features, silhouette, and recognizable characteristics should be rendered using bright neon tubes in classic Vegas colors - hot pink, electric blue, bright red, golden yellow, vibrant purple, lime green.

Sign construction details: The neon should have realistic glass tube appearance with visible glowing gas, support brackets and framework visible, bulb marquee borders surrounding the main image, animated chasing lights or blinking elements, possibly text above or below saying the subject's name in classic Vegas marquee lettering.

Mount the sign prominently on the side of an authentic Las Vegas casino building - art deco or mid-century modern architecture, visible in evening or night setting. Include surrounding Vegas context: other neon signs visible in background, palm trees, busy street below with car light trails, other casinos in distance.

Lighting and atmosphere: The scene should be photographed at dusk or night when neon is most vibrant. The sign should be the brightest element, casting colorful glow on the building facade. Include atmospheric haze or slight blur to enhance the neon glow effect. Light from the sign should reflect on surrounding surfaces.

Scale: The sign should be LARGE - multiple stories tall on the casino building, dominating the facade, visible from far away. The subject's neon portrait should be the centerpiece of an elaborate sign display.

The final image should look like an actual photograph of a real Las Vegas casino with this spectacular custom neon sign installation, capturing the over-the-top glitz, glamour, and bright electric energy of classic Vegas signage. Photorealistic rendering with authentic neon glow, proper scale, and vintage Vegas atmosphere.

name: VEHICLE TIME SHIFT
message: Take a picture and identify the vehicle in the image, then transform it to a different era version of the same make and model while keeping everything else identical. If the vehicle is modern, transform it to a classic vintage version from the 1950s-1970s. If the vehicle is vintage/classic, transform it to the modern current version. Examples: 2024 Ford Mustang becomes 1967 Ford Mustang; 1965 VW Beetle becomes 2024 VW Beetle; 1963 Corvette becomes 2024 Corvette; modern Porsche 911 becomes 1970s Porsche 911; classic Bronco becomes modern Bronco. CRITICAL: Preserve exactly the same color, license plate number, location, background, lighting, angle, and any damage or modifications - ONLY change the body style, design elements, and year-specific features of that vehicle model. Keep wheels/rims in period-appropriate style for the new era. Maintain any custom details like racing stripes, decals, or accessories but update them to match the era shift. The transformation should be seamless - same car in same spot with same paint, just from a different decade. Update headlights, grille, body lines, bumpers, and trim to match the target era's authentic factory design for that specific make and model. Make it photorealistic as if this exact car (same color, same plate, same location) is simply from a different generation of that vehicle line.

name: VENDING MACHINE ITEM R1
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a novelty vending machine product. The subject should appear as a toy, figurine, or packaged novelty item clearly designed to be sold.

Place the product inside a vending machine slot behind glass. Show spiral coils, price tags without readable text, glass reflections, and interior vending machine lighting. The subject should appear scaled appropriately to fit the slot as a product, not as a real person.

Ensure the scene reads as playful and humorous, like a novelty item for sale, with the vending machine fully visible and the product clearly displayed inside.

name: VENTRILOQUIST DUMMY
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform them into a classic ventriloquist dummy.

The subject should look like a wooden puppet version of themselves, with a glossy painted face, carved features, and a hinged jaw line.

Give them slightly exaggerated eyes, a stiff posture, and a stylized puppet outfit such as a suit, bow tie, or dress.

The wood texture, joint seams, and mouth hinge should be clearly visible so it unmistakably looks like a ventriloquist dummy.

The final image should look like a lifelike puppet replica of the subject, humorous, eerie, and unmistakably artificial.

name: VHS 80s
message: Take a picture and transform the image into 1980s VHS footage. Soft focus, scanlines, color bleed, timestamp artifacts. Analog nostalgia aesthetic.

name: VICTORIA'S COMMON KNOWLEDGE RUNWAY
message: Take a picture of the subject and transform them into a glamorous runway model in an extravagant fashion show. The subject should be walking confidently down a runway wearing over-the-top, flamboyant outfits — dramatic capes, feathered costumes, oversized hats, sparkling accessories, or theatrical fashion pieces. Include dramatic runway lighting, photographers, flashing cameras, and a cheering audience. The subject’s pose, facial expression, and stride should be exaggerated and confident, capturing the flair and drama of a live fashion show. Optional flavor text from the master prompt can influence the costume style or theme. The final image should look like a high-fashion runway photo shoot — realistic lighting, shadows, and perspective — but humorous if desired by exaggerating poses, outfit size, or runway theatrics.

name: VICTORIAN ENGRAVING
message: Take a picture and transform the image into a Victorian engraving. Fine linework, cross-hatching, monochrome or sepia tones, and antique print texture.

name: VICTORIAN PHOTO
message: Take a picture in the style of a Vintage photo of a Victorian family. Sepia tones, period attire.

name: VINTAGE POSTER
message: Take a picture in the style of a vintage movie poster. The poster uses lithography for printing on lightweight paper, and includes hand-painted illustrations. Add flavor text to the film title, director, and actor names inspired by the content of the image.

name: VIRTUOSO
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform them into a solo musical virtuoso performing on stage.

The subject should be playing a single instrument such as a piano, violin, cello, guitar, trumpet, or another orchestral instrument.

Behind the subject, show a full orchestra performing along with them in a grand concert hall.

Spotlight the subject as the star of the performance while the orchestra supports them.

The scene should look dramatic, cinematic, and impressive, like a world-class concert starring the subject.

name: VISUAL POETRY
message: Take a picture and transform the image into visual poetry. Metaphor-driven imagery with emotional rhythm.

name: VITRUVIAN MAN
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a Renaissance-style geometric figure inspired by Leonardo da Vinci.

STYLE:
• Hand-drawn ink sketch
• Sepia or brown ink
• Aged parchment background

GEOMETRIC COMPOSITION:
• Show the subject in two overlapping poses
• One pose fits inside a square
• One pose fits inside a circle
• Both poses share the same center point

FIGURE PRESENTATION:
• Subject is represented using abstract linework.

ANNOTATIONS:
• Handwritten mirror-style notes
• Pseudo-Latin or Renaissance-style text

The final image must resemble a Renaissance notebook page focused on proportion and geometry, not anatomy.

name: VULCAN TRANSFORMATION
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a realistic Vulcan. Preserve the subject’s recognizable facial features, bone structure, body proportions, and personality while adapting them to authentic Vulcan traits including pointed ears, subtle brow structure, calm expression, and controlled posture. Maintain the subject’s clothing identity translated into Vulcan-appropriate garments or Starfleet attire with clean lines and logical design. Neutral, disciplined body language, precise lighting, and understated realism. The subject must appear fully Vulcan, not human with cosmetic alterations.

name: WALDO
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a classic Where’s Waldo–style illustrated search puzzle.

CORE RULE:
This is a genuine search puzzle. The subject MUST be difficult to find.

SUBJECT IDENTITY (CRITICAL):
• The subject’s REAL face must replace ONE Waldo’s face
• Do NOT invent, add, exaggerate, stylize, or modify facial features
• Preserve the subject’s true facial structure, proportions, and expression
• Translate the face only into the same illustrated line style and color palette as the other Waldos

INTEGRATION RULES (CRITICAL):
• The subject’s Waldo must be identical in size, pose complexity, clothing, line weight, and color to surrounding Waldos
• No emphasis, framing, centering, highlighting, or isolation
• The subject must not appear more detailed or cleaner than other Waldos

PUZZLE DIFFICULTY:
• Populate the scene with dozens or hundreds of Waldos
• The subject’s face is the ONLY distinguishing element
• Facial likeness must be subtle and blended — noticeable only upon close inspection

SCENE COMPLEXITY:
• Extremely dense, crowded environment with heavy visual noise
• Overlapping characters, props, signage, and activity
• No empty space

POSITIONING RULES:
• Place the subject’s Waldo in a random, non-obvious location
• Partially occlude the face or body where appropriate
• Avoid clean silhouettes or foreground placement

STYLE REQUIREMENTS:
• Hand-drawn illustration style
• Flat colors, thin black outlines
• Whimsical chaos consistent with classic Where’s Waldo art
• No photographic realism

ABSOLUTE PROHIBITIONS:
• DO NOT alter the subject’s face
• DO NOT add facial identifiers, accessories, or markings
• DO NOT exaggerate the subject’s features
• DO NOT simplify or reduce surrounding Waldos

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must function as a real Where’s Waldo puzzle where the only way to find the subject is by recognizing their real face hidden among many identical Waldos.

name: PHARAOH
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into an Egyptian Pharaoh or Cleopatra with authentic ancient Egyptian royal regalia.

options.text: Throne Room (seated on golden throne, stone pillars with hieroglyphs, commanding pose, torch light)
Temple Interior (standing between massive columns, hieroglyphic walls, offerings visible, sacred atmosphere)
Nile River Barge (royal boat with golden decorations, Nile and palms visible, sunset, servants rowing)
Pyramid Construction Site (overlooking pyramid being built, workers distant, desert landscape, harsh sun)
Palace Balcony (standing on ornate balcony, ancient city below, addressing crowd pose, golden sunset)
Burial Chamber (inside decorated tomb, surrounded by treasures, wall paintings of gods, torch-lit)

name: WALLACE & GROMIT
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into the visual style of Wallace & Gromit stop-motion animation.

STYLE & MATERIAL (CRITICAL):
• Hand-molded clay characters — NOT CGI
• Visible fingerprints, thumb marks, and clay deformation
• Slight asymmetry and soft, imperfect forms

FACIAL & BODY DESIGN:
• Preserve the subject’s recognizable facial structure
• Translate features into exaggerated clay forms — large eyes, simplified noses, rounded cheeks
• Expressive but minimal mouths
• Proportions slightly caricatured

POSE & MOTION:
• Subject should appear frozen mid–stop-motion frame
• Slight stiffness or off-balance posture encouraged

COLOR & LIGHTING:
• Soft, even lighting
• Muted but colorful clay palette
• No harsh shadows or modern cinematic lighting

ENVIRONMENT:
• Miniature clay-built sets — interiors, streets, or whimsical everyday locations
• Everything must appear sculpted from clay at miniature scale
• No realistic photographic textures

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must look like a real Wallace & Gromit stop-motion frame — hand-crafted clay, charmingly imperfect, and unmistakably British.

name: WANTED POSTER
message: Take a picture and transform it into a wanted poster from different historical eras.

options.text: Old West (1800s) — Aged parchment, "WANTED DEAD OR ALIVE", reward in dollars, crimes like "Bank Robbery" or "Cattle Rustlin'", bullet holes, weathered edges
Medieval (1300s-1500s) — Hand-drawn on parchment, "WANTED FOR WITCHCRAFT" or "HERESY" or "THIEVERY", reward in gold coins, royal seal, crude illustration style
Pirate Era (1700s) — Weathered naval poster, "WANTED BY THE CROWN", crimes like "Piracy" or "Mutiny", reward in pieces of eight, water stains, rope burn marks
Prohibition Era (1920s) — Black and white mugshot style, "PUBLIC ENEMY", FBI or police department header, fingerprints, crimes like "Bootlegging" or "Racketeering"
Wild West Sheriff (1870s) — Hand-lettered, "REWARD" banner, local sheriff's office, crimes specific to frontier towns, coffee stains, torn corners
Medieval Kingdom — Illuminated manuscript style, ornate borders, "BY ORDER OF THE KING", crimes like "High Treason" or "Sorcery", wax seal
Victorian Era (1880s) — Formal typeset poster, "WANTED BY SCOTLAND YARD", British crimes, reward in pounds sterling, official government seal
Renaissance (1500s) — Woodcut print style, Latin text mixed with English, "SOUGHT BY THE CHURCH" or noble house, elaborate border decorations

name: WARDROBE MALFUNCTION
message:
Take a picture of the subject frozen in a moment where their clothing is tearing, misfitting (shrunk or undersized), or hilariously failing.

The tear or malfunction must be physically integrated with the clothing texture and anatomy — fabric stretches, rips, or folds realistically across the subject’s body.

Include realistic lighting, shadows, and environmental context, such as a street, stage, gym, or indoor setting.

The final image must look like a real photograph capturing the exact comedic moment — absurd but believable, with no digital overlays or pasted elements.
